loans.name: Safarbi

texts.ru: Сафарби проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 58 лет. Вдова, имеет 6 детей. Двое ее сыновей находятся в Российской Федерации на заработках. Сама Сафарби занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. В основном она откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа дойной коровы и двух голов бычков.
texts.en: Safarbi lives in the Hamadoni District. 58 years of age. A widow, with six children. Two of her sons are migrant workers in the Russian Federation. Safarbi raises livestock. She keeps cattle by her home. Her main business activity is fattening cattle for sale. She has been doing this for 20 years. She is taking out a loan to buy a milk cow and two bulls.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow and two bulls

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is a married woman with 2 children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past 3 years, Agatha has operated a clothing sales business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. Her greatest monthly expense is the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of opening another business in the future. Agatha plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Wilber Alfredo

texts.es: Wilber Alfredo, de veintiséis años de edad, soltero, vive en casa de su mamá, la señora Carmen y Don Ruben compañero de vida de su madre. Wilber posee un local dentro del mercado regional del lugar en que vive y ahí vende zapatos para todas las edades, géneros y gustos. Ya son mas de tres años los que lleva de comercializar dicho producto y el negocio va para adelante sin detenerse, cuenta muy feliz Wilber. Con los ingresos que percibe Wilber ayuda a su mamá con los gastos de la casa y también se encuentra ahorrando porque desea continuar estudiando en la Universidad, es por esto su esmero en reinvertir a su negocio a través del crédito que INTEGRAL le otorgue, para comprar nuevos estilos de zapatos para mujeres, porque es la clientela que mas demanda este producto y poder incrementar sus ventas y en consecuencia sus ganancias y así tener el dinero necesario para iniciar sus estudios y continuar ayudando a la economía en su hogar
texts.en:
Wilber Alfredo is 26 years old, single, and lives in the house of his mom (Carmen) and her life partner (Ruben). 

Wilber has premises in the regional market where he lives.  There he sells shoes for all ages, styles and tastes.  He has been selling shoes for more than three years and a very happy Wilber tells us that his business is moving forward without stopping.  With the income that he makes, Wilber helps his mom with the household expenses.  He is also saving up because he would like to continue studying at university.  This is why he will take care to re-invest in his business through the loan he receives from INTEGRAL.  He will buy new styles of ladies' shoes because these are the customers who most request his products.  This will enable him to increase his sales, and thereby his profits, so that he will have the money he needs to start his studies and continue financially supporting his household.

loans.use: to buy new styles of ladies' shoes

loans.name: Rose Natacha

texts.fr:
Cliente de 31 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 17 mois et 7 ans. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille , elle ouvre une boucherie en 2006 ou elle vend des vivres frais comme les cartons de poule a boullir et cuisse de poulets, cartons de queue de bœuf, cartons de poissons.
Elle a des ventes de 10.000frs a 25.000frs par jour.

A l'octroi de son prêt elle va renforcer son stock en achetant 2 cartons de queue de bœuf,2 cartons de viande, 5 carton de cuisse de poulet,2 cartons de ailes de poulet, et 3 cartons de poissons comme la sardine,les harengs et capitaines.

Sa stratégie est d'avoir du courant en permanence et palier au difficulté de transport pour faire  ses achats.
Tres populaire dans le quartier, elle veut a la longue avoir une chambre froide pour faire la vente en gros.
texts.en:
This borrower is a 31-year-old married woman with three children ranging in age from 17 months to 7 years old. To support her family, she opened a butcher shop in 2006 where she sells fresh food such chicken for boiling and chicken legs, oxtails, and fish. Her sales average 10,000 to 25,000F per day.

She will use the new loan to increase her stock by purchasing two cartons of oxtails, two cartons of meat, five cartons of chicken legs, two cartons of chicken wings, and three cartons of fish such as sardines, herrings and capitaines (Nile perch).

As a business strategy, she plans to have the electricity running permanently and solve the transportation issues she faces when making purchases. 

She is very popular in the neighborhood, and wants to someday have a cold storage room and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy cartons of meat, chicken for boiling, chicken legs, tripe, oxtails, etc.

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
Desde pequeño, Gustavo Adolfo aprendió al lado de sus familiares y vecinos los oficios propios del campo debido a su procedencia campesina. A sus 30 años de edad y con el propósito de generar sus propios ingresos decidió darle vida a su propio negocio, una cría de cerdos, que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Gustavo necesita de un préstamo para iniciar con su negocio y empezar así a generar ingresos que le permitan obtener un capital de trabajo para crecer poco a poco así como obtener ganancias.
texts.en:
From a young age, Gustavo Adolfo learned to do farm work from his family and neighbours because of his farming heritage. At the age of 30, with the desire to generate his own income, he decided to give life to his own business: raising hogs. This will allow him to improve his quality of life.

Gustavo needs a loan to start his own business and start generating an income which will allow him to obtain working capital to grow bit by bit and make an income.

loans.use: to purchase hogs for raising.

loans.name: Neida Isabel

texts.es:
Neida de 59 años tiene en su barrio Los Olivos un taller de confecciones, actividad creativa que inició desde el año 1986 con una máquina de coser doméstica que le había regalado su madre.  Su infraestructura actual la componen: su maquina de coser industrial, mesas y estanteria. Neida ofrece productos en sus líneas femeninas, masculina e infantil,  sus clientes son amas de casa, empleadas, estudiantes y en general todo al que ella le confecciona por primera vez, le queda giustando y regresa porque trabaja con mucha precisión, sus ventas las realiza de contado y tambien a crédito en plazós cortos pactados con su clientela. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará materias primas e insumos,  para fabricar ropa encargada en las líneas femeninas, masculinas e infantil y esto es lo que hará de su inversión todo un éxito, porque conoce muy bien su mercado y la hará sobre solicitudes de este. Ella tiene una hija de 30 años, con la que sueña siempre verla felíz y exitosa. Su meta es tener un local propio para adecuarlo y con un surtido especializado de ropa casual para impactar su mercado. 
Su mayor desafío es ampliar la infraestructura física de su taller, pues en la actualidad  se encuentra en una habitación de su casa. Mientras trabaja para lograr sus sueños se esmera en mantener una rentabilidad no menor del 40%, una rotación de inventarios de 26 días y de sus cuentas por cobrar de 35 dias.
texts.en:
Neida is 59 years old. She has a clothes making workshop in her neighborhood of Los Olivos. She began this creative endeavor in 1986 with a household sewing machine that her mother gave her. Her current infrastructure consists of: her industrial sewing machine, tables, and a bookcase. Neida offers different product lines including a women’s line, a men’s line and a children’s line. 

Her customers are housewives, employees and students. In general, first time customers always like everything she makes and return because she works with precision. She makes both cash sales and short term credit sales with her customers. 

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it she will purchase basic materials and supplies to complete clothing orders in women’s, men’s and children’s lines. This will make her investment a success because she knows the market very well and will make clothing with this, on request.

She has a daughter who is 30 years old whom she hopes will always be happy and successful. Her goal is to have her own storefront that she can adapt and supply with casual clothing so as to impact the market. Her biggest challenge is expanding the physical infrastructure of her workshop. It is currently located in a room in her house. While she works toward her dreams, she has taken care to maintain a profit margin of no less than 40%, a 26 day inventory turnover time and a 35 day accounts receivable schedule.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and basic materials to make clothes for her feminine, masculine, and children's clothing lines

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 26-year-old hardworking man living in a rented house in Karuguuza, Uganda. 

For four years he has been running a grocery shop and from it he has been able to pay school fees for his children. 

He faces a challenge of inflation but hopes to expand his business to a wholesale status. 

Julius needs a loan to buy soap, sugar and cooking oil for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Sardaran's Group

texts.en:
Sardaran is married and has five children. Three of her children are studying and her eldest son is a daily wage laborer. Her husband is also a daily wage laborer. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her animal sales business. She has been doing this business for many years and has maintained a good clientele base. She buys animals from the animal market and sells to the butchers at a profit. With the loan, she will purchase goats in good numbers and increase her sales. She is very confident that her business will improve further after the loan investment.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sardaran.

loans.use: To buy more goats

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a hardworking business man.  He is married and blessed with three children.  For the last five years, he has been practicing dairy farming to support his family.  He has been able to improve his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya hence raising his living standard.  In the next five years, he wants to increase the number of cows on his farm.  He is requesting for a loan of 35,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a  dairy cow.

loans.name: Umoja Ni Nguvu 2 Group

texts.fr:
Evariste est un commerçante âgé de 45ans qui habite au quartier Bwiza de la Mairie de Bujumbura.Il fait le commerce des chaussures depuis 3ans. Il a fait ses études jusqu’en 5e année primaire.Il est marie a Adele et ont ensemble 4 enfants dont 3 étudient. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 250,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital en achetant beaucoup de souliers à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« UMOJA NI NGUVU 2».
texts.en:
Evariste is a 45-year-old merchant who lives in the district of Bwiza, in the city of Bujumbura. He is a member of the UMOJA NI NGUVU 2 community group.

Evariste is married to Adele and they have four children together, three of whom go to school. He himself attended five years of primary school. 

Evariste started selling shoes three years ago. A loan of 250,000 Burundian francs will allow him to increase his working capital. He will stock up on shoes for resale in order to earn substantial profits.

loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy lots of shoes for resale

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 60 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 
Nelia has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase more goods such as soap, detergent, grains, soft drinks, etc. to sell
Nelia has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her grandchildren to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as soap, detergent, grains, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Maritza; La socia tiene 31 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad, la socia se dedica  a la atención de venta de jugos de frutas, ella tiene su stand en el mercado principal y la socia prepara ricos jugos de frutas frescas todos los días en las mañanas y por las tardes, la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de fruta y de mercadería para la juguería como vasos y otros utensilios que desea comprar para mejorar su calidad de atención. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de utensilios como vasos, y de frutas frescas para implementar su negocio.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Maritza belongs to the "Las Emprendedoras de Andahuaylillas" communal bank, located in Andahuaylillas district in the province and department of Cusco.  She is 31, and lives with her partner. She has two children, ages eight and two. 

She sells fruit juices, and has her stand in the main market.  She prepares delicious fruit juices every day in the mornings and afternoons. 

She wishes to use her loan to buy fruit and other items she needs for the juice stand, such as glasses and kitchen utensils, in order to improve the quality of her service.  She is applying for the loan to buy glasses, kitchen utensils, and fresh fruit for her business. 

She is grateful for the loan, and promises to pay her instalments in accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils, glasses and fresh fruit for her business.

loans.name: Shake

texts.ru:
Шаке 33 года , родилась ,выросла  и живет в любимом  городе Капан.Она окончила Капанскую среднюю школу.                В 1997 году вышла замуж и живет с мужем.Имеет трех сыновей – по 13, 10 лет а младшему из них 2 годика.
Шаке  с 2007года  занимается частным предпринимательством  и имеет свой продовольственный магазин в родном городе Капан, где она продает конфеты, сладости, молочные и мясные изделия,масло, соки, хлебо-булочные продукты и тд. Бизнес у Шаке семейный - во всем ей помогает муж, который  закупает продукты для магазина  в оптовых рынках в Капане а так-же привозит из Еревана . Шаке уже имеет постоянных клиентов в городе, которые уже многие годы предпочитают сделать свои покупки из магазина Шаке.  Не смотря на то что у Шаке нет высшего экономического образования ,она хорошо знает толк в бизнесе и сама справляется с бухгалтерскими и другими учетами связанныими с магазином.Шаке с мужем работают почти без выходных и по этому с воспитанием детей им помогают их родители .
Шаке нужен кредит 900.000 армянских драмов для покупки  новых продуктов для Новогодней  и Рождественской продажи.
texts.en: Shake is 33 years old.  She was born, raised and still lives in her beloved town of Kapan.  She graduated from the Kapan secondary school.  Shake got married in 1997, lives with her husband and their three sons, who are 13, 10 and 2 years old.  Since 2007, Shake has been involved in private enterprise and has her own food market in her native town of Kapan.  She sells candy, sweets, dairy and meat products, oil, juice, bakery goods, etc. there.  This is a family business, and her husband helps her with everything.  He buys products for the store at wholesale markets in Kapan and also in Yerevan.  Shake already has loyal customers in town, who have preferred to make their purchases from Shake's store for many years.  Despite the fact that she does not have a higher economics education, she understands business well and handles accounting and other financial matters relating to the store.  Shake and her husband work almost without days off, and this is why their parents assist with raising their children.  Shake needs a loan in the sum of 900 000 Armenian dram to buy new products for the New Year's and Christmas sales.

loans.use: to buy a new products for the New Year's and Christmas sales

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 45-year-old married woman with five children, all in school. She has had a business selling food items in Yei, South Sudan for five years. Esther requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase fish and beans for sale.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsetseg, 52, is a druggist, a profession that she practiced between 1980 and 1997. Now she works as a social worker in a public organization. She was widowed many years ago and now lives with her two children in the ger district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. A ger is the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.
 
Altantsesteg has been thinking about her profession for the last several years. Her current income does not enable her to meet her family's regular expenses. Her two children both attend secondary school, and there are always sudden expenses related to her children. Once she said that one of her biggest wishes is to get the best education for her two children. 

Due to her financial circumstances, she decided to start a pharmacy business in order to increase her earnings. She needs about 2,800,000 MNT initially to build working capital for her new business. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing drugs from certified suppliers for starting her pharmacy business.

loans.use: To purchase drugs for starting her pharmacy business.

loans.name: Bulicho A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bulicho A Group in Western Kenya! Zipporah is the facilitator of the Bulicho A group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Zipporah takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Zipporah had a very good maize yield, harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Zipporah was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Zipporah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Zipporah will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Bulicho A group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Zipporah with her group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Bessy Margoth

texts.es:
Bessy Margoth, de 26 años de edad, casada desde hace 6 años , tiene un hijo de 4 años, vive en la aldea Pedregal de Potrerillos Cortes.
Bessy es una persona muy activa y trabajadora sobre todo responsable, quien tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa nueva, como ser jeans, camisas, faldas, vestidos, ropa de niño, ademas calzado y ropa interior, sus ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y por encargo. Siempre le ha gustado esta actividad y ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Este es su primer préstamo para surtir de ropa nueva como jeans, camisas, vestidos, ropa interior y ropa de niños en esta temporada navideña.
Su meta es que con las ganancias va ahorrar para hacerle mejoras a su vivienda y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Bessy Margoth, age 26, has been married for six years.  She has a four year old child, and she lives in the village of Pedregal de Potrerillos, Cortes.

Bessy is a very active, hard-working, and above all, responsible person.  She has her own business selling new clothes like jeans, shirts, skirts, dresses, children’s clothes, shoes, and underwear.  She makes her sales in an itinerant manner and by order.  She has always liked this business activity and helping with the household expenses.

This is her first loan to stock up on new clothes like jeans, shirts, dresses, underwear, and children’s clothes for this Christmas season.

Her goal is to save her earnings to make improvements to her house and to have a betty quality of life.

loans.use: to buy new clothes like jeans, shirts, dresses, underwear, and children's clothes to cover her orders.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a responsible and loving mother to her only child. Her husband's name is Aristotle. She established a business selling soap, shampoo, colognes, and laundry and bath soap to the people in her neighborhood. With this kind of business, she earns about PHP 40,000 each month. She utilized the income to pay the allowance and tuition fee of her child. Other parts of her income were used for daily meals and electric bills.

She would like to stock more items to sell but she has insufficient capital so she is asking for PHP 50,000 to buy colognes, bath soap, and laundry soap to sell to the people in their neighborhood. She would like to increase her income so that she saves for future expenses for the college education of her child.

With her continuous operation of the business, she hopes to further diversify it to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy colognes, bath soap, and laundry soap to sell to the people in her neighborhood

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es: Paquita, de 54 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación, además de ser amable y alegre. Vive en compañía de su hija, su nieto y su pareja en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza es la pesca, para eso cuenta con un bote pesquero pequeño, asimismo posee de redes y tranqueras. Dicha actividad lo ejerce en el lago de Yarinacocha, lugar donde se adentra buscando los mejores ejemplares marinos, para luego venderlo en los mercados de la localidad. Para ello cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja y 02 ayudantes a quienes paga hasta 200 nuevos soles por una buena pesca. Por otro lado, su esposo es quien se encarga de venderlo al por mayor a lo mercados de la zona. Lleva realizando más de 40 años y hasta el momento continua con su trabajo porque le gusta, además que es su fuente de ingreso económico. Comenta que gracias a éste oficio a logrado tener un vida cómoda y tranquila. Ahora tiene planes de incursionar en el negocio del transporte fluvial de pasajeros, por lo que planea construir un bote especial para ésta actividad. Este será el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal ya que los considera personas amables y responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la construcción de un bote para el transporte fluvial de pasajeros.
texts.en:
Paquita, age 54, is a hardworking woman who has tremendous desire to succeed. In addition, she is a friendly and cheerful person. She lives in her own home along with her daughter, her grandson, and her partner. Paquita is in the fishing business and owns a small fishing boat equipped with nets and traps. She conducts her business on the lake in Yarinacocha, where the best fishing in the area takes place. Paquita sells her products at the local markets. She has the help of her partner and two assistants who are paid up to 200 PEN for a good catch. Her husband is also in charge of conducting wholesale transactions to the regional markets. Paquita has been in this line of work for more than 40 years and continues to this day because she enjoys it. In addition, it provides a source of income. She says that thanks to her work, she has been able to live a comfortable and peaceful life. Now she has plans to integrate a river transport venture as part of her business, so Paquita wants to build a special boat for this purpose.

This will be her 10th loan with the MFP organization. She is appreciative of the financial support she will receive to advance her business. In addition, Paquita gets along well with her Communal Bank because she considers the members to be friendly and responsible people. The amount of 2000 PEN that she requested will be invested in the construction a boat for transporting passengers across the lake.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a boat that will be used for transporting passengers.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 32 years old and married. She lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. 

Helen owns and operates a business venture selling ice cream in the local community to earn a living and she's been 10 years in this business. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business. 

In 2010, Helen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Helen wants to expand her ice cream business.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Ayuen

texts.en:
Ayuen lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, marriage, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Ayuen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans,sugar for sale.

loans.name: Lisseth Giovanna

texts.es:
Lisseth es una mujer de 30 años, es soltera,  vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus Padres y su hermana menor, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora  entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Lisseth no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero gracias a su esfuerzo pudo estudiar una pequeña carrera técnica de corte y confección, la cual le ha servido de mucho. 
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace dos años Lisseth trabaja en su pequeño negocio de confección y costura de ropa, adicionalmente también trabaja vendiendo pollos, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana  y puede hacerlo por  un aproximado de 8 horas, ella cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Lisseth se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una pequeña maquina remalladora semi industrial; de esta manera Lisseth podrá realizar todo tipo de costuras, con ello espera poder aumentar sus servicios e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que poco a poco pueda ir logrando su sueño de terminar la construcción de su casa y espera poder seguir ayudando a su hermana menor para que se convierta en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Lisseth is 30, single, and lives in the city of Pisco with her parents and younger sister, whom she loves and are her principal reason for living. She is likable, hardworking, and enthusiastic and wants to get ahead. Sadly, Lisseth couldn´t study for a career, but thanks to hard work, she was able to complete a technical course in cutting and sewing that has been a great help. 

On her own initiative and with dedication and effort, Lisseth works at her sewing business every day for up to 8 hours starting early in the morning. She also sells chickens and feels her businesses are a success because she is dedicated and treats her customers well.

Lisseth thanks the Kiva lenders whose support will allow her to buy a small, commercial overlock sewing machine that can be used for all kinds of stitching. She expects that this investment will increase her business and income. She will be able to slowly achieve her goals to finish her house and continue helping her younger sister so that she can have a professional career.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Dios Nos Ayude Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Josefa que vende ropa nueva ambulante en un mercado populoso de la capital desde hace 20 años tiene tres hijos de dominio es madre soltera y el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa nueva y variada, Dora vende ropa, zapatos, celulares por encargo y Sandra vende cosméticos de la Avon.
texts.en: This group is made up of three entrepreneurs.  Josefa sells new clothing on foot in a popular market in the capital and has been doing so for 20 years.  She has three children and is a single mother and will use the money from this loan to buy new clothing.  Dora sells clothing, shoes, and cell phones on order.  Sandra sells Avon cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Nim's Group

texts.en: Nim’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Nim makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Raquel Karina

texts.es: Raquel tiene 21 años de edad, es una jovencita con mucha ilusión de salir adelante en la vida y lo está haciendo de la mejor manera, para lograrlo esta estudiando cursos libres que le ayudan a adquirir más conocimientos a parte de su carrera universitaria que finalizo no hace mucho la cual es Marketing y Publicidad, ahora el paso a seguir de Raquel es ingresar al curso de titulación para poder obtener su titulo como Licenciada motivo por el que solicita el apoyo de crédito, tiene como respaldo económico el apoyo incondicional de su madre  quien con muchas dificultades la ha llevado hasta este peldaño.

loans.use: Raquel solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera, gracias a este financiamiento  esta joven podrá graduarse como Lic. en Marketing y Publicidad.

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en: Z. is Married with Nine Children she started her business in 1989. She will receive an equivalent of $147 as her first loan in order to organize her business well.. With the second loan of $375 from PEMCI, she has used to boost her stock in order to improve her income and service to her local community.

loans.use: To stock her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cow and build a shed for his dairy business

loans.name: Shadab

texts.en: Shadab lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is the boy who has to support his family because his father is dead. He is the youngest of his family and he is the one that is working. He has a catering shop and he wants to make a good business. He wants to take a individual loan to buy glasses, plates, a tent and extra materials for catering. He rents all these things for rent for people who have wedding parties. He wants to expand his business and make a better life for his family. He is very happy that he can help his family with this loan.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia is a single woman with 3 children. The oldest is 14 years old, and he is in junior high. The 2 youngest are in elementary school. One is 10 years old and the other one is 6 years old. She was let go from the company she used to work for, and since she had bills to pay as well as the schooling for her children, she started a home business about 8 years ago. She has made some adjustments to her carport, where she has her grocery store, and with the money she received from her company she began buying main staples and other groceries to sell. Her oldest son helps her whenever he has free time. Little by little her business has grown as well as her clientele.

Antonia is requesting a loan in the amount of $650 USD to purchase more inventory so that she can offer a greater variety of merchandise to her clients and to provide better customer service. She commits to repay the loan within 5 months. Antonia and her family thank you for your support and for helping them move ahead in life!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonia es una mujer soltera con tres hijos, el mayor de ellos tiene 14 años y se encuentra estudiando en la escuela su secundaria, los dos menores ambos están en primaria con 10 y 6 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio por que la despidieron de la empresa en la que trabajaba y tenía cubrir los gastos de la casa y de la escuela de los niños, fue así que ya desde hace ocho años atrás ella acondicionó la cochera de su casa y con el poco dinero que le dieron en su liquidación compró abarrotes de mayor demanda para comenzar con su negocio, su hijo mayor la ayuda en el negocio en sus ratos libres. Poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo y ha seguido incrementando el surtido de su tienda para ofrecer mejores y más productos a sus clientes.

Antonia está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 650 para comprar mercadería y así continuar surtiendo su negocio y darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes que son los que también le solicitan de mayores productos que ofrecer, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Antonia y su familia están muy agradecidos por el apoyo que le brindas para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Kifayet

texts.en: Kifayet is a low income resident from Gahramanli village in the Beylagan district of Azerbaijan. She is a widow and the only breadwinner of the family. She has been in the cattle rearing business for several years. She has 2 cows and is applying for a $300 loan to buy a calf so as to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Faleupolu

texts.en: Faleupolu is married with three kids, all of whom are in school. When she heard of this program, she joined and applied for $300USD and used the loan to start her fast foods stall business. At the moment, she supplies  lunch for one of the offices in town in addition to other people she delivers her food to. If there is any left she sometimes delivers to the school. She earns $130ST net profit per day and works five days per week. She is now very comfortable raising her family and providing her kids with school financial support. She hopes to stay long in the program.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her fast food stall

loans.name: Mimin

texts.en: Mimin is 29 years old and has a 10 year old child. She has a small grocery store in which she sells snacks, rice and household goods. She can earn up to US $10 per day. Her husband, D., is employed in the silk-screening business and usually earns US $10 per week.  Sometimes, he helps his wife at the store. Mimin is requesting a IDR 900,000 loan to stock her store with more inventory.  She is willing to repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: to fill her store with more inventory

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei recently started a business selling cleaning supplies at a market in Kahovka, Ukraine after he was unable to make enough as a farmer to support his wife and young daughter. He’s only been in business for about 4 months but would like to be the best in the market. Sergei currently has around $1000 worth of inventory on hand and makes around $200 in profit per month. 

Sergei is requesting a loan of $500 to help purchase new inventory to sell. We are happy for this opportunity to help him at this critical time in his business and look forward to seeing where his venture will take him in the future.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Riffat's Group

texts.en:
My group members’ perseverance and desire to succeed in life are the reasons which compel them to improve their existing businesses. I am their group leader because all of them feel that I have leadership qualities. All of us reside in Multan, a city in Pakistan famous for its handicrafts.

I embroider clothes, while my husband is a painter, and he paints buildings and houses on order. I have five kids: three girls and two boys. Three of my kids are under 15, while the others are older. I am requesting a loan for my own business and for the others. Below is a small description of my group members’ businesses.

Suriya B. plans to use her share of the loan in her family’s cotton business. Nadia B.’s husband manufactures bolt-nuts used in machines. Amna B. sells fabric and wants to buy a suitable quantity of merchandise.

This is a group loan and we are mutually responsible for each other's loans.

loans.use: Improve embroidery business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 22-year-old young man. He lives and works in Borj El Barajneh where he owns a mobile phone store.

This is the first time he has asked for a loan from Al Majmoua. Mohamad is planning to buy new merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise for his mobile phone store.

loans.name: Khaduji

texts.en:
Khaduji is a 22 year old single woman. Khaduji conduct some small business, starting in 2005. She works from 6am to 6pm everyday at her business and earns about $70 a month from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more comodities for her business.

loans.use: To buy more comodities for her business.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is thirty three years old. She sells fresh water fish called tilapia. Tilapia can be found in almost all Ghanaian homes with delight as it has low cholesterol and is tasty in Ghanaian dishes. Adjoa travels to the Volta Lake (the largest man-made lake in the world) to buy her products.

She wants to use her loan to buy more tilapia to increase her stock and also to avoid price hikes. Adjoa is a member of the group Animonyam (meaning "Glory"). Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tilapia fish

loans.name: Leoi

texts.en: Leoi S., 32, is married with 2 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the taro plantation business, and she sells to the village people and public 3 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (approximately 250 USD).  SPBD loans are Leoi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to pay for her children's schooling. Her husband farms to support the family.

loans.use: To maintain business improvement

loans.name: Targul

texts.en: Targul (her husband is pictured) is a mother of three children. She was born in 1969 and lives in Khachmaz town. This family sells blankets. Five years ago they started this business. Now they need a loan of $1200 US to buy blankets for improving their business.

loans.use: To buy blankets

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Every weekend night, Natividad sells food outside of her home. On her own, she offers tradition dishes to neighbors, who request the meals in advance. She has also sold cosmetics for the past 10 years, and her clients are her friends and neighbors. The loans that she has previously received have been used to buy the ingredients for her meals and to pay for the cosmetics she keeps in stock. Natividad also has plans to sell clothing to her friends via order.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Todos los fines de semana por la noche, Natividad vende comida afuera de su casa. Asimismo, ofrece platos típicos a sus vecinos, quienes le solicitan con anterioridad. Ella también vende cosméticos desde hace 10 años. Sus clientes son sus amigos y vecinos. Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para los ingredientes de los platos que ofrece y para pagar los cosméticos que tiene en stock. Natividad tiene planes de vender ropa por pedidos a sus amistades.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make the meals she sells and buy the cosmetics she keeps in stock / Para comprar los ingredientes de los platos que ofrece y para pagar los cosméticos que tiene en stock en su casa.

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.ru:
Хатамов Мухамад 1982 года рождения. Молодой предприниматель четыре года как занимается продажей мужской одеждой. Местом его деятельности является рынок «Шохмансур» города Душанбе. В его ассортименте большой выбор мужских летних и демисезонных футболок и накидок из хлопчатобумажных и маячных материалов производство Китая и Турции. 
Он закупает товар в оптовом рынке «Корвон» и у поставщиков из Китая. Хочет увеличить ассортимент, разновидность джинсов и спортивной одежды. Узнав о программе «Кива» хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для закупа джинсовых брюк.
texts.en:
Muhamad H. was born in 1982. The young entrepreneur has been in the business of men’s clothes sales for four years now. He has a retail outlet at the Shohmansur market in Dushanbe. His goods assortment includes a large variety of men’s summer and multi-season cotton T-shirts and hooded sweatshirts made in China and Turkey. Muhamad purchases his goods at the Corvon wholesale market and from suppliers in China and Turkey. He wants to widen his goods assortment by including jeans and sportswear. Having learnt about the Kiva program, Muhamad wants to obtain a $1200 loan to buy jeans.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase jeans

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Greetings from Serafine A. in Rwanda! Serafine is 32 years old, married with 4 children. She owns a small shop in Nyamagabe town. She sells domestic materials like soap, maize flour, cassava flour, matchboxes, salt, sugar, beans by the kilogram, Colgate, paraffin, biscuits, etc.

Besides operating her shop, Serafina grows beans, wheat, and sweet potatoes, which are commonly grown in this area. From all her business activities, she earns about US$ 22 per month. She employs two people to help her run the business.

She is looking for a loan worth 200,000 Frws. The loan is to buy more stock for her shop because the number of customers is increasing.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop

loans.name: Sak

texts.en: Mrs. Sak D., 48, lives in the Chek village in the Kandal province. She is a widow with two children who are both employed in a garment factory. She owns a 1.5-hectar field where she cultivates rice to earn her living. Since her plantation has a problem with plowing, she decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field.  She would use the rest of the loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her rice field; and to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas”, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Espinar Nº 371, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 9 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de frutas.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio. Se levanta temprano para ir al mercado a comprar sus frutas para luego venderlos a sus clientes.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 ciento de naranja, ½ ciento de aguaje, S/10.00 de cocona para preparar su néctar, etc.

Lourdes agradece a Manuela Ramos por confiar en su persona. Se siente con mucha energía para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lourdes M. belongs to the communal bank "Las Golondrinas" (The Swallows), located in the Coronel Portillo Province, at Jr. Comandante Espinar #371, Callería District, in the Ucayali Region of Peru. She is a 62-year-old widow and mother of nine grown children. With her first 300 soles loan from Manuela Ramos, she invested in fruit sales which is her current business. She heads out early to the market to buy the fruit she then sells to her client base. With this 1000 soles loan, which she'll pay back in 4 months, she will buy a stock of oranges, aguaje fruit, 10 soles of cocona fruit to prepare as nectar, etc. Lourdes is grateful to Manuela Ramos for trusting in her as she is very enthusiastic to keep growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stock of oranges, aguaje fruit, 10 soles of cocona fruit to prepare as nectar, etc.

loans.name: Ni Luh Budi Artini

texts.id: Keinginan yang sangat besar untuk membantu suami dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya cukup tinggi.Ibu Budiartini Adalah seorang Ibu rumah tangga dengan satu orang anak perempuanSelama ini Ibu Budiartini hanya seorang ibu rumah tangga yang hanya mengurusi rumah tangganya.tetapi setelah ada program dari Dinari Ibu Budiartini Ingin berusaha memelihara 4 induk  babi,agar ada tambahan untuk kebutuhan rumah tangganya.Suami yang selama ini hanya bekerja sendiri sangat mendukung program yang ditawarkan oleh Dinari.Untuk itu Suami Budiartini ingin agar Modal Yang didapat nantinya bisa membatu kebutuhan Rumah Tangganya.Karena Ketut Sedana Hanya sebagai sopir truk yang mengangkat pesanan pasir dari pelanggan.Itupun Ketut Sedana bekerja ditempat orang lain yang hanya dibayar harian.Ibu Budiartini berharap bila mendapat modal akan memelihara Induk babi.Semoga usaha ini bisa menopang dan membatu Suami agar bisa memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya.
texts.en:
Her willingness to assist her husband to meet househould needs is quite high. Mrs Budiartini is a mother with one daughter. So far Mrs Budiartini is a homemaker who is only concern about her household. However, after a Dinari program, Mrs Budiartini like to raise 4 mother pigs, for addition to her household expenses. Her tenant employed husband is very much in support of the program offered by Dinari. Therefor Budiartini's husband wishes that the obtained capital could help their household needs, since Ketut Sedana only works as a truck driver who delivers orgered sand for customers. For that Ketut Sedana works in other people's location, and is only paid daily. Mrs Budiartini hopes that if capital is obtained she could raise mother pigs. Hopefully these efforts could support and help husband to meet household needs.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mother pigs and feed (Induk babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Anwar Sultana M. Suleman Group

texts.en:
Anwar sultana baji is 48 years old and married. She owns a two room brick house in the city of Vehari, Pakistan where she has lived with her family for the past 35 years. She got married after completing her education until 10th standard. Her husband's name is M. S.. He is a tailor by profession and has been running a tailoring center in the market for the past three years.

Anwar sultana baji is the mother of three children: one son and two daughters. Her son is a driver and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Her daughters are getting an education from a school near their house.

Anwar baji is a seamstress and sews clothes, taking orders from neighbors. She charges $2 per dress. She invests her income in a committee, and is planning to buy an electric sewing machine from the committee funds.

She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her son, so that he is able to keep all the money he earns.

Anwar sultana baji is a group leader of some women in her locality. Suraiya baji, Khalida saleem baji, Sakina baji, and Razia baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Pheng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people living in Trapaing Mortes village in Kampong Chhnang province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Mom P., the 27-year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from the plantation, she sells firewood. She is a widow with a child who is attending the local school. Mrs. Mom P. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to build a house, in order to better her living conditions.

One member in this group has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are Kiva partner AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To add to her savings for building a house

loans.name: Villa Cumaravi Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “VILLA CUMARAVI”, es una de las mas  antiguas, pertenece a la familia de  pro-mujer hace ya mas de diez años,  cumpliendo con 21 ciclos de crédito, esta  se encuentra en la zona de Senkata, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con 14 miembros activos y han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito. Un grupo muy particular ya que tienen a un varón como presidente de la asociación, a diferencia de los demás grupos. 
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la elaboración y venta de comida, venta de dulces y otras golosinas en puestos, otras  tienen tiendas de barrio y algunos son artesanos. La asociación Villa Cumaravi afirma que necesitan mayor capital para la compra productos al por mayor para aumentar sus ventas, para obtener mayores ganancias con el único objetivo de mejorar la situación económica de sus hogares.
texts.en:
The association, so-called 'Villa Cumaravi', is one of the oldest, and has belonged to the family of pro-women for more than 10 years now. It has reached 21 cycles of credit, and is found in the zone of Senkata, in the city of El Alto, which at this date counts 14 active members and has demonstrated to be an organised group, in terms of loan payments. It is a very individual group, now that the members have a man as president of the association, which is different to the rest of the groups. Different businesses exist within the assocation, such as preparation and sale of food, sales of sweets and other candies in stalls, others have suburban shops and some are artesans. The association Villa Cumaravia states that they need more capital to buy products, mainly to increase their sales, to obtain better earnings, with the sole objective of improving the economic situation of their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for their businesses

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha S. is a 42 year old trader. She is married and a mother with six children. All her children are now in school and her husband is a teacher. She is a very resourceful mother whose hard effort helps support her family. Agatha supports her kids through the sale of used clothing, curtains and bed sheet. Selling of used clothing, curtains and bed sheets is a very big market in Ghana, as brand new cloths are very expensive for the poor. She has been in this business for a year now. The selling of used clothing has created a market for many women. She travels to a nearby city called Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She normally concentrates on bed sheets and used towels sales. She will use this loan rent a store and to help her save for her children future. Agatha belongs to a village bank called ‘One touch’. She is requesting a loan of GHS500 to increase her business and restock her inventory.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah N. is 62 years old, widowed, and the mother of seven children. Two of her children are in school, while the other two are working. She lives with her family at Twifo Praso in the central region of Ghana. She sells cooking utensils such as large cooking pots, coal containers, and ladles. She has been working at her business for twenty years. Currently, her customers are demanding more stock but she doesn’t have the current inventory to meet the heightened demand. Sarah is requesting a loan to purchase more stock, to continue to support her family and contribute her income.

loans.use: To restock her inventory

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena A. is forty-two years old. She is married and blessed with three children.  Currently, her children are all pursuing education in junior and primary schools. She lives, with her family, in a family house in a town called Oda, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works with zeal as a resourceful parent to support her family and to provide for the children’s schooling. She is a fishmonger and sells all kinds of fresh and smoked fish. She sells through “hawking” (Door-to-door sales). She buys her goods from big time fish mongers in Yeji and Mankessim towns, who sell at wholesale prices. She has been in business for five years. According to Helena, most of her customers are food vendors in her community. 

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fish in bulk to serve a larger market and to improve her family’s finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Rock of Ages Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another, as social collateral, to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy wholesale smoked fish and tilapia to sell to vendors.

loans.name: Mujidat

texts.en: Mujidat is thirty-five years old and married with four children. Her business is selling clothes. She resides in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Mujidat has been in this business for a long time. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Erla

texts.en: "I am the tenant of a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm, but I never stop dreaming that someday I will be able to buy my own farm. I work so hard on the farm for my family. I want to help my husband in raising our children and in providing them with a future," says Erla T., 38 years old and the mother of five children. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 15,000. She will use the loan to purchase farm materials including fertilizers and insecticides. Through her loan, she will be able to improve their harvest. CEVI aims to help small businesses grow. It provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase farm materials like seed, fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in the rural community of Lamo in Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya, together with her husband and two children: George and Lynette Joy. The children are both studying in high school level.  

Josephine patiently maintains her canteen to further support the education of her children. She would like to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional capital to increase her income. She will utilize the loan to purchase more inventory.  She plans to expand her eatery into a general store business.  She is hoping that lenders will assist her in fulfilling her business endeavor.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of material for her studio

loans.name: Tomás Manuel

texts.es: Don Tomás Manuel M.  cuenta con 28 años Tiene 2  hijos lleva Ocho años prestando sus servicios de transportista entregando materiales para construcción de viviendas y otros, actualmente cuenta con un vehículo pesado debido a la demanda de sus clientes su vehículo necesita una reparación para el mantenimiento de la misma, por esos se acerco a la asociación ASDIR para poder adquirir un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de cuatro llantas las actuales ya no le permite poder viajar de un lugar a otro, en los diferentes partes de la ciudad donde atiende a la mayoría de sus clientes por tal razón necesita mejorar su herramienta de trabajo para facilitar y seguir mejorando sus ingresos mensuales para el  sostenimiento diario y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Tomas Manual M. is 28 years old and has 2 children. He has worked transporting construction materials in his truck for the past 8 years, and due to the demands of the job, the vehicle is currently in need of repair. For this reason, he is asking for a loan from ASDIR, which he will invest in the purchase of 4 tires, since the ones he currently has prevent him from being able to get anywhere. This investment will allow him to again attend to customers in different parts of the city, and to continue increasing his monthly income to support the day-to-day need of him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells cooked foods and bottled water. She has been in her business for the past 22 years and she has been borrowing from LAPO for the past 2 years. Felicia lives in Lagos. She is very happy with the financial assistance from KIVA lenders. She is 47 years old, married and has 5 children. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN50,000. She will use the funds to purchase more food items and bottled water to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more food items and bottled water.

loans.name: Ayaovi Clémence

texts.fr: Cette dame s’est spécialisée dans la vente d’épices et d’ingrédients pour la préparation de la sauce. Elle a installé son étalage à la devanture de sa maison et exerce ce commerce depuis 1994. Elle a comme clientèle des mini restaurants, des bars et des ménages. Ce commerce lui permet d’aider financièrement son mari à subvenir aux besoins scolaires de leurs 02 enfants. Elle a besoin de renouveler  son stock hétéroclite. Pour cette raison, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGESS  pour acheter des gimgembres, de l’ail, des poivres et bien d’autres ingrédients.
texts.en:
This woman sells spices and sauce preparation ingredients. She has set up her stall in front of her house and has been practicing this occupation since 1994. Her clients are mini restaurants, bars and households. This business allows her to financially assist her husband in meeting the schooling needs of their 2 children. She needs to replenish her miscellaneous stock. For this reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase ginger, garlic, pepper and many other ingredients.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spices and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Install a concrete floor

loans.name: Juvean

texts.en:
Juvean Q.’s source of income for the family is their tricycle (motorcycle with a sidecar), managed by her husband. The said tricycle was already old and used before it was given to her as her inheritance. Nevertheless, this has provided well in her life, especially for Juvean’s four children whose age range is from seven to 13 years old. Since this is the main means of transportation of people in their municipality and within their village, the income it generates can at least provide them with food for the day.

Juvean joined ASHI last month in September because she wanted to sustain their tricycle. She is requesting a loan through ASHI which will be used to renew their tricycle license and to continue its operation. Someday, she hopes that she will be able to request a much bigger loan amount which will enable her to buy a new tricycle for better presentation, which will attract passengers’ interest. The profits she will be making in this business will be the means for her to be able to send all of her children to school until graduation in college. By then, their standard of living will have changed.

loans.use: To pay for the renewal of the tricycle's license.

loans.name: Abose

texts.en: Abose sells bags and shoes in an open-air market. She has been in the business for the past 15 years. She is 42 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo Stata.   She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more bags and shoes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Chroeb

texts.en:
Mrs. Chroeb M. lives in Kraing Touch village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land she uses to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Khun Kheng, is a duck breeder. He is on the left of the photo.

Since his poultry business is doing well, Mrs. Chroeb M.’s husband wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Chroeb M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks and duck food for her husband business.

Mrs. Chroeb M. has four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more ducks and duck food for her husband's business

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.en:
Juan is 60 years old, married, and lives in Ita. Juan and his wife, Nymia, have two grown children who live in a neighborhood located near the center of town where Juan has a tailor shop. He manufactures clothes and bags for individuals and companies well known in the capital. 
Juan has worked at his tailor shop for over 20 years, during which time he has provided for his family. 
Juan will use this loan to buy fabric, thread and buttons, to meet the high demand there is for clothing for the holidays. 
This purchase will result in greater sales and therefore higher profits.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita Q. is from the city of Linao East Tuguegarao City. She is 39 years old. Emelita is still single. To make a living, Emelita owns & operates a general store. where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Emelita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Emelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Emelita is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Emelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic S. is from the village of Tambo, Iligan City. She is 25 years old. Marivic owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marivic joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and give her the ability to engage in business activities. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marivic from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sugarbadam

texts.en:
Sugarbadam is 45 years old and lives in Dornogobi province, Mongolia. She lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent. She is divorced from her husband and her four children are grown and live and work on their own.

Sugarbadam operates a tourist camp and food cafe in her town. In her tourist camp she hosts both foreign and domestic customers during the peak tourist season in the summer. Her customers are very satisfied and have a relaxing time viewing the natural beauty of Dornogobi province.

Sugarbadam started her tourism business in 2007 by renting a ger from her friend. After operating both her tourism business and her food cafe, she has enabled herself to live a better quality life. For the future, she is planning to expand her tourism business in order to help her children and their families.

Sugarbadam says, “My dream is to open a hotel in my town.” She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase new gers for her tourism business. In the photo, Sugarbadam is shown with her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase new gers in for her tourism business

loans.name: Eneyda

texts.es:
La Sra. Eneyda P. G. es la Directora de un Centro educativo de secundaria en el Municipio de Condega, ella es Lic. En Ciencias de la Educación, soltera y con un hijo en La universidad el cual esta a cargo de ella.

 Eneyda solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como es Zinc para techo y vigas metálicas, con la compra de estos materiales ella pretende mejorar las condiciones del área de estudio de los alumnos.

La idea de este centro de educación empieza con el objetivo de tener su propio trabajo luego que ella renuncia como maestra en un centro educativo estatal y el deseo de tener su propia empresa. Eneyda ha tenido este centro de educación secundaria desde hace 6 años e imparte las clases sabatinas y dominicales desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.

Ella espera que con la mejora de las condiciones de dicha instalaciones brindar un mejor servicio a sus alumnos y por ende tener mas demanda por brindar un servicio de calidad.

Este es el  crédito numero 8 que Eneyda tiene en Ceprodel en un periodo de 8 años, ella dice que estos créditos le han ayudado positivamente ya que ha podido llevar a cabo varios proyectos que se a propuesto para mejorar su empresa así como el que llevara a cabo una ves desembolsado dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Eneyda P. G. is the director of an education center for middle and high school students in the Condega district. She has a license in science and education. She is single and has one son in the university in her district. Eneyda would like a loan from Ceprodel to buy construction materials like Zinc for roofing and metal studs. With these materials she hopes to improve the study area for her students. The idea behind this education center started when she wanted to be her own manager. She quit her job as a teacher in a state school and started her own business. Eneyda has had this education center for the last 6 years and gives classes on Saturday and Sunday from 8 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon. She hopes that with the improved space she will be able to provide better services to her students and ultimately generate greater demand for her quality services. This is the 8th loan that Eneyda has taken out from Ceprodel over the last 8 years. She says that these loans have helped her complete various projects that have improved her business like the one she plans to do with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Anyela Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Anyela R. se dedica a la actividad de pulpería donde vende todo tipo de productos desde comestibles, cosméticos y también productos farmacéuticos como lo son medicamentos de todo tipo. 

Ella es una dama muy trabajadora que se ha destacado como excelente comerciante en el municipio de Nagarote. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de los productos para la pulpería como son los granos básicos tales como arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, entre otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Anyela R. manages a store where she sells all types of products such as food items, cosmetics, as well as medicines of all kinds.

Anyela is a hardworking woman who has developed into a successful merchant in the town of Nagarote. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products for her store such as basic grains (such as rice), beans, oil, sugar, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Mercedes Yolanda

texts.es:
Mercedes Yolanda A. M. tiene 21 años de edad, es casada, y vive con sus esposo y hijo de 3 años que se llama Edwin.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura como su fuente principal de ingresos, sembrando mora, papas, y maiz.  Vende la mora en mayores cantidades y los otros cultivos son para el consumo.  Tiene unos 10 gallinas que crece para consumir.

Solicita el crédito para comprar productos para la agricultura como abonos y liquidos.  Su esperanza principal es lograr tener más terreno y sacar su hijo del campo porque es muy duro y quiere que salga adelante.
texts.en:
Mercedes Yolanda A. M. is 21 years old, is married and lives with her husband and her 3-year old son Edwin. She belongs to the solidarity group “Mushuc Nan”, a Qechua name that means “Camino Nuevo” in Spanish (“New Road” in English). This is a group of 18 women that work in agriculture. They belong to the community of Guantug Cruz in the canton of Guaranda. They all have a strong desire to work with loans to get ahead in life. Mercedes works in agriculture which is her main source of income; she grows blackberries, potatoes and corn. She sells the blackberry wholesale, and the other crops as consumables. She has 10 hens that she grows for consumption. She is requesting the loan to buy agricultural products such as fertilizers and liquids. Her main hope is to have more land so she can bring her son out of the hard rural life and he can get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural products (fetilizers, liquids, etc.)

loans.name: Yobani Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Yobani Francisco G., labora para la empresa Camiones y Motores desde hace un año y ocho meses, desempeñandose como Guardespalda, don Yovani necesita el credito para la compra de materiales ya que quiere realizarle mejoras a su Vivienda, como ser ampliacion de la cocina e instalar ceramica, construccion de una habitacion y un muro en la parte frontal de su vivienda. Es viudo, su esposa murio hace unos años, y tiene un hijo el cual esta a cargo de el. con su salario mensual cubre con el pago del credito.
su meta es poder terminar de construir su casa de habitacion y asi poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo que es lo que mas quiere en este mundo.
texts.en:
Mr. Yobani Francisco G. has worked as a security guard for the Trucks and Motors company for a year and eight months. Yovani needs a loan to purchase materials to make improvements on his house. He wants to add on to the kitchen, tile the floor, build an extra room, and put a wall up in front of his house. He is a widower. His wife died a few years ago. He has one son who lives with him. He will use his monthly salary to make his loan payments. His goal is to finish building his house and thus improve his son's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sand, iron bars, cement block, and tiles

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a 50-year-old single lady.  She rears dairy cattle and sells milk to the area residents to earn a living. She has been in this business since she was 20 years old.  She also earns rent from her residential houses to improve her living conditions.  She had previously taken out a loan of Kes 46,900 from Faulu Kenya, which she used to expand her business and successfully repaid.  She hopes to increase her turnover and improve her living standards in the future. She has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 to buy a dairy cow and dairy feed.

loans.use: To buy one dairy cow and feed

loans.name: Marina Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora P.  se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante distribuyendo su mercadería a empleados de empresas con abonos diarios, semanales y mensuales  inicia su jornada de trabajo desde las 8:00Am a las 4:00pm.
 
 Este crédito lo solicito para  compra de mercadería apropiada en la temporada de Semana Santa.
 
Cabe mencionar que la Señora P.  esta agradecida  con ceprodel ya que ha logrado crecer en su negocio y dejar los prestamos con prestamistas.
texts.en:
La señora P. se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante distribuyendo su mercadería a empleados de empresas con abonos diarios, semanales y mensuales inicia su jornada de trabajo desde las 8:00Am a las 4:00pm. Este crédito lo solicito para compra de mercadería apropiada en la temporada de Semana Santa. Cabe mencionar que la Señora P. esta agradecida con ceprodel ya que ha logrado crecer en su negocio y dejar los prestamos con prestamistas.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de Pantalones, Short, Camisa, Vestidos, Trajes de Niño.

loans.name: La Mixtequilla Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama L. MixtequilL. por que asi  le llaman al lugar donD. habita L. mayoria del grupo, y se les hizo que era un nombre original  Las  5 personas del grupo son Rocío Hernández, Anel Martínez, Francisco  Javier Ávalos C., Javier D. L. O  e Isabel  Hernández.  Todos D. ellos viven en el estado D. Veracruz.  Rocío se dedica  a una estética en su domicilio, Isabel y Anel tiene un carros transportistas, francisco Javier se dedica a   L. comercializacionD. ganado   y  Javier tiene una tiendita D. abarrotes
 
Rocío es L. representante del grupo.  ElL. está casada.  Tiene tres hijos  varones.  Rocío es estilista y atienD. a sus clientes en su domicilio ya que a L. fecha no cuenta con un local donD. elL. pueda poner su negocio y atender mejor a sus clientes; por lo que pidió este crédito para comprar algunas cosas que le faltan para iniciar con su salón D. belleza.     

Con este crédito, elL.  quiere  comprar algunas cosas que le faltan para iniciar con su salón D. belleza y compraría más mercancía para  tener  más variedad en su negocio y ofrecer un mejor servicio.  Su meta para el futuro es dar una mejor vida a sus hijos.  Con sus ganancias, elL. espero que algún día sus hijos puedan tener un mejor futuro e ir a L. universidad.  
 Rocío dice que elL. se siente muy a gusto en el grupo D. L. MixtequilL. porque elL. sabe que pueD. confiar sus compañeros, ya que los conoce  y espera este sea uno D. muchos créditos  en Fundación Realidad.  

Rocío se siente muy afortunada  y agradece a   los prestarios D. KIVA el que estén dispuestos para ayudarL. para sacar su negocio  y el D. sus compañeros adelante.
texts.en:
This group is named L. MixtequilL. because it is the name of the place where the majority of the group lives. The five people in the group are named Rocío Hernández, Anel Martínez, Francisco Javier Ávalos C., Javier D. L. O, and Isabel Hernández. All of them live in Veracruz. Rocío works at a beauty salon in her home, Isabel and Anel drive cars, Francisco Javier works with commercially raised cattle, and Javier has a small grocery store. Rocio is the representative of the group. She is married with three sons. She is a stylist and attends to her clients in her home because she has yet to establish a fixed location where she can better attend to her customers. She requests a loan to purchase things she needs to start her beauty salon. She would also like to buy merchandise to have a better variety and offer the best service. Her goal for the future is to give a better life to her children. With her income she hopes that one day her kids will have a better future and go to college. Rocío says that she is very excited to be in the L. MixtequilL. group because she knows that she can rely on her group members. She hopes that this is the first of many loans with Fundación Realidad. Rocío feels very fortunate and appreciative of the Kiva loan officers who are willing to help her and her group's businesses move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy various chemicals and tools for a beauty salon

loans.name: Nom

texts.en:
Mrs. Nom N. is 53 years old. She lives in Kouk Doung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer and owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. She is also a duck breeder and earns a small income from this business to help support her family. Mrs. Nom N. is requesting a loan to buy 200 more ducklings to breed.

Mrs. Nom N. is a widow. She has three children; one works as a seamstress in a garment factory and another is a duck breeder, while the third is a student.

loans.use: To purchase ducklings to breed

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn D. is from the town of Banga. She is 49 years old, married and has a 24-year-old child. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a fishing business, raising and selling "tilapia" (St. Peter's fish) at the market. She also sells dry goods at her town's market.
