Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 20 years now.

Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food for the fish and also additional stock for her dry goods. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jocelyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase food for fish and additional inventory of dry goods for sale at market

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: The photograph shows Mrs. Chem S. at work raising pigs in her stall. Chem S. is a single mother who earns her daily revenue by working as a farmer in the local village; she raises pigs as well as cultivating a rice crop. Chem S. has given birth to five children: one is married and lives separately and the others are still single. Chem S. has always been successful with her pig-raising investment because she learned how to do it years ago. To earn additional income, Chem S. is applying for a loan to buy pig feed and more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Ang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ang C. is 46 years old and is the village bank president.  She has been selected by its eighteen members who are located in Kantout Thom village in Takeo province. Each member will use their loan for their individual businesses.

Mrs. Ang C. and her husband, Mr. Sorn Saem, are farmers who own two hectares of land on which they cultivate rice for a living. Aside from being farmers, Mrs. Ang C. is a pig breeder at home and her husband is a vegetable seller in the local market. With both businesses they are able to earn a small income to support their family. To expand both businesses, Mrs. Ang C. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for pig breeding, and to buy more vegetable to support her husband's business. This couple has eight children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is a vegetable seller, and the other five children are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food for pig breeding

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic A. is from Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old. Marivic is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marivic owns & operates a business selling specialty food products in the local community. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marivic joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Marivic from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El señor Luis Alberto es Albañil, tiene tres hijos pequeños. Quiere ir mejorando su calidad de vida; es por ello que ha ido construyendo su vivienda poco a poco para ofrecer a su familia comodidad y un buen patrimonio para el futuro. El señor quiere poner la losa de concreto en un cuarto que tiene en la parte trasera de su vivienda. El Señor Luis Alberto les agradece la ayuda para realizar su Proyecto de su Vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is a bricklayer. He has three small children. He wants to improve his quality of life. Little by little he has been building his house in order to make his family comfortable and to give them a good inheritance in the future. He wants to pour a concrete slab in a room in the back of his house. Luis Alberto is grateful for the help on his home project.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Concrete slab

loans.name: Manolito

texts.en:
Manolito F. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 58 years old. Manolito is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Manolito manufactures and sells charcoal. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing, buying and selling charcoal to local businesses and community members. Manolito has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Manolito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Manolito is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Manolito from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional charcoal

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria F. is from the village of East Pob., Rizal. She is 60 years old, married and has two adult children. To make a living, Gloria does farming by planting crops such as corn, rice, etc. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2004, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase carabao (water buffalo). This will be the sixth loan taken out by Gloria from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase carabao (water buffalo) for farming

loans.name: 060303-Quang Trung-Hoang Chau Group

texts.en:
Danh  L. T. (14) is a 57 year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa. Danh  is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 060303-Quang Trung-Hoang Chau (060303-Quang Trung-Hoang Chau).

Danh  is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, Danh operates a family member's agriculture business, raising livestock, primarily pigs, for saL.. Danh has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Danh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Danh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. She is now requesting a new loan of 5000000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Danh from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Danh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Toi N. T. (29) is a 49 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.

2.  Danh L. T. (22) is a 53 year-old femaL., requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

3.  Luan L. T. (6) is a 53 year-old femaL.,s requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

4.  Minh C. T. (17) is a 63 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

5.  Chat L. T. (18) is a 44 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

6.  Nien N. T. (35) is a 37 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

7.  Danh L. T. (19) is a 48 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

8.  Cam L. T. (24) is a 50 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Danh  L. T. (14) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa.  Danh  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 9 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 060303-Quang Trung-Hoang Chau (060303-Quang Trung-Hoang Chau).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Danh  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Danh  kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2005, Danh  đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Danh  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua con giống.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

1.  Toi N. T. (29) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.

6.  Nien N. T. (35) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es: Víctor B. A. de 62 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador quien cuenta con una amplia experiencia en el oficio que realiza. Él se dedica a la elaboración de calzado para niños, mujeres y hombres, los cuales son hechos de cuero y que poseen una excelente calidad, comprarle zapatos a Víctor es toda una tradición ya que tiene más de 30 años de elaborar este trabajo, en el pueblo de San Juan Opico, lugar en el cual también vive junto a su esposa y un nieto de 4 años de edad. Víctor solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar: cuero, cintas, hilo, agujas, pegamento y otros instrumentos primordiales que sean de mucha ayuda para agilizar y mejorar su trabajo, así de esta forma él espera iniciar a elaborar calzado más moderno y de esta forma llamar la atención de más personas.
texts.en: Victor B. A. is a 62-year-old is a hard working man who has extensive experience in his trade of making shoes for children, women and men.  His shoes are made of leather and are excellent in quality. Buying shoes from Victor has been a tradition for over 30 years in the town of San Juan Opico, where he lives with his wife and grandson (age 4).  Victor requests a loan so that he can purchase: leather, tape, thread, needles, glue and other key products that are needed to streamline and improve his work.  He hopes that he will be able to begin to develop more modern footwear and thus grow his business by attracting more customers.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima para fabricación de calzado. (To purchase materials for making shoes)

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Wuilton José

texts.es: El Sr. Wuilton José C. F. es Trabajador activo del centro de salud “Julio Buitrago Masa chapa” desempeñándose como responsable de estadística tiene  dieciocho años de trabajar para esta institución es casado actualmente tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  nueve créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Wuilton José C. F. is at active worker who is responsible for statistics at the Julio Buitrago Masa Chapa Health Center. He has worked for this organization for 18 years. He is married with two school-aged children. He has had nine loans with CEPRODEL (Kiva Field Partner) and each one has been used to buy construction materials to improve his house. These loans with CEPRODEL have benefited him greatly as they have allowed him to improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: To buy construction materials: sand, cement, stone, etc.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana, de 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora, esta casada con Gregorio, de 35 años, ambos tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales 4 son menores y estudian, como una familia unida, ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Clara. “Hace 20 años que me dedico a sembrar, pero pareciera que fue ayer”, afirma. Su vida se centra en el cuidado de sus terrenos, en los que pasa la mayor parte del día. Sus principales cultivos son de papa de las diferentes variedades. Además el buen carácter que tiene le ayuda en la comercialización de sus productos en el mercado central de la ciudad de “Tarma”, en donde sus clientes son bueno pagadores y saben de la calidad de su producción. Lo que le disgusta de la siembra es cuando, la rancha y gusanera se apodarán de los tubérculos, ocasionándole grandes pérdidas, pero eso no la desanida, por ello desea comprar sus terrenos agrícolas, limpios y sanos. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y está agradecida por todo este tiempo que gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal, pudo sembrar. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono orgánico y guano (fertilizante natural), para esparcir en sus cultivos, de papa de la variedad “yungay”, que dentro de estos meses cosechará.
texts.en: Viviana is 35 years old.  She is married to Gregorio who is also 35.  They have 5 children, 4 of whom are still studying.  They live in their own home in the town of Santa Clara as a united family.  “I started sowing crops 20 years ago but it seems like it was yesterday”, Viviana says.  Her life is centered around the care of her plots of land which is where she spends most of her day.  Her main crops are different varieties of potato.  Her good character helps her when selling her products in the central market in the city of Tarma where her customers are good payers and are aware of the quality of her goods.  What upsets her about sowing crops is when blight and pests take over her tubers, causing great losses.  However, this does not stop her.  For this reason though, she would like to be able to keep her plots of land, clean and healthy.  This is the eighth loan she has had from MFP and she is grateful that she has had the support of her community bank and been able to sow her crops.  With this loan she will buy organic fertilizer and guano (a natural fertilizer), to spread on her crops  - “yungay” variety potatoes – which she will harvest shortly.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer for her potato crops

loans.name: María Esthela

texts.es:
La Señora. María A. es socia del banco comunal Dinastía Espoir, vive en la ciudadela  los Eucaliptos en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía, es muy rica en su cultura y tradiciones y su gente es amable y cordial.

Nuestra socia tiene 55 años, es casada y tiene 8 hijos, 7 son casados viven independientes, su último hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica al comercio actividad que le ha permitido mantener su familia, gracias al esfuerzo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María al igual que su esposo es comerciante de cosméticos y vende  joyas, billeteras, cinturones etc., esta labor la realiza hace 30 años, trabaja vendiendo sus productos en todas las ferias de la ciudad al igual que en las ferias de la ciudad de Azogues. Hace 5 meses tiene un local de medicina natural en el cual labora de 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta por que puede estar con sus amigas y pasar un buen momento junto a ellas. su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería. Su meta es  tener un local donde puede vender su mercadería sin necesidad de recorrer la ciudad.
texts.en:
Mrs. María A., 55, is a member of the Dinastía Espoir (Espoir Dynasty) communal bank.  She lives in Eucaliptos in Cuenca.  This city is knows for the beauty of its historic city center.  It has a varied gastronomy, is very rich in culture and traditions and its residents are kind and cordial.

She is married and has 8 children.  Seven of them are married and live independently; her youngest son is studying in school in the city.  Her husband is a merchant, an activity that has made it possible for him to support his family.  Thanks to their efforts as a couple they have succeeded in building their house.

María, like her husband, is a merchant.  She sells cosmetics, jewelry, belts, etc.  She has been in this line of work for 30 years.  She sells products in all of the city’s markets as well as in the market in the city of Azogues.  For the last five months she has had a location where she sells natural medicines from 7am until 5pm.

She’s in her second loan with the communal bank and she likes it because she can be with her friends and spend a pleasant moment with them.  She will use the new loan to buy more merchandise.  Her goal is to have a locale where she can sell her merchandise without having to traverse the city.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, jewelry, wallets, belts and natural products.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German vive en Achacachi. El es constructor albañil y su esposa es productora agrícola, ella siembra particularmente cebollas. Es su principal fuente de manutención para su familia que esta compuesto por sus cuatro hijos.

El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera, lo que le  permitirá vender a la fábrica PIL una producción mayor de leche y mejorar sus ingresos. German también tiene el objetivo de afiliarse a Aplepo (Asociación de productores de leche de la Provincia Omasuyos).
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
German lives in Achacachi. He is a mason by trade, and his wife is an agricultural producer, who mostly grows onions. This is his main source of support for his family, which includes his four children. 

The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow, which will allow him to sell more milk to the PIL factory and improve his income. German also has the goal of joining Aplepo (the Milk Producers Association of Omasuyos Province).
 
This is his first loan with Impro.

loans.use: Buying a dairy cow to improve his milk production

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Maïmouna K. est une femme mariée de plus 40 ans et mère de quatre enfants qui vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Madame Maïmouna mène des activités  de préparation de jus de fruits, d’achat et de vente de l’eau minérale, de céréales, de bois de chauffe et de  poissons fumé il y a dix années. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans ses activités et reçoit beaucoup de commandes, mais ses ressources ne peuvent pas lui permettre de les satisfaire. Ainsi, elle a besoin de ce septième prêt individuel pour acheter un nouveau réfrigérateur, de l’eau minérale, des céréales et des ingrédients pour la préparation de jus de fruits.
Elle vend les jus de fruits et de l’eau minérale à la gare routière de Sikasso, les céréales sont stockées et vendues à son domicile.
Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ ans, elle a bénéficié  de plusieurs prêts solidaires avec une association des femmes de son quartier et est maintenant à son  septième prêt individuel, tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  réaliser l’essentielle de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Maïmouna K. is a married woman over the age of 40 and a mother of four who lives with her husband and their children in Sanoubougou I, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso.

Maïmouna has been leading businesses in the preparation of fruit juice, buying and selling mineral water, grains, firewood and smoked fish for ten years. She enjoys a great reputation in her business dealings and receives many orders, but her resources don't allow her to fulfill them all. So she needs this seventh individual loan in order to buy a new refrigerator, mineral water, grains and ingredients for the preparation of fruit juice.

She sells the fruit juice and the mineral water at the bus station in Sikasso, the grains are stored and sold at her home.

She has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for several years, has benefited from several group loans with a women's association in her neighborhood and is now on her seventh individual loan, all the previous loans having been properly repaid.

With this loan, she hopes to make a monthly profit of 200,000 CFA francs, which will be used to cover the bulk of her expenses, contribute to the family expenses, pay the interest on her loan and invest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: Buying miscellaneous goods.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Doña Emilia, se dedica a la venta D. antojitos y verduras, tiene 54 años D. edad, vive con sus hijos y su esposo, sus hijos son Marjori D. 20 años y Henry D. 24 años, ellos residen en Guatajiagua, departamento D. Morazán.
La señora Emilia tiene 15 años D. experiencia en el negocio, trabaja en un horario D. 5:00am a 6:00pm, ella aprendió a cocinas porque asistió a clases en un curso impartido en Guatajiagua, ella necesita D. un préstamo para la compra D. materiales para preparar la venta, elementos como verduras para el negocio D. verduras y otras para preparar los platillos, así como condimentos y carnes, este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar el negocio y a ir creciendo poco a poco en el comercio.
Ella sueña con instalar algún día una panadería D. pan dulce y simple, ya que en las clases que recibió aprendió a hacer pan, también desea actualmente proveer D. su negocio los ingresos necesarios para solventar las necesidades del hogar y pagar oportunamente este préstamo.
texts.en:
Emilia has a business selling snacks and vegetables.  She is 54 years old and lives with her children and husband.  Her children are 20 year-old Marjori and 24 year-old Henry.  They live in Guatajiagua, in Morazán department.

Emilia has 15 years of experience in her business.  She works from 5.00am to 6.00pm.  She learned to cook by attending classes in Guatajiagua.  She needs this loan to buy supplies for preparing her sales.  She will buy some vegetables for her vegetable business and some for making her meals.  She will also buy condiments and meat.  This loan will help her to increase her business and grow little by little as a saleswoman.

Emilia dreams of some day setting up a bakery where she will make sweet bread and ordinary bread, since the classes she attended taught her how to bake bread.  Her current wish is, through her business, to make the money she needs to cover her household needs and to repay this loan on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks for resale

loans.name: Mirco

texts.es: Mirco, de 25 años, vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos y de sus 2 hermanos menores; juntos trabajan cada día para salir adelante. Desde muy pequeño aprendió todo lo referente a la confección de prendas, pues observaba como sus padres realizaban esta labor en el taller de su casa. Es así que desde los 12 años empezó a ayudarlos y en la actualidad trabaja al lado de su padre creando prendas de vestir, de acuerdo a la temporada. Esta muy satisfecho de su labor ya que ellos mismos muchas veces comercializan las prendas y las ganancias son mayores; además se las venden a grandes comerciantes. Le gusta mucho su labor y puede trabajar durante todo el día en la comodidad de su hogar aunque algunas veces debe amanecerse trabajando con sus padres para cumplir con grandes pedidos.  Como es un joven muy emprendedor para el futuro quiere ampliar el negocio, y ya tiene pensado comprar maquinas de coser para contratar operarios y producir en cantidad. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, ya que quiere cumplir con todas las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Mirco tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de material (rollos de tela) que necesita para cumplir con un pedido que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Mirco, who is 25, lives in his parents' house with them and with two younger siblings. Together, they work every day to advance themselves. Beginning when he was very young, he learned everything about making clothing, since he watched how his parents carried out this work in the workshop in their house. It is in this way that at the age of 12 he began to help them, and now he works alongside his father creating garments to wear, according to the season. He is very satisfied with his work, since they themselves often sell the garments and the earnings are greater. In addition, they sell them to larger dealers. He likes his work a lot and can work through the entire day in the comfort of his home, although sometimes he has to get up at dawn to work with his parents to complete big orders. 

Since he is a very entrepreneurial young man, in the future he would like to expand the business, and he has already thought about buying sewing machines to hire operators and produce in quantity. 

This is his first credit with MFP, and he promises to be punctual with his payments, since he wants to fulfill his obligations to the people who make possible this support, which will allow him to continue working in search of progress. Mirco has plans to invest the loan he is applying for in the purchase of material (rolls of fabric) that he needs to complete a pending order.

loans.use: Buy rolls of fabric to continue making garments.

loans.name: Nyakashoga Tweyambe Group, Ntungamo

texts.en: T.  Innocent is the leader of the Nyakashoga Tweyambe Group, Ntungamo. He is 28 years old and married, with three children aged 1, 4 and 6 years old. Innocent has operated a bar business in the Nyakashoga trading centre for 3 years. Because he is friendly, social and determined, Innocent is able to make a monthly profit of 150,000 UGX. He is also involved in the agriculture business and is a farmer just like the rest of his extended family. Innocent is hardworking and needs a loan to buy more beer and sodas for resale. Innocent hopes to be able to buy more land for agriculture, educate his children and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more beer and sodas

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo tiene 60 años, es una mujer tierna y dócil. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y su madre anciana, para quien es su esfuerzo de todos los días. Hace más de 15 años, Consuelo se dedica a tejer, bordar y realizar manualidades en bisutería, negocio que lo realiza en su casa durante sus horas libres y para lograr que su trabajo le genere utilidades; inicialmente ofrecía a sus familiares y poco a poco a sus amistades. Hoy sus tejidos son cotizados por sus vecinos; siendo así dinámica en la venta de sus tejidos y  bisuterías. Se siente muy contenta de las utilidades que capta y sobre todo disfruta mucho al realizar su labor.  Ella trabaja con mucha entrega esta emprendedora mujer, así puede ayudar a su esposo a cubrir los gastos de su hogar y sobre todo afrontar las medicinas de su madre anciana. En adelante tiene planeado trabajar en la venta de ropa en sociedad con su nuera y, de ese modo también dar a conocer a otras personas sus tejidos. Es su noveno crédito que tiene con MFP, y dice “que confíen en ella y estén seguros que pagará todas sus cuotas puntualmente como lo hizo hasta ahora”, ya que mas adelante desea seguir contando con posteriores ayudas. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará zapatos colegiales, para enviar a Argentina, de ese modo proveer de esta mercadería que por campaña escolar tiene mucha demanda.
texts.en:
Consuelo, 60, is a tender, gentle woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband and elderly mother for whom is her daily effort.  For over 15 years Consuelo has knitted, embroidered and done costume jewelry crafts, a business she does at home during her spare time and so that the work will earn her profits.  Initially she sold to her family members and gradually to her acquaintances.  Today, her knit work is purchased by her neighbors; this is the dynamic of her knitwear and costume jewelry sales.  She feels very happy about the profits she makes and above all enjoys her work very much.  This enterprising woman works very diligently to help her husband cover household expenses but above all to afford her elderly mother’s medicine.  In the future she plans to work selling clothes in partnership with her daughter-in-law thus making her knitwear known to more people.

This is her 9th loan with MFP.  She says to trust her and be assured that she will pay all her installments punctually like she’s done to date because later on she wants to be able to count on getting future loans.  

If she were to get the loan she’s asking for she will buy school shoes to ship to Argentina to provide this merchandise which is in high demand right now because of the start of the new school term.

loans.use: To stock up on school shoes.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 58 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Aldo de 59 años, pues sus 3 hijos ya no viven con ellos porque tienen sus propias familias. Esta trabajadora mujer, ha pesar de sacar adelante a sus hijos mayores con mucho trabajo, aún sigue luchando por salir adelante junto a su esposo. Es por esta razón  que hace algunos años decidieron comprar una combi, para que su esposo brinde el servicio de transporte público, y en el negocio le va muy bien, él conduce el auto, durante el turno de día,  mientras que ella administra el dinero de las ganancias. Y en la actualidad, como en el negocio le va muy bien, están ahorrando para comprar un auto más y brindarlo en alquiler. Esta emprendedora mujer tiene muchos planes por concretar y espera lograrlos con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Pero con frecuencia las llantas de su vehiculo se malogran por lo que constantemente necesita capital para cambiar de llantas y por esta razón solicita el crédito. Es el tercer  crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas pues desea seguir trabajando, además esta muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su grupo pues esta compuesto por personas responsables y solidarias. Juana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cuatro llantas nuevas para cambiar las antiguas de su auto, de esta manera espera que su esposo brinde un mejor servicio de taxi.
texts.en:
Juana is 58 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her 59 year-old husband Aldo.  Her three children no longer live with them as they have their own families.

Although this hard-working woman has already worked to get her children ahead in life, she continues working every day in order to get herself and her husband ahead.  Some years ago, they decided to buy a van so that her husband could provide a public transport service and the business is doing very well.  He drives the car during the day shift while she manages the money.  As the business is doing very well they are currently saving to buy another car to hire out.

This enterprising woman has many plans to fulfil and she hopes to achieve them through a lot of hard work and commitment.  However, her vehicle's tires wear out frequently and so she constantly needs capital in order to change the tires.  This is why she is requesting a loan.

This is Juana's third loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time as she would like to continue working.  She is very satisfied with  her group since it is made up of responsible people who are supportive of each other.  Juana plans to invest her loan in buying four new tires for her vehicle.  She hopes that this will enable her husband to provide a better taxi service.

loans.use: to buy four new tires for her vehicle

loans.name: Boun's Group

texts.en:
The eleven people who make up this village bank loan have selected Mrs. Boun to become the village bank president. They will use their portions of the loan in various ways to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Boun was born in 1958, and she earns her living by selling groceries in the local village. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business. 

Her husband, Mr. Bo is a motorcycle taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to support his family. This couple has two children: one is a motorbike taxi driver and the other helps with the grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita D. is a 57-year-old woman from the village of Bonfal West, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. Estrelita is separated from her spouse and has four adult-age children. To earn a living, Estrelita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. Specifically, she runs a general store, where her primary source of income is derived from selling both food and everyday products to members of her local community. Estrelita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Estrelita joined ASKI to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, she was better able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her standard of living. Recently, Estrelita successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP ($250) from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Estrelita is now requesting another loan, again in the amount of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Notably, this loan would be the third loan taken out by Estrelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to financially support her immediate family members. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional items and to expand her product offering

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema N. lives in the Kanyanya neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her mother. 

Rehema sells bales of second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Rehema sells her products from home, by means of retail. 

Rehema has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more boxes of bar soap and powdered soap. The main business challenges for Rehema include thieves and seasonality. Her goals for her business are to buy a plot of land and also to start importing clothes herself. 

Rehema lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and  piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael tiene 30 años de edad, el es soltero.  Vive en casa de su madre,  que es ama de casa  .En la comunidad donde vive, la gente se dedica al servicio de mototaxi,  además de venta de animales, bodega, etc.  Su casa de ubica en el distrito de Tumán a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Rafael , cuenta con una unidad vehicular (mototaxi, vehiculo de transporte público, con  moto y una cabina para el transporte de personas), que es de su propiedad, con la cual  brinda servicio  de transporte publico de pasajeros.rafael se dedica a esta labor hace 7 años, tiempo en el cual ha adquirido  experiencia en el rubro.

Rafael,  está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa de S/, 1000,00 mantenimiento de unidad móvil tiene buenas perspectivas para su negocio, piensa en hacer su negocio mas grande, adquiriendo posteriormente otra moto  o poner un servicio de motorepuestos.

Por consiguiente  apoyar a su madre, y poder alcanzar una major calidad de vida. Rafael es una persona trabajadora, activa y bastante responsable. Las personas que lo conocen lo consideran alguien tranquilo y confiabl.
texts.en:
Rafael is 30 years old and single.  He lives in his mother's home.  His mother is a homemaker.  The people in their community provide motorcycle taxi services.  They also sell animals, run grocery stores, etc.  Their home is located in Tumán district, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Rafael has a motorcycle taxi (a public transport vehicle which consists of a motorcycle with a cabin for transporting passengers).  He owns the vehicle and uses it to provide a public transport service.  Rafael has been in this business for seven years.  He has acquired experience in this line of work.

Rafael is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can have some maintenance work carried out on his vehicle.  His business has good prospects.  He is thinking of expanding his business by acquiring another motorcycle or setting up a business selling motorcycle parts.  This will enable him to support his mother and achieve a better quality of life.

Rafael is a hard-working, active, responsible person.  People who know him consider him to be a calm and trustworthy person.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: 42 Vạn Hà Thiệu Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyet works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Nguyet is 53 years old, married and has two children. She is the group leader of the 12.7.42.Van ha solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.
This is Nguyet's first loan with Kiva partner, Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nguyet has been involved in her business for less than a year. The main hardship that she faces in her business is lack of capital. With her business profits, Nguyet hopes to maintain a successful business, remodel her house, and see her business do well.

loans.use: to buy baby chicken and pig and food for chicken and pig

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with 4 children; two of her children attend school and two are still young for school. She owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 5 years, Mwanajuma has operated a firewood sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She also makes table mats as another source of livelihood. Mwanajuma faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, it becomes difficult to get firewood for sale. 

Mwanajuma wants to use this KES 15,000 laon to purchase bundles of maize flour, crates of tomatoes and sacks of coconuts. Mwanajuma dreams of expanding her business and establishing a retail shop in the future. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, tomatoes and coconuts.

loans.name: Biimu

texts.en:
Biimu is a married woman with two children; one attends school and one is still young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Biimu's greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, Biimu has operated a food vending business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of owning a café in the future. Biimu plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to build a shelter, purchase timber and iron sheets and pay labor. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to build a shelter, purchase timber and iron sheets and pay labor

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es: Yanina trabaja como educadora en un colegio de la ciudad y también dicta clases particulares. El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de una maestría en educación. Vive en alquiler en una casa la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Mallasa en la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Yanina se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente, uno de los cuales fue canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Yanina works as a teacher in a high school in the city and also gives private classes.  She needs this loan to pay for her master's degree in education.  She rents a house which is located in Mallasa district, in the city of La Paz.  She is single and doesn't have any children.

Yanina is very happy with the loans that she has previously been given, one of which was through Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her master's degree in education

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María de 62 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Túcume, la cual pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y turismo.

María desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su familia.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar animales y alimentos balanceados para los mismos, con los ingresos que adquiera por la venta puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  María es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere y  mejore económicamente para tener otras comodidades.
texts.en: María is 62 and lives with her husband and son in the rural district of Túcume, in the Departament of Lambayeque.  This region is known for its agriculture, livestock and tourism.  For some years, Maria has raised and sold sheep in the back of her house, using balanced feed and natural pasture to grow them to optimum size.  She sells them in local markets and has earned solid profits to provide for her family's expenses.  Maria now seeks a credit of 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy additional animals and feed stock, to increase her earnings.  María is a hard worker and very responsable, who is eager to see her family prosper.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed stock

loans.name: Mayli Cecilia

texts.es: Mayli es su segundo credito,es de 25 años y tiene 1 hijo,ella se dedica a la confeccion de prendas de vestir, desde hace tiempo,ella le da gracias a Dios y Kiva por haberle ayudado con el credito anterior ella logro comprar una cantidad bonita de tela para sus confecciones,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de telas por mayor y tener mas bariedad en prendas,el sueño mas grande de ella es darle lo mejor a su unico hijo y que tenga lo necesario para que pueda estudiar y ser una persona de bien,
texts.en: This is Mayli’s second loan.  She’s 25 years old and has a son.  She has manufactured articles of clothing for some time now.  She thanks God and Kiva for having helped her with the previous loan.  She was able to buy a nice amount of fabric for her creations.  She’s asking for this loan to buy fabric at wholesale to have a wider variety of articles of clothing.  Her biggest dream is to give the best to her only son and that he has everything he needs to go to school and become an upstanding citizen.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Xavier

texts.en:
Xavier is 65 years old and married with 11 children aged between 42 and 20 living in his own permanent house in Hoima, Uganda. For 4 years, he has been a tea out-grower (contract farmer). He started as a casual laborer at the factory and later saved money to buy land on which he now grows tea.

His major challenge is the high cost of inputs such as manure, but he hopes to expand his tea plantation in the next five years. Xavier wants a loan to buy inputs such as fertilizers for his garden.

loans.use: to buy inputs (fertilizers, etc.) for his garden

loans.name: Kobil

texts.ru:
Кобил умный и образованный человек.  Он женат и ответственный отец 1 ребенка. С детства он мечтал иметь свой собственный бизнес и стать богатым человеком. Четыре года назад он открыл свой собственный бизнес и успешно продолжает. С начало он занимался услугой таксиста, а затем постепенно он открыл свою автомойку.  Теперь он хочет отремонтировать здание там, где он занимается мойкой автомобилей. С этой целью Кобил запрашивает займ в размере 2000$ США. Он заранее благодарит всех кредиторов за их поддержку и доброты.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Kobil is a smart and educated person.  He is married and is a responsible father of one child.  Since childhood, he dreamed of having his own business and becoming a rich man.  He opened his business four years ago and successfully runs it now.  He started his business with proving a taxi service and then opened his own car wash.  Now, he wants to repair the building, where he washes cars.  To achieve this goal, Kobil is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000.  He is grateful in advance to all creditors for their support and kindness.

loans.use: to repair his car wash building

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a hardworking businesswoman aged 31. She is married and blessed with two children. For the last four years, she has been managing a retail shop to earn a living. Through the loans she gets from Faulu Kenya, she has been able to manage her business well. In the next five years, she wants to manage a wholesale business. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar and rice.

loans.use: To buy sugar and rice.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher is a 28-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and only sibling. He has owned a barber shop since 2009. He is well-known in the whole region and has a good reputation.  Like the majority of Lebanese guys, he helps his family with his business income. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new shaving tools. In the future, he is planning to buy a laser machine and start providing his customers with these services in order to satisfy them.

loans.use: to purchase new shaving tools

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 67 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.
Concepcion runs a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. She has been in this business for 33 years and sells a variety of items such as sandals, shorts, pants, t-shirts, etc. 
In the future, Concepcion would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction tools to do his construction work.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is a 58 year-old farmer from the village of Gantiadi, South Georgia.  He is married and lives with his wife, Mzevinar. 

Merab and Mzevinar have 7 milk cows. They sell milk locally to a milk processing company. Also, the family grows potatoes on family owned land. Merab sells harvested potatoes in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). Total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris. 

Merab requested a loan for purchasing 5 or 6 calves. He will grow the calves during the winter months and sell them in spring for a higher price. The family will earn additional income, which will be used for improving family members’ living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 32 years old and married, with three children, two of them in school. She has operated a business selling groundnuts and cooking oil in Yei, South Sudan, for four years. Lucy requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase groundnuts and cooking oil for resale. She will use her extra income to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts and cooking oil.

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en: Dulamsuren is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her husband is a security guard. Her elder two children are school students and the younger one goes to kindergarten. Dulamsuren started her embroidered products retail business in 2008 by renting a counter in a market. Now that her business is stable enough, she wants to expand it by renting another counter. However, she doesn't have enough supplies to support having another counter. Therefore, she's requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy more supplies.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her embroidered products retail business.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 6 children. 

Jimmy is providing tracking or multipurpose cab services. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools & to pay for the gasoline for vehicle maintenance.

Jimmy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & to pay for the gasoline for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, con la mejor disposición solicita otro préstamo, para continuar fortaleciendo el negocio y esperando que los próximos meses sean de más provecho para ella, comprara blusas, faldas, vestidos de fiesta, camisas formales, y ropa interior.
Su proyección es en estos meses generar mayores ventas, pues esta época es cuando más se vende en prendas de vestir; ella considera que estos préstamos han aumentado su variedad en el negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is fully prepared to request another loan to continue strengthening her business, hoping that the coming months will be more worthwhile for her.  She will buy blouses, skirts, party dresses, formal shirts, and underwear.

Her projection for these months is to generate more sales, since this season is when she most sells clothing.  She considers that these loans have increased her variety in the business.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, party dresses, shirts, and underwear.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, aged 27, is a single man who runs a photo studio that has been in operation for eight years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 18,000.

This is his fifth loan with KADET Ltd and he has a good credit history.  He will use the funds to buy a digital camera and a computer.  Peter hopes to own a studio lab in the future.

loans.use: buy a digital camera and a computer

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Juana, sigue laborando, para el bienestar familiar, en gestion de carga, desde hace seis años, junto a su esposo han logrado mejoras  a su vivienda, el cual ha sido posible a corto plazo con los financiamientos que han obtenido en Afodenic.
Con esta nueva solicitud, podra terminar de cerrar el bajarete que le falta en la parte de atrás, ya que en tiempo de invierno se le llena de agua, lo que comenzara desde la pared, y terminar con esta obra. Materiales a comprar, laminas de zinc, perlines, golosos, cemento, arena, tubos y soldadura. El cual esta contenta por lograr cada dia, mejor seguridad y comodidad en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Doña Juana is in charge of her family and continues to look after their welfare. For the past six years, she and her husband have been making improvements to their home. This has been made possible as a result of the short-term loans they have obtained from AFODENIC.

With this new loan, she will finish enclosing the patio in the back because it fills up with water during the winter. She started by having a wall built, but the remaining work needs to be completed. Juana will buy zinc sheeting, crossbeams, screws, cement, sand, tubing, and welding supplies. Each day she is pleased that her home will be safer and more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting, crossbeams, screws, cement, sand, tubing, and welding supplies.

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
This is Gliceria, 60, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Policarpio, her business partner and father to her child. She and her husband together manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gliceria operates a variety store. In the Philippines a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Gliceria hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es una madre soltera cabeza de hogar de sus 2 hijos de 12 y 16 años de edad, a quienes siempre ha buscado brindarles una buena calidad de vida y una calidad de buena educación. Gracias a que tiene experiencia trabajando en panaderías, quiere aprovechar esto y montar su propio negocio en el cual pueda ofrecer a sus clientes diversos alimentos, bebidas calientes, gaseosas entre otros y así tener una mejor fuente de ingresos para su hogar. Debido a problemas de salud hace unos días que no ha estado trabajando y esto se ha visto reflejado en la economía de la familia, sin embargo ahora que esta recuperada busca que un préstamo le permita comprar una vitrina para los panes, la greca, la freidora y demás productos que ofrecerá.

Así podrá iniciar su negocio lo más rápido posible y continuará generando los ingresos que requiere en su hogar. Su sueño es sacar su negocio adelante el cual le permita ofrecer a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida.

loans.use: Comprar una vitrina para los panes, la greca, la freidora y demás productos que ofrecerá.

loans.name: Angellina

texts.en: Angellina is 52 years old and widowed with two children, ages 21 and 25. She runs a cafeteria to earn a living. She has been in the business since 2008.  She has employed one person in the business. She also does poultry farming for more income generation. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money because she has been trained in financial management. Angellina has requested for 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He is a 30-year-old married man living in a company house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is an employee of a tea company, where he works as an electrician, and he is the only breadwinner for his family. His challenge is price fluctuations and inflation. His dream is to educate his children and complete building his own house. Godfrey needs a loan to buy iron sheets for his residential house.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets.

loans.name: Benitez De Fe Group

texts.es:
Una familia entera que deposito toda su confianza a VFMexico desde hace ya muchos años, ellos cambiaron de domicilio su angustia era que en su nuevo hogar no tenfrian la posibilidad de contar con el apoyo de la institución, “Cuando nos informaron que cercas de nuestro nuevo domicilio una sucursal de VFMexico nos podría seguir apoyando nos dio mucha alegría y de inmediato decidimos iniciar cono los tramites” comento muy contenta Isabel.
Ellos vivían en la cuidad pero por decisiones personales decidieron mudarse a un municipio tranquilo, con mucha estabilidad, dicho lugar se caracteriza por tener una iglesia católica enorme que sus feligreses acuden a misa en fiestas patronales o todos los domingos, además ahora la familia vive más tranquila en dicho lugar y les agrada porque poco a poco están haciendo amigos nuevos.
Guadalupe Isabel es muy amable, cordial pero sobretodo muy trabajadora, platica que desde muy temprano inicia con sus labores de todos los dias, además de su espíritu emprendedor que la caracteriza dicen que siempre le gusta particiapar en las convivencias del municipio.
 Isa como le llaman sus vecinos y familiares tienen 27 años de edad esta casada con el señor, Eduardo juntos han formado una familia con dos hijos quienes estan estudiando su educación primaria y otro en el preescolar.
 Isa desde pequeña a lado de su mamá Isabel aprendió que los negocios son muy buenos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos, asi que decidio iniciar con la elaboración de tortillas echas a mano,  dicho alimento se obtiene del maíz que se cosecha en las comunidades aledañas del municipio, se hace una preparación que se llama nixtamal, para después llevarla a un molino y asi obtener masa para inicar con la elaboración de las tortillas.
En la tortillería le iva muy bien pero tiempo después de 10 años que  las tortillas fueron su negocio, Isa decide dejar el comal y la prensa por un mostrador, fue asi como emprende una pequeña tienda de abarrotes ahora tiene un año seis meses con su pequeña tienda tienda aunque su sueño es poderla invertir en una gran cremería, platica que le va muy bien ahora con su préstamo comprara mas producto de abarrotes como, leche, azúcar, refrescos, jugos, productos enlatados, detergente pero comprara productos de cremería como quesos, jamón, leche, yogures, etc.
Platica que cada vez recibe su préstamo lo aprovecha al máximo y trata siempre de surtir de todo cuanto pueda para que durante algún tiempo no se preocupe por surtir su pequeña tienda de abarrotes.
Ella esta muy agradecida con el préstamo porque dice que gracias a sus prestamos ha podido hacer crecer su necio sin ningún problema, sus hijos continúan sus estudios sin niguna dificultad, Aunque realmente uno de sus sueños es hacer crecer su necio hasta conseguir que la pueda convertir en un minisúper.
Los integrantes del grupo son Isabel invertirá en maíz y harina para tortillas, Heriberto en una cremería e Hilario en harina para tortillas.

loans.use: comprara leche, azúcar, refrescos, jugos, productos enlatados, detergente pero comprara productos de cremería como quesos, jamón, leche, yogures, etc.

loans.name: Gursel

texts.en: Gursel H. is 42 years old. He is married and has three children. Gursel has graduated transport shool and has worked as a bus driver for more than twenty years. In 1998 he buys an old bus repairs it and starts own transport business. Mow he has four buses and transports people from Kardjali to the villages in the area. Gursel need a $ 2 000 loan to repair one of his buses.

loans.use: To repair one of his buses.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Mrs. Lopez hopes to cover family expenses. Her husband is a bricklayer, but she tells us that the family needs more income, which is why she's been selling sandals, accessories, and clothes for the past 10 years. She says, "For me, it's very important that we don't lack basic needs in the house, so I sell in the popular areas of the city, or outside my house. I would like $800 of support to buy merchandise at volume to increase my sales and receive a bit more money. That way, I can worry less about our monthly expenses."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

La intención de la Sra. L. es contribuir con el gasto familiar, su esposo tiene el oficio de albañileria pero ella nos cuenta que no es suficiente la entrada de dinero, por eso ella lleva 10 años dedicándose a vender sandalias, accesorios y ropa. "Para mi es muy importante que no falte lo básico en la casa es por eso que yo vendo en las colonias populares de la cuidad o afuera de mi casa, quisiera que me apoyaran con $800.00 dlls para comprar mercancía en mayor volumen para lograr subir mis ventas y sacar un poco mas de dinerito, para así quitarme la preocupación que tengo cada mes con los gastos de la casa".

loans.use: Buy sandals, accessories, and clothes.

loans.name: Mardiah

texts.en: Mardiah is 26 years old and is married.  She has one daughter.  Her husband,  A. Marjaya, has a scrap material business. Mardiah and her family live in Sepatan in the Tangerang District. To supplement her husband’s income, Mardiah sells household goods such as sugar, coffee, soap, washing powder, toothpaste and other toiletries in a small store in front of her house. She also sells vegetables by going around her village on foot with a bamboo tray. In a day Mardiah can earn $5. She needs a loan of $50.  With this loan, she can buy more vegetables and thus more or less double her income. Mardiah very much wants to earn more money for her daughter's education and to give her a better life than what she grew up with.

loans.use: to buy more goods

loans.name: Fa

texts.en: Fa is a hard working woman of thirty eight. She is married with four children but sadly misses one because he passed away. He was her eldest son and was the first one to go away. So, from a family of five, Fa runs her BBQ business to help out with family needs. Only one of her children is still attending school and the other two are helping her out with the business. She uses her loan to buy stuff needed for her business. Fa has devoted her time whole heartedly in what she is doing. She earns $120.00 profit a day from selling her BBQ. To her, it is fun selling her BBQ everyday nearby the road in front of her house. Fa really appreciates the help she gets from SPBD for lending her the money that makes everything for her business possible.

loans.use: Fa would like to buy freezers to make her BBQ more elegant.

loans.name: Tamella

texts.en: Tamilla lives in the Beylagan district of Azerbaijan.  She is married and has no children. She has been running her trading counter in the market for several years. She applies for $1100 to buy goods from the wholesale market to help her business in wedding season.

loans.use: to increase volume of inventory

loans.name: Ni Wayan Twi

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Twi aged 50 lives with her husband I Wayan Sidia lives in their modest home in a hindu town South Bali. They have 4 children who all now lives separately with their own family. Their home is made out of hollow brick and rough cement. To face their daily lives, Ni Wayan Twi works on farming pigs. With her current capital she has 2 pigs, which she sells after 4 months for each around Rp. 250.000 to Rp. 300.000. However this is barely sufficient to buy pig feedings on top of their daily expenses which is around Rp. 20.000. After receiving training and finance from Dinari, Ni Wayan Twi intends to grow her business. She intends to buy piglets and build a bigger pig sty. She estimates that her piglets outputs will increased by 8-10. And with the training provided, she will be able to gain more profit. She has also made plans on saving and paying back her loans. Ni Wayan Twi hopes that her business will be succesful.

Translated from Bahasa by Bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Wayan Twi, 50 tahun, tinggal bersama suaminya, I Wayan Sidia, dirumahnya yang sederhana di sebuah desa Hindu di Bali Barat. Mereka memiliki 4 orang anak, namun saat ini keempat anaknya sudah berkeluarga dan tinggal dengan keluarganya masing – masing. Rumah mereka semi permanen, terbuat dari dinding batako dan lantai semen kasar. Untuk mencukupi kebutuhan hidup sehari – hari, Ni Wayan Twi menekuni usaha beternak babi. Dengan modal yang dimilikinya sekarang, 2 ekor anak babi, Ni Wayan Twi bisa menjualnya setelah dipelihara 4 bulan. Per ekor dijual dengan harga Rp. 250.000.- s / d Rp. 300.000.- Hasil tersebut dirasakan sangat minim, karena masih harus dikurangi dengan biaya pakan dan juga harus memenuhi kebutuhannya sehari – hari yang mencapai Rp. 20.000.- Setelah mendapat pembinaan cara beternak babi yang baik dari yayasan Dinari, Ni Wayan Twi ingin meningkatkan usahanya. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, Ni Wayan Twi berencana untuk membeli seekor induk yang sudah siap dikawinkan. Untuk itu, ia juga menggunakan pinjaman untuk membangun kandang baru yang lebih baik dan besar untuk anak babinya nanti. Dengan menambah populasinya, perhitungan Ni wayan Twi, induk babinya akan beranak 8 s / d 10 ekor. Dalam perawatan dan pemeliharaan selama 4 bulan, penjualan babinya akan mendapatkan hasil yang lebih banyak dari sebelum ia mendapat pelatihaan dan pinjaman modal. Ni Wayan Twi juga sudah memperhitungkan untuk menyisihkan keuntungan yang ia akan dapatkan untuk modal dan juga untuk mengembalikan pinjamannya nanti. Ni Wayan Twi berharap usahanya akan sukses, pinjamannya bisa dilunasi dan ia akan bisa mandiri dengan usahanya

loans.use: Membeli induk dan membuat kandang - Buying piglet and building a pig sty

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
This is 24 year-old Flora M.. She is married to husband Alnord and has one daughter, Monica, who is 7 years old. Flora runs a shop in the rural town of Mlandizi, on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam, where she sells general groceries, such as oil, rice and vegetables and other small items. She requires a loan of $300 to expand the business by purchasing additional stock. Flora thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.pSELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her shop.

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Maria Julia and Angelica have been members of the community bank “Maria Antonieta” for one year, and Gloria has been a member for three. Maria Julia is 37 years old and Gloria is 30. They both live with their partners and have two children. Angelica is 23 and single.

Maria Julia has owned a grocery store in the small town of Ambarmarca for the last two years. She sells milk, sugar, fruit, vegetables, and beans. Angelica has been traveling around the town selling carrots, squash, celery and lemons from a cart for the past 12 years. Gloria has a stand in the Nery Garcia market where she has been selling chili peppers, garlic, and squash for ten years.

Their loans are for de 600 soles, 200 soles, and 1800 soles (3 soles = $1) respectively, which will be invested in buying milk, sugar, fruit, vegetables, beans, corn, and corn meal. Maria Julia, Angelica, and Gloria plan to continue saving. Eventually Angelica would like to open a store and stop moving around as much.

In their bank they feel relaxed and are able to forget their problems. The dreams of Maria Julia and Gloria are to buy their own house. Angelica hopes to prove herself by paying off her loan on time.

loans.use: Their loans are for de 600 soles, 200 soles, and 1800 soles (3 soles = $1) respectively, which will be invested in buying milk, sugar, fruit, vegetables, beans, corn, and corn meal.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Mrs. Janet O. is 40 years old, is married and has 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells charcoal and has been in business since 1999. She has been a LAPO member. She needs a loan of $850 to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ndella

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ndella T., 39 years old, has been a member of the Ngollard village Bank for 5 and a half years. She has benefited from 11 loans, which were all repaid without problems. She plans to raise cattle and sheep, a business in which she is well-equipped for. The income drawn from her business will allow her to maintain her household. To promote this business, she is asking for this loan, and proposes to repay it at the end of 6 months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mme Ndella T., agée de 39 ans est membre du Banc villageois de Ngollard depuis 5 ans et demie. Elle a bénéficié de 11 prêts qui ont été remboursés sans problème. Elle envisage de faire l’embauche bovine et ovine,une activité pour la quelle elle a une bonne expérience. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent d'entretenir son foyer. Pour promouvoir son activité, elle sollicite ce prêt et propose de rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy animals and food products

loans.name: Mwashamba's Tuvumiliane Group

texts.en:
Mwashamba is 23 years old, and married. She began her business in 2007, and works daily from 7:30 AM to 8 PM at night. She earns around $170 a month from her sales.

Mwashamba now is requesting a loan to increase the number of items she stocks in her business. She will also share the money from the loan with her sub-group members, all who run their own small businesses as well.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is business-focused and very determined to increase her business and to lift her family above poverty. Esther is 40 years old, and she is married with 4 children. She owns a small store where she sells foodstuffs and provisions. She has been in this business for 10 years. She needs a loan of $350 to buy more foodstuffs and provisions to meet the demands of her customers and also to serve them better. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and provisions

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia B. is a wife of M.. She lives in a small city named Arifwala in Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house. She is a mother of three children, two sons and one daughter. Her first son, Awais, is in the 3rd standard grade. Her second son, Waqas, is in the 2nd standard grade. Razia’s daughter is named Nargis. She is 14-years-old and does not go to school. Razia’s husband is a trader by profession. He has been in this profession for the last 20 years. He buys livestock from different cities and sells them to the customers. Therefore, Razia has applied for this loan for her husband’s livestock business.

She has been joined in her group by a few more members. Latifan B. wants a loan to repair her vehicle, an auto-rickshaw. Anwari B. wants a loan for her stove business. Anwari B. wants a loan for her shoe cart business. Rubina B. wants a loan for her fruit cart business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T. is 33 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2003 when she was only 28. When TYM Fund was expanded in her area, Mrs. T. and her husband decided to join T. Fund so that she could take out a loan to invest into her business- selling eggs. She is now T. regular supplier of eggs for ten restaurants. Besides selling eggs wholesale, Mrs. T. also sells them retail at her home. About 400 eggs from ducks and 300 eggs from chickens are sold daily, which generate a daily profit of 150.000 VND. Her family’s income thus has been relatively stable. Mrs. T. has two children, who are still in school. Both of them are very diligent and well-behaved, and thus are a source of motivation for their parents. In T. next loan level, Mrs. T. wishes to borrow 19 millions VND ($ 1,125.00) to continue investing into her business. Her family’s monthly income is 6 millions VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị T. 33 tuổi, Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003 lúc đó chị con rất trẻ 28 tuổi.
