Khi Quỹ Tình Thương triển khai trên địa bàn chị đã bàn bạc với chồng tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn, khi vay vốn chị đã đầu tư vốn vào buôn bán trứng gia cầm, hiện nay chị đang giao cho 10 quán ăn thường xuyên, ngoài ra chị còn bán lẻ tại gia đình, bình quân mỗi ngày gia đình chị bán 400 quả trúng vịt lộn và 300 quả trứng gà, thu nhập từ việc buôn bán mỗi ngày gia đình chị lãi 150.000đ. Kinh tế gia đình chị tương đối ổn định, 2 con chị đều đang trong độ tuổi đi học, các con chị ngoan và học giỏi đấy cũng chính là nguồn động viên anh chị trong làm ăn. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán trứng.

Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in food business

loans.name: Acuario Rsr Group

texts.es:
RSR Aquarius is a group consisting of 12 members, all of whom are women. The RSR Aquarius group was formed by people who formerly belonged to the RSR Roses group, which lamentably did not finish perfectly as they did not meet some quotas, but which were ultimately covered by the partners. Aquarius RSR enters its second cycle fulfilling the quotas taken in the first cycle with much honesty and punctuality. Many of the ladies work in travelling food and merchandise sales, and some have their own stations. They each hope to be able to obtain an individual credit working with Kiva partner AGROCAPITAL.

Maruja has sold salchipapas, a type of fast food that consists of thinly sliced pan-fried beef, for 19 years. Eleuteria is an assistant in a restaurant, Juana has been selling salt for 3 years, Luzmila has been weaving for 9 years, Victoria has been chauffeuring for 2 years, Elena is an attendant in a grocery store, Francisca has maD. knitwear for 2 years, Alejandra sells candies, Salome sews bedspreads, Cecilia has owned her grocery store for 12 years, Isidoro sells beer, and Maria has had her grocery store for 6 years.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Grupo conformado por 12 personas 100 % MUJERES. El grupo Acuario RSR es creado con personas D. un grupo anterior llamado las Rosas D. RSR, que lamentablemente no terminaron con un cierre excelente falto algunas cuotas D. las cuales las socias que actualmente forman el grupo cubrieron. Acuario RSR entra a su segundo ciclo cumpliendo con mucha honestidad y puntualidad las cuotas que se llevo en un primer ciclo. Muchas D. las señoras trabajan con venta D. víveres y mercadería donD. ambulan y algunas tienen puestos propios. La esperanza D. cada una D. ellas es poder, obtener un crédito individual en el cual puedan trabajar con AGROCAPITAL.

Maruja se dedica al a venta D. salchipapas desD. hace 19 años, Eleuteria es ayudante D. una broasteria, Juana venD. sal desD. hace tres años, Luzmila hace tejidos desD. hace nueve años, Victoria en chofer desD. hace dos años, Elena atienD. una tienda D. abarrotes, Francisca teje chompas desD. hace dos años, Alejandra venD. dulces, Salome costura colchas, Cecilia tiene su tienda D. abarrotes desD. hace 12 años, Isidoro venD. cerveza y Maria tiene su tienda D. abarrotes desD. hace 6 años.

loans.use:
Operating Capital
Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Orlando José

texts.es:
Don Orlando, at his 40 years of age, has managed to have his own transportation business. He has his own taxi, which he obtained with a loan from an car agency of the cooperative that he inhabits in the Central America colony. He and his wife have two beautiful children of 6 and 3 years of age, which already go to school. His wife is a housewife. With the loan request that he is making, he will buy wheels for the taxi and thus prevent the taxi from deteriorating and also give good service to the client. Long-term he hopes to obtain another taxi in order to have a better income, since he would work one and rent the other. He also hopes to always have his health and the money to be able to give the necessary education to his children.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Orlando a sus 40 años de edad ha logrado tener su propio negocio que es de transporte, él tiene su propio taxi, lo cual obtuvo con crédito en una agencia de vehiculo por parte de la cooperativa, el habita en la colonia Centroamérica, su esposa le tiene dos hermosos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad, los cuales ya van a clases, su esposa es ama de casa. Con la solicitud que esta haciendo es para comprar llantas al taxi y así permitir que éste no se deteriore, y también darle un buen servicio al cliente. A largo plazo es obtener otro taxi para así tener mejores ingresos, ya que uno lo trabajaría el y el otro lo alquilará. Poder tener siempre la salud y el dinero para poder dar los estudios necesarios a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy wheels to maintain his taxi.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando trabaja como chofer asalariado en el Trufi 88 (Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa), su esposa es operaria en un taller de costuras,con ambas ocupaciones pueden cubrir los gastos familiares. La familia paga el alquiler de una casa ubicada en la zona Villa Ingavi de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito será usado para que Rolando adquiera otra herramienta de trabajo (vehículo  a medio uso que servirá como taxi), misma que será de su entera propiedad, lo que le permitrá incrementar sus ingresos económicos.

Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, su buen comportamiento de pago le permite acceder a otro prestamo.
texts.en:
Rolando works as a salaried driver in the Trufi 88 (Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa). His wife is an operator in a clothing factory; with these occupations they are able to cover the family expenses. The family pays to rent a house located in the zone Villa Ingavi in the city of El Alto. The loan would be used for Rolando to acquire a different working tool (a vehicle to be used in service as a taxi). This would be entirely his own property, which would permit him to increase his income. This is his second loan with IMPRO; his good payment history permitted him to continue with another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a taxi

loans.name: Najjuma Mwaijuma, Kweyamba Group

texts.en:
Mwaijuma N. is a member of Lugazi Kweyamba Women’s Group. She has a retail shop selling soda, juice, and mineral water in Namawojjolo on the Kampala - Jinja road. She employs a total of 3 boys and girls to do the running around with cold water and juice to sell to passengers in the stopped vehicles. Hence the more drinks she has, the more will be sold by her workers.

The loans have always helped her in stocking more drinks for sale, hence more profits. Mwaijuma needs a loan to buy more soda, mineral water, and juice for her shop. Her dream is to own a much bigger shop with more soda, mineral water, and juice plus other goods like sugar, maize flour, soap, salt, and many others.

loans.use: to stock her shop with more soda, mineral water, and juice for re-sale

loans.name: Rosa Alvina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Paraíso”, ubicado en el Jr. Ricardo Palma Mz. J Lt. 2, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de la pesca. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de frutas. Tiene 6 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de golosinas en casa. Todos los días vende en el patio de su hogar, brindando buena atención a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 6 cajas de galletas de diferentes marcas, 2 cajas de chocolates, 3 bolsas de chizitos, 5 tiras de chupetín, etc.

Rosa es una mujer que le gusta trabajar por el bienestar de su familia. Agradece al banco comunal por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the El Paraiso Community Bank, located at Jr. Ricardo Palma Mz. J Lt. 2, in the district of Yarinacocha, province of Coronel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of 5 grown children. Her husband works as a fisherman. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300 she decided to invest in the sale of fruit. She has worked with the community bank for 6 years. Currently she works selling candy and snacks from her house. Everyday she sells from the patio of her residence, offering excellent service to her customers. With this loan of S/. 2,500, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 6 boxes of different brands of cookies, 2 boxes of chocolates, 3 bags of snack food, 5 strips of lollipops, etc. Rosa is a woman who enjoys working for the wellbeing of her family. She is grateful for the help offered by the community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 6 boxes of different brands of cookies, 2 boxes of chocolates, 3 bags of snack food, 5 strips of lollipops, etc.

loans.name: Dib

texts.en:
Dib is a 27-year-old man who lives in Tyre in southern Lebanon with his wife and their daughter. He has been working in agriculture since 2001. He plants vegetables such as tomatoes, cucumbers, white beans, and cabbage. Dib has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars in order to purchase furniture for his house. This is the first time that Dib has requested a loan.

Dib wants to improve his monthly income and has also moved to a new area. His clients are wholesalers. In the future, he plans to create a private project.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his house

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah N. is 56 years old. She is married with four children. At the moment, two are still in the junior high school and the rest are independent. She is a local manufacturer of palm oil and has sells grocery products for the past fifteen years to take care of her family. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. The palm oil is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil. Palm oil is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale due to capital inadequacy to buy machines for the processing.

In addition to her palm oil business, she also operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, biscuits, evaporated milk, etc. in the community where she lives. She says this has also slowed down due to current food prices in the world market. She wants to use the loan to buy more palm nuts to increase her efficiency to produce in larger quantities, and for the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, biscuits, and other canned foods so that she can produce daily and supply her customers on regular bases. Hannah again believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support her husband to provide food and finance her children’s education. Hannah belongs to a village bank called ‘Yonkodo’, which means 'best of friends'. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make her business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts fruits and grocery products to restock her inventory.

loans.name: Mrs. Seng Un Chey Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people living in Hong Chhouk village in Kampong Chhnang province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. S. Un C., the 48- year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns  land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. She is requesting a loan to buy water melon seeds and fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Pol Pich, is a farmer to help his wife’s work. Mrs. S. Un C. has three children, one of whom is employed in garment factory while the others are attending the local school. 

Thirteen members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Buy water melon seeds and fertilizer to increase crop production

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Mrs. Milagrosa B. is one of the active members of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in Barangay Landing, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, a section known by the name of PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People). She was recognized July 11, 2005. She is married and has five children, and all of them are already married. She has a small Sari-Sari Store at their residence which she started with the capital lent from the Cooperative amounting to PHP 3,000.

She is grateful that she became a member of Paglaum because of their products and services offered to the community that can help those who are in need. She was very interested in the insurance benefits especially at her age. As of now, she’s on her sixth loan amounting to PHP 7,000, granted for additional purchased of basic grocery items for her Sari-Sari (variety) store, such as canned goods, assorted noodles, seasonings, laundry and bath soap and many others suitable for household needs. Now her business is growing compared to before when she has only a small amount of capital. Through Paglaum she also learned the importance of savings.

Her hopes and aspiration in life are to expand her business for the future of her grandchildren, to support their education and have a decent home for the family.

loans.use: purchase of additional grocery items such as canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Mohammad Tamim

texts.en:
Mohammad Tamim is the son of S. H. S.. Right now he lives in district 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. During the war, Mohammad and his family were emigrated to Pakistan. After regression, they settled in their own house, which was destroyed. They tried so hard to live in that house because they did not have enough money to repair it well.

Mohammad was informed by one of his friends about the lending process, so he came to Kiva's partner AFS and requested an individual loan of 40000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to repair his house and solve his problems.

loans.use: Buying construction materials

loans.name: Pearl

texts.en: Pearl S. is 39 years old. She is married and is the mother of three children. Currently all her children are in school. Pearl trades in traveling bags, school bags and suitcases in the local market on the cape coast, which is the town she lives in. She buys her supplies of bags from importers at wholesale prices and sells to her customers at retail prices. She requests for a loan to enable her to increase her stock of traveling bags, school bags and suitcases. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase savings to expand her shop. She has been in business for eight years now.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of traveling bags and suitcase.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
“Prayer is the strongest armor when problem comes” said Teresita. She is a food vendor in their village. She used to roam around their community using her tribike (bicycle with three wheels). She is 47 years old and married to Francisco, a driver. They have three children: Jezrelle - 19 years old, a high school graduate working in a rice grain company; Jay Ruiz - 16 years old, and Jaizer Joy - 14 years old, who are both high school students.

She has managed to sell cooked foods for almost 11 years. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 as additional capital for her business which is in demand from her customers. Her loan request will help her in sending her children to school through her enterprise.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 52 years old and married with five children. She sells kerosene and engine oil. She is requesting a loan amount of N120,000 to purchase more kerosene and engine oil to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene and engine oil to sell

loans.name: Djiguiya 1  De   Kola (Koumantou) Group

texts.fr:
Composé de dix femmes mariées, les membres du groupe Djiguiya 1 du village de Kola ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et de 6 enfants. Elles  vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies. Le village de Kola relève de la commune rurale de Koumantou, préfecture de Bougouni (région de Sikasso,  république du Mali). 
Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations familiales et de voisinages. 
Pour soutenir leurs activités agricoles en ressource financière afin d’améliorer leur productivité, elles ont  décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt agricole et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 150 kg de semence d’arachide et s’acquitter des frais de labour de 6 hectares dont 2 hectares pour l’arachide et 4 hectares pour le maïs. Les semences sont achetées sur le marché de Koumantou lors des foires hebdomadaires.
Ces femmes  comptent sur une production de 1 tonne 750 kg  de graine d’arachide  et 14 tonnes de maïs. Avec une clientèle  composée essentiellement de revendeurs et de quelques consommateurs, les produits sont vendus en gros, détail et au comptant sur les marchés de Bougouni et de Koumantou. 
Avec ce prêt les femmes espèrent obtenir un bénéfice de 50 000 FCFA chacune à la fin de la campagne agricole qui les servira à s’investir dans l’élevage des ovins.
texts.en:
Composed of six married women, the members of the group Djiguiya 1, of the village of Kola, have an average age of 37 and six children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families. The village of Kola belongs to the rural community of Koumantou, Bougouni prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another by family and community ties. To support their agricultural businesses with financial resources, in order to improve their productivity, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third agricultural loan. All the preceding loans have been repaid. With this new loan, they intend to buy 150 kg of seeds for growing peanuts and to pay for the cost of labor for six hectares, including two hectares for peanuts and four hectares for corn. The seeds are purchased at the Koumantou marketplace during weekly fairs. These women are planning on a production of 1.75 tonnes of peanuts and 14 tonnes of corn. With a customer base composed essentially of retailers and a few consumers, they sell their products wholesale and retail, and in cash transaction, at the markets of Bougouni and Koumantou. With this loan, the women hope to obtain a profit if 50,000 francs CFA at the end of the crop year. The profits will be invested in raising sheep.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds for planting peanuts and to pay for labor (peanuts and corn)

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel A. is 39 years old. She was able to graduate from college but, due to a lack of job opportunities, she ended up being a school canteen operator.

Raquel sells foods at very affordable prices for student meals which helps her husband Rodolfo A. in sustaining their daily living. She is thankful that her husband is employed as a teacher but, because of their growing needs, the couple needs to work very hard.

Raquel is requesting the amount of PHP 10,000 for further improvement of her food-vending business so that she will be able to increase her family’s daily income.

loans.use: To use as business capital

location.town: Lamo Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Narayan Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Narayan Devi K. lives in Sundhara, which is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses.

Mrs. K. lives in a single family dwelling with her husband and three children. She has two sons and one daughter. Her younger son and her daughter are studying in high school. She opened her meat shop six months ago, selling buffalo meat. Her husband and older son help in the shop. Now she is requesting a loan of 20000 NPR to buy a deep freeze for storing meat.

loans.use: To buy a deep freeze

loans.name: Elias Ramon

texts.es: El joven Elias Es originario de la comunidad de Cantón ChiY.  el cuenta con su pequeño taller de Mecanica en la localidad, el comenta que en año dos mil siete se gradua en dicha profesion el decide prender su propio negocio con la ayuda de sus queridos padres, hasta la fecha todo camina de la mejor manera hoy necesita de un credito donde le servira para la compra de herramientas y materiales, para ir poco a poco a equipar su taller.
texts.en:
Elias is a young man originally from the community of Cantón ChiY.. He runs an auto repair shop in town. Elias says that in 2007, he completed his training to become a mechanic and decided to start his own business. With the help of his beloved parents, all has worked out for the best so far. Today he needs a loan to buy tools and materials so that he can furnish his shop over time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools & materials

loans.name: Hin

texts.en: There is a house where neighbors always cross by with a more joyful interaction with a good communication. There is a household grocery store, run by a strong housewife with a good relationship. P., 34, has three children, all of whom are still young. P. is married to Ly, 46, who employed as a local construction service provider in the village. The family has now gained much better income as this couple has a careful plan for its family. This year, P. and Ly are preparing to buy a new small plot of land located next to her house. This is why they have agreed to ask for a loan of $ 600. The couple really wants their children to finish university in the future.

loans.use: To buy a new small plot of land located next to their house.

loans.name: Mansata

texts.fr: Mansata Diédhiou est une femme de 46 ans, elle est mariée et a en charge 7 enfants. Avec son prêt elle développe un petit commerce de vente tissus teintés. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité lui permettent de participer quotidiennement aux dépenses de la famille. Elle participe également à la prise en charge de la santé de la famille.

loans.use: Renforcer son activité de commerce

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is married to Remielyn and they live in the village of General Balao, Solana, Cagayan. They do not have children yet, but they remain optimistic that they can have their own children in the future. This couple is working together at a hog raising business. Sometimes George works as a farm laborer.

George wants to borrow at least 4,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to further develop his hog raising business. According to him, the loan will not only assist him in improving his business, but also meet the needs of his family. He also intends to use his income to buy fertilizers for their small farm lot; thus, he is doing his best to earn a bigger income.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Wally Baba Group

texts.en: Wally Baba is the group leader of Wally Baba group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for progressing the business and making it larger. So they are requesting a group loan of 56000 Afghani. Farei wants to take loan for the business of embroidery. A. Zai wants to take a loan for a general store. Uasamen wants to take a loan for the business of bead working. Sabera wants to take a loan for her husband who sells fruit. They are very happy from this process of loan.

loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 23 years old and is single. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she lives with four people. She also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.

Margaret owns a retail shop selling dresses and dressmaking materials in Makerere-Kikoni, in the outskirts of Kampala, and doesn’t pay business rent because, she works from her home. She buys her merchandise from Kiyembe shops in Kampala and so she incurs transport costs to and from shopping. Her challenges include transportation of merchandise and the ever-increasing prices of clothes.

Margaret has been in this business for one year and with MCDT for two years and is servicing her third loan. Margaret wants to use this loan to buy more dressmaking materials. She aspires to seeing her business grow stronger and to owning a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more dressmaking materials

loans.name: Shagdar

texts.en:
N. is a 55 year old widow who lives in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. All three of her children are grown and live on their own. N. lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and operates a hairdressing salon in her town. N. graduated from a hairdressing school in 1972 and, since then, has been working as a hairdresser. She has taken out loans from XacBank five times in the past and has proven herself to be a trustworthy customer who always repays on time and in full. N. is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug loan in order to replace the styling tools and equipment used in her salon. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

loans.use: To replace the styling tools and equipment used in her salon

loans.name: Maria Beatriz

texts.es:
El banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar, está formada en la ciudad de Cuenca, es una ciudad con una belleza arquitectónica, teniendo un centro colonial, Cuenca está delimitado por sistemas montañosos, El nudo del Cajas es punto de origen de un sistema hídrico formado por 4 ríos principales: Tomebamba, Yanuncay, Tarqui y Machángara que atraviesan el valle de oeste a este, su gente es cálida, amable y siempre luchan para tener una vida más digna como muestras socias.

La Sra. María O. es socia del banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar, vive por la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 53 años de edad, se encuentra divorciada hace 20 años por la irresponsabilidad que tenía en su hogar, ha procreado 4 hijos de 32, 30, 28, 21 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos se encuentran casados y viven independientemente de su hogar, solo vive con su último hijo quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de herederos.

María se dedica a la venta de viandas, lleva 3 años en este negocio y nos comenta que le va bien o a veces solo para sobrevivir, su negocio tiene en su casa y su horario de trabajo es de 6 a.m. a 3 p.m. tiene una gran amistad con todas sus compañeras de la banca comunal, se encuentra en su tercer ciclo realizando los prestamos en la fundación y nos comenta que le han beneficiado en su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que realiza en la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR,va a invertir en la compra de materiales para su negocio como es arroz, azúcar y una viandas que le hace falta, su sueño es de salir adelante y tener un salón grande.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Futuro Para un Bienestar", is located in Cuenca, a city with beautiful architecture and a colonial downtown area. Cuenca is delimited by systems of mountains. The junction of Cajas (a mountain range) is the point of origin of a water system formed by 4 main rivers: Tomebamba, Yanuncay, Tarqui, and Machangara, which cross the valley from West to East. The people of Cuenca are warm and friendly, and they are always trying their hardest to have a better life, such as our partners. Mrs. Maria O. is a partner of the communal bank "Futuro Para un Bienestar" and lives in the urban area of Cuenca. She is 53 years old and has been divorced for 20 years, due to the irresponsibility that she had in her home. She has 4 children, ages 32, 30, 28, and 21. Her first 3 children are married and live independently of her. She lives only with her youngest son, who works and helps her economically. Maria makes a living by selling food. She has been doing this business for 3 years and she tells us that it is going well for her, but sometimes it is just enough to survive. Her business is in her house and her work schedule is from 6 A.M. to 3 P.M. She has a great friendship with all of her partners in the communal bank. This is her third cycle receiving loans from this foundation, and she tells us that they have benefited her business. With the new loan she is requesting through FUNDACION ESPOIR, she is going to invest in the purchase of materials for her business, such as rice, sugar, and other foods that she is lacking. Her dream is to get ahead in life and have a large living area.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and other food for her business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina Y. is a 51-year-old woman entrepreneur from Balubad, Silang, Cavite. Her husband, Ladislao, 57, is the village’s local chieftain. Josefina owns a general store and it has been around for the last twenty years. She earns up to P11,000 per month in net income and uses her profits to support her children. Josefina is now on her sixteenth loan with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative and has recently applied for a new loan of P10,000. She will use the funds to purchase more items to sell at her general store. Josefina dreams of improving her general store so that it becomes a big grocery store someday. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell at her store

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Mrs. Pon H. is a villager in An Doung village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a 0.8 hectare field of land on which she cultivates rice. She faces some problems because the soil on her field is infertile, and it is far from an irrigation system. So, she decided to request a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizers, a water pump, and gasoline. Her husband, Mr. Phan Puoch, is a fisherman. Mrs. Pon H. is 31 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizers, a water pump, and gasoline.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of general grocery products

loans.name: Sin Fronteras Group

texts.es:
Ángela tiene 46 años pertenece al grupo “SIN FRONTERAS”  conformado por amigas y negociantes como ella.
Cuando era soltera siempre trabajo para otras personas y algunas  empresas  dejo esos trabajos  por dedicarse a sus hijos pequeños y su familia. con el transcurrir del tiempo sus hijos crecieron y busco la manera D. ganar dinero empezó vendiendo D. todo un poco, ahora que se avecina la época escolar esta fabricando loncheras para niños tiene muchos pedidos D. ese producto por lo cual tiene trabajar muy duro para cumplir con sus clientes,  por otro lado también compra ropa por mayor y la venD. a sus amigos y familiares ellos le compran por la facilidad D. pago, ahora ella no cuenta con un lugar estable donD. poder mostrar sus productos pero en un futuro próximo ella quiere tener otro tipo D. negocio quiere dedicarse al rubro D. fiestas infantiles ya tiene el lugar adecuado en su misma casa y esta ahorrando para iniciarse en ese negocio, lo que hará con el préstamo que EDAPROSPO le otorga es comprar materiales para fabricar muchas loncheras.
  
*La Señora Ángela esta en medio D. las socias sentadas con blusa guinda y muy sonriente.
texts.en:
Angela is 46 years old and belongs to the group "Sin Fronteras" (Without Borders), which is maD. up of friends and tradespeople like her. When she was single she always worked for other people and for some companies. She left those jobs in order to dedicate herself to her small children and her family. With the passage of time her children grew and she looked for a way to earn money. She started selling a little bit of everything; now that the school season is approaching she is making lunchboxes for children. She has a lot of orders for this product so she must work very hard to fulfill them for her customers. In addition, she buys clothing wholesale and sells it to her friends and relatives. They buy from her because she allows them to pay in installments. Now she does not have a stable place where she can display her products, but in the near future she wants to have another type of business. She wants to get into the business of children's parties. She has space in her home to carry out this activity, and now she is saving in order to start up this business. She will accomplish this through the loan granted by EDAPROSPO, which will be used to buy materials to make a lot of lunchboxes. *Angela is in the middle of the seated members of the group; she is smiling and is wearing a cherry red blouse.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials to make lunchboxes

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
In this tough economy, Sam was looking for an opportunity to provide for his family’s financial security, but he never imagined that he would find inspiration while walking through the mall one afternoon.

Sam is the owner of BouncyLand, an indoor children’s play space and recreation zone located inside a suburban shopping mall. “Since we opened, I’ve enjoyed watching the families come and have a good time together. It’s nice to see that even in this economic crisis, parents still make their children’s happiness a priority. We do it all for the kids.” 

Sam, a father of two and originally from Morocco, poured his life savings into BouncyLand to get his business up and running and turning a profit. “I’m very proud of our success; especially that I employ four people in my business. It feels good to give someone a job.” Sam now wants to upgrade the play space to make it safer, but, despite his good credit, he was declined for a loan from his bank.

A $10,000 loan, approved by Opportunity Fund, will allow Sam to invest in safety improvements at BouncyLand, including new floor mats and carpeting. “There’s no limit to what I can achieve now that I’m my own boss. I’m giving kids a safe place to play and parents the chance to relax and have fun with their children. I love what I’ve created here.”

loans.use: To make safety improvements

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: EL SR. PABLO ESTA CASADO Y TIENE HIJOS MAYORES EL CREDITO QUE SOLICITA EL SR. PABLO ES PARA LA ESPOSA QUIEN SE DEDICA A VENTA DE COMIDA EN ACHUMANI SU ESPOSO LE AYUDA CON LA VENTA DE COMIDA, ACTIVIDAD QUE SE EVALUA ,YA QUE LA SEÑORA NO PUDE ACCEDER A UN CREDITO POR SER DE EDAD AVANZADA, CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD MANTIENEN A SU HOGAR Y DEMOSTRARON TODO ESTE TIEMPO RESPONSABILIDAD Y PUNTUALIDAD EN SUS PAGOS PESE A LOS SEÑORES YA SON DE EDAD AVANZADA PERO AUN SE LES NOTA CON MUCHA FUERZA, ES POR ESO QUE SE DECIDIO DARLES LA TAZA KIVA.  EL DINERO DEL CREDITO SERA UTILIZADO EN TRAMITES PARA SU DOMICILIO, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO COM EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sr. Pablo is married and has grown children. The loan he is applying for is for his wife, who sells food in Achumani, since she cannot consent to a loan because she is of advanced age. Her husband helps her with the sale of food, the business activity that is being evaluated. With this activity, they maintain their home, and they have always showed responsibility and punctuality in their payments, in spite of their being of advanced age. But it's clear that they still have much strength, and it was for this reason that it was decided to give them the Kiva rate. The loan money will be used for the formalities for their home. Sr. Pablo is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Correcting the documents for their home

loans.name: Lazarus

texts.en: Lazarus is married with six children. He has run a photography business for 24 years. He also practices farming to increase his earnings. He previously had a retail shop selling used clothes and his wife has a cafeteria. He dreams of putting up his own photo studio and hiring employees to improve his standard of living. He has requested a loan of kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy photo equipment to make his work faster and more efficient.

loans.use: To buy photo equipment

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel tiene 52 años, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de carpintería. Inicio con un hermano trabajando como albañil,  el era un hombre muy emprendedor y luchador que se le presentaban muchos trabajos, de aquí aprendió muchas cosas y así fue que él aprendió su otro oficio como es la carpintería el decidió buscar el capital necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como madera, pinturas y otras herramientas. El sueño de Miguel es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is 52 years old. His business is offering carpentry services. He began working with a brother as a bricklayer. He was a very enterprising and hardworking man, and so he was given a lot of work. From there learned a lot of skills, and that is how he learned his other trade, carpentry. He decided to look for needed capital. The financing that he is requesting is to purchase raw materials, such as wood, paints and other tools. Miguel's dream is to improve the conditions of his housing.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. V. is a married woman, 38 years old. She makes a living as a fish seller. Her husband, Say Thy (shown here) owns a car that he uses to transport  passengers or merchandise, which is a significant source of the family's income. The couple has three children, all of whom are in school or working. Recently her husband can’t earn as much as he did before because his car often breaks down. So she is applying for a loan to help her husband repair his old car. (Mrs. V. is not in the picture because she was busy when the photo was taken.)

loans.use: To repair an old car.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. María tiene 31 años, esta casada con el Sr. Ramón S., tienen 3 hijos, viven en la ciudad D. San Lorenzo en su casa propia.
Tienen una despensa en su casa 3 años, la Señora. María era empleada domestica durante mucho tiempo para una familia, se propuso a salir a delante y habilito una pequeña despensa y con el tiempo le fue resultando muy buena la actividad.
La señora María desea invertir en la ampliación D. su negocio comprando bebidas, como gaseosas, cervezas y vinos, además panificados y todo tipo artículos D. la canasta básica en gran cantidad y comprando otros productos que hacen falta.
Es una persona que ha progresado mucho en la vida y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya  y a KIVA por el apoyo que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. María is 31 years old and married to Mr. Ramón S.. They have 3 children and live in the city of San Lorenzo in their own house. They have operated a general store called La Señora” in their home for the last 3 years. For a long time, María was a domestic employee for a family. She decided to get ahead by opening a small store and in time, the result was good activity. María wishes to invest in the expansion of her business, buying drinks, including soft drinks, beer and wine, plus bread products and all kinds of articles from the basic food basket in large quantity, including products that are now lacking. She is a person who has progressed a great deal in life and she thanks the Paraguaya Foundation and Kiva for the help they have offered.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING DRINKS, BREAD PRODUCTS, BEANS, MILK PRODUCTS, ETC., TO SELL

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Mrs. Thai S. is 28 years old, and she is a villager who lives in Thnuoh village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice, while her husband, Mr. Vart Muth, is a construction worker and also makes furniture, doors, and windows for selling. Mrs. Thai S. now is requesting a loan to purchase construction supplies to support her husband's business. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Ricarte

texts.en:
Ricarte B. is from the village of San Isidro, Baggao, Cagayan. He is 47 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Ricarte operates a motorcycle transport service. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately $75 a month from this activity.

Ricarte joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a  loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle in order to provide better service. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Ms. Juliana P. is from the barangay (village) of Bolinsong, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years of age and is single. Juliana is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store business where she sells items such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and much more. She has been engaged in this kind of business for four years already and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from sales. In 2009, Juliana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Juliana is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to add her the capital of her sari-sari store business. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, as savings for future use, especially for future business expansion, and for her niece and nephew’s education. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea T. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Lea owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lea joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lea is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Phol's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Phol K. is a group leader who was born in 1982, selected by five members who are made up a group loan located in Tnaot Chrum village, TaK. province. Each member will use portion of their loan for different purposes in which it can improve their businesses. Mrs. Phol K. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family while her husband, Mr. Ra Chhan, is a construction worker. Her problem is that her husband did not have construction supplies to use. So to improve her husband’s business, Mrs. Phol K. is applying for a loan to buy more construction supplies to use. She is a mother of two children whom all are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more construction supplies

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; La socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en Chimpahuaylla la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Hilda; ella tiene 51 años de edad y la socia es viuda y  ella tiene 4 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene su peculiar carrito en el cual incorporó sus ollas y los mantiene calientitos con esas mantas gruesas que envuelven las ollas; ell lleva a vender al mercado vino canchón y sus diferentes platos de comida, ella es una excelente cocinera por lo que su arte le ha valido para mantenerse toda la vida con sus negocio de comidas, pero La socia ha comprado unas ovejitas tiernas y ahora que crecieron ella las vende también en el mercado, este negocio le está ayudando a nmejorar su economía y está pensando en adquirir unos cuantos ovinos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para elaborar sus comiditas y comprar gas.

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the communal bank “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; she lives in the district of San Jerónimo in Chimpahuaylla in the province and department of Cusco. Hilda is 51-years-old. She's a widow with 4 children. She alternates domestic duties with commercial retail. She has her own cart that holds her pots that she keeps warm with thick blankets. She brings her cart to the Vino Canchón market to sell various dishes. She's an excellent cook, and this art has maintained her all her life in her food business. She's also bought some young sheep and now that they're grown she sells them in the market. This business is helping her improve her finances and she's thinking about acquiring a few more sheep. She's asking for the loan to buy supplies for her food and to buy gas. She's grateful for the loan because it will permit her to grow her business and have a better quality of life. She promises to make her payments within the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make food

loans.name: Victoria Del Pilar

texts.es:
Victoria de 64 años, vive en una casa de caña ubicada en una zona periurbana en el Fortín Guayaquil,  tiene una papelería, desde hace años para ayudar con los gastos familiares. 

Empezó hace 6 años con una vitrina vendiendo cuadernos y plumas porque no tenia ingresos suficientes invirtió sus ahorros para vender a sus vecinos, poco a poco con esfuerzo y ayuda de sus hijos ahora tiene un papelería, trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 20h00pm todos los días.    

Para surtir mas su papelería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo papelería y cuadernos. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa e incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is 64 years old and lives in a house made from cane reed on the outskirts of Fortín Guayaquil. For years she has had a stationery store to help out with family expenses. Because she did not have enough income, six years ago she invested her savings in a display case to sell notebooks and pens to her neighbors. Little by little, through her efforts and with the help of her children, she was able to have a stationery store. She works from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm every day. With this loan she wants to stock her store with more paper and notebooks. In the future she wants to finish building her house and to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks and paper for her store.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
Leoncia B. is from the village of Lucban. She is 35 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Leoncia owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leoncia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Leoncia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As with her previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which she has successfully repaid, this new loan of 12,000 PHP will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan that Leoncia has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida Q. is from the village of Bitnong Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Aida is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Aida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling vegetables. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Aida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Aida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Aida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Bitnong Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jose Julio

texts.es:
José Julio es un padre de familia de 60 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el sector Keiko Fujimori del distrito de Manuel Mesones Muro, un distrito agrícola situado en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace mas de treinta años. Actualmente cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar algunos granos y menestras. En esta ocasión tiene instalados en su terreno los cultivos de maíz y pallar y se encuentra trabajando para lograr que le brinden una buena cosecha con la que espera sacar adelante a su familia.

José Julio desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para poder dar mantenimiento a su cultivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

José Julio es una persona trabajadora y con bastante experiencia en el manejo de cultivos. Los vecinos de su zona le consideran alguien tranquilo y responsable.
texts.en:
José Julio is a 60-year-old father who lives with his family in the Keiko Fujimori section of the district of Manuel Mesones Muro, which is an agricultural district located in the province of Ferreñafe, half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Jose Julio has worked in agriculture for more than thirty years. He now has a plot of land where he will plant some grains and beans. This time he plans to plant a field of corn and lima beans and is working to ensure that he provides a good harvest with which he hopes to help his family get ahead.

José Julio wishes to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his crop and has applied for this loan, which he will use to achieve his objective.

José Julio is a hard worker with considerable experience in crop management. His neighbors consider him someone who is quiet and responsible.

loans.use: Adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para poder dar mantenimiento a su cultivo (To purchase fertilizers and pesticides so that he can help maintain his crop)

loans.name: Aurelio De Los Santos

texts.es: El Sr. Aurelio de los Santos H. P.  él es ganadero tiene  cuarenta y tres años de dedicarse a esta actividad  es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  tres créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra ganado y este lo está solicitando para la compra de tres cabezas de ganado los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Aurelio de los Santos H. P. has raised cattle for 43 years. He is married. 

He has received three loans through Kiva partner CEPRODEL, each of which he has used to buy more cattle. He wishes to buy three more head of cattle with this loan.

The loans with CEPRODEL have greatly benefitted him, and he has managed to improve his own and his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Jemiratu Adjoa Oforiwa

texts.en: Jemiratu Adjoa Oforiwa O. moves from one area to another to sell a variety of soaps. She is married and takes care of three children. She has no educational background. She has been in this soap business for some time now. Jemiratu uses her income to assist her husband in providing for the basic needs of the family. She will add the loan to her initial capital to expand her business. She plans to reinvest her profit.

loans.use: additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: El Sr. Marcos, vive en la zona de la Urbanización de El Recreo de la Zona del Plan 3000, él se dedica a la chapería de movilidades desde hace 9 años, actualmente esta brindando servicios de chapería a los transportistas que llevan a la gente de Santa Cruz a la localidad de Porongo, por este motivo solicito el crédito ya que necesita mayor capital de trabajo para comprar macillas, arreglar su equipo soldador para abastecer a sus clientes. Su esposa es cliente antigua de Emprender y actualmente se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, tienen 4 hijos que están en edad escolar, Ellos se caracterizan por ser personas responsables y muy conocidas en el barrio, esperan ampliar el taller para poder generar más ingresos y así terminar de construir su casa para y brindarle mejores condiciones de  vida y mejores  oportunidades de estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Marcos lives in the El Recreo housing development in Plan 3000 district.  He has been in the panel beating business for 9 years.  He is currently providing panel beating services to taxi drivers who take people from Santa Cruz to the town of Porongo.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan because he needs more working capital to buy putty and fix his welding equipment so that he can serve his customers.  His wife is an old client of Emprender and currently she sells cosmetics.  They have 4 school-age children.  They are both responsible people and very well-known in their neighborhood.  They hope to expand the workshop so that they can make more income and thereby finish building their house which will provide better living conditions and better opportunities for study for their children.

loans.use: To buy putty and fix his welding machine

loans.name: Maria Ramosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Ramosa; ella tiene 55 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de jardín de niños, ella es profesora del nivel inicial que es propietaria de un jardín de niños, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de jardín de niños. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para el jardín.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria Ramosa is a member of the “Maria Elena Moyano” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Maria is 55 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business running a pre-school.  She is a pre-school teacher and owns her own pre-school.  She works from 8.00am to 1.00pm.  She would like to improve her business.  She is requesting a loan to buy materials for her pre-school.

Maria is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials for her pre-school

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 27 years old and single. This is her 3rd successful year in her business and she works from 7 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day.  Chantal owns a small business selling wedding clothes which is well-organized and known in her area.

Chantal has requested a loan to purchase more wedding clothes to sell. She will make use of the profits to reinvest in her business and ensure it continues to do well.

loans.use: To purchase more wedding clothes to sell.

loans.name: Moises Tony

texts.es: El Sr. Moisés Vive en el municipio de la Guardia, es nacido en el departamento de Tarija, hace unos 20 años  que esta en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, de ocupación taxista, su esposa con la cual tiene tres hijos, se encuentra en el exterior por motivo de trabajo se fue a trabajar para asi poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, hace un año que se dedica a esta actividad, es su primer financiamiento, se siente contento por el apoyo y facilidad que le da la institución, el destino del crédito es para comprar materiales de construcción para terminar su vivienda, es una persona joven y esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr Moisés lives in the La Guardia municipality. He was born in the Tarija department. He has lived in the city of Santa Cruz for 20 years. He is a taxi driver. He and his wife have three children. He is currently living away from home to work and help his wife with the household costs. He has worked as a taxi driver for a year. This is his first loan, and he is happy to have the support and ease of this loan. The loan will be used to purchase construction materials to complete his home. He is a young person and is very grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: the purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es:
Carlos Alfredo B. M. tiene 21 años, es soltero, vive solo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  No Tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO AMANECER se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Carlos Alfredo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Ecua-química y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener su propio negocio.

Le gusta ver películas, salir a las fiestas
texts.en:
Carlos Alfredo B. M. is 21 years old, single, and lives alone in Ventanas canton, in Los Rios province.  He doesn't have any children.

The Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) community bank is located in San Luís de Zapotal neighborhood, in Ventanas canton.  This community bank has 12 members who all work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Carlos Alfredo is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He buys his products in Ecua-química and sells his products in the same place.  He is requesting this loan so that he can sow his corn and rice.  He will buy supplies and seeds.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his work such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to own his own business.

Carlos Alfredo enjoys watching movies and going out to parties.

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds

loans.name: Lucila Yolanda

texts.es:
Lucila de 22 años, (aparece con su esposo en la foto) comenzó a ser una microempresaria ya que su papa le inculco desde joven que pusiera su propio negocio para ser independiente. 

Trabaja en la actualidad con ayuda de su esposo pero ella es la que más se dedica a su tienda en un promedio de 10 a 12 horas. En su tienda vende arroz, azúcar, aceite ente otros víveres. Ellos tienen tres hijos que aun no estudian. Po eso ella tiene muchas aspiraciones para poder mejorar su estilo de vida comprando con el préstamo arroz, aceite, azúcar. 

En el futuro quiere incrementar y ampliar el negocio y darles un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucila, age 22 (her husband appears with her in the photo), started as a small business owner at a young age. Her father encouraged her to become independent by starting her own business.

She currently works with the help of her husband, but she is extremely dedicated to her store by working an average of 10 to 12 hours. At her business she sells rice, sugar, oil, and other provisions. She and her husband have three children who are not yet in school. Lucila has many aspirations to improve her way of life and will use this loan to buy rice, oil, and sugar.

In the future, she wants to increase and expand her business so that she can give her children a good future.

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil, and sugar

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en:
Lukia S. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her sisters’ children). Lukia has a business selling old clothes.  She has been in this business for ten years, and she works 6 days out of every week. 

Lukia sells her products in a shop. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She also generates additional income through selling water and through rental rooms

The main business challenges for Lukia are seasonality and transportation. Her goal is to one day build a house.  Lukia lives in a home that she rents and has access to electricity.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es: La señora María L. tiene tres años  poniendo uñas postizas en el interior de su casa, y aunque esto surgió como pasatiempo le resulto muy útil al generar de  una forma segura y practica tener  ingresos para su familia,  debido que las uñas las pone en su misma casa no descuida a sus hijos. La señora María está solicitando un crédito con nosotros debido a que ella desea invertir en dicho negocio porque quiere brindarles a sus clientas accesorios nuevos e innovadores para que sigan asistiendo y a la vez la recomienden. Ella planea pagar este crédito con sus ingresos de operaria, y aunque es separado su ex esposo aun le ayuda con los gastos de los niños y así ella no se preocupa  tanto por los gastos de la casa y de sus hijos y se concentrara en pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Mrs. María L. has been attaching artificial fingernails for three years at home.  Although this started as a hobby it turned out being a useful, sure way to generate family income because she attaches the fingernails at home and can watch over her children at the same time.

María is asking for a loan from us because she wants to invest in said business because she wants to provide her customers with new and innovative accessories so that they will continue to come and to recommend her.

She plans to repay the loan with profits she’d earn and, although separated from her husband, her ex-husband still helps her with the children’s expenses so she’s not too concerned about her household or her children’s expenses and can concentrate on repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy women's accessories.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila P. is from the village of Tupsan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 56 years old. Leonila is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Leonila runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and beverages. Leonila has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2010, Leonila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Leonila is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods. This will be the third loan taken out by Leonila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Noberto

texts.en:
Norberto D. is 41 years old, married and has two children. His oldest child is 12 years old.

Norberto is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. He grows rice that he sells to the people in his community. He usually earns 5,000 PHP from this farming. Norberto also grows pigs in his backyard. He fattens the pigs and sells them to the market.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag, 43, is married and lives with her husband and three children in a house in Zavhan Province, Mongolia. Her two older children attend college, while the younger one goes to a local secondary school. With the help of her husband, Tungalag manages a shoe-making business that she started in 1998 after working at a shoe-making factory for eight years.

A diligent woman who is thankful to our bank for giving her a start-up loan to begin her business, she is planning to expand in the future. Tungalag is now requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more materials for her shoe-making business.

loans.use: to purchase shoe-making materials for her business

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Composé de neuf femmes mariées les membres du groupe BENKADI ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et de 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier HEREMAKONO-NORD de la ville de BOUGOUNI, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Par des relations d’amitié et de commerce, ces femmes se sont connues et font le commerce de condiments alimentaires, de pagnes, de draps de lit, de tissus teintés et de poissons avec Rokia T.. 
Dans le souci d’améliorer leur capacité d’achat afin de satisfaire l’attente des clients, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt de groupe. Le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé. 
Madame Rokia T. fait le commerce de poisson frais qu’elle a appris auprès de sa maman depuis le bas âge. Avec ce prêt Rokia T. compte acheter 200kg de poissons de mer et 120 kg de poisson d’eau douce. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des bozos pécheurs installés au long du fleuve SANKARANI dans la préfecture de YANFOLILA, tandis-que les poissons de mer congelés sont achetés de la Côte d’Ivoire. Toutes les ventes se font en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans la ville de BOUGOUNI à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Avec ce prêt le elle compte obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000 FCFA alors que les autres membres du groupe comptent sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé selon elles dans leur activité.
texts.en:
Made up of nine married women, the members of this Benkadi group have an average age of 38 and on average, 6 children each. They live in nuclear families with their children and husbands. The women live in the HEREMAKONO-NORD district of the town of BOUGOUNI, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.  

These women met because of friendships and commercial relationships, and they sell condiments, lengths of African-print cloth, sheets, dyed cloth, and, in the case of Rokia T., fish. 

Wishing to expand their purchasing power so that they can satisfy the demand of their clientele, they decided to join the Microfinance Institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their second group loan. The preceding loan was correctly reimbursed. 

Mrs. Rokia T. sells fresh fish, a business she learned from her mother when she was very young. With this loan she intends to buy 200 kg of saltwater fish and 120 kg of fresh water fish. She buys her fresh water fish from Bozo-ethnicity fishermen along the river SANKARANI in the prefecture of YANFOLILA, whereas she buys her ocean fish frozen in Ivory Coast. All her sales are retail, for cash or credit, in the town of BOUGOUNI to a clientele composed of men and women. With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 20,000 F CFA whereas the other members of the group expect a monthly profit of 15,000 F CFA which they say will be used for their businesses.

loans.use: to buy ocean fish and fresh water fish for resale.

loans.name: Luisa Inocencia

texts.es:
Inocencia es una madre trabajadora D. 61 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en la parte rural del distrito D. TambogranD.- Piura. La casa D. Inocencia no cuenta con los servicios básicos D. luz, agua y desagüe.

Inocencia se dedica a la crianza D. ganado vacuno, los cuales le producen leche diaria la cual venD., esta actividad la realiza desD. hace 5 años. Cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos. Complementariamente Inocencia se dedica a la agricultura  junto con su esposo, ellos cuentan con una hectárea D. mango, los cuales cultivan D. manera adecuada para tener una buena producción.

Inocencia solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles los cuales destinará en la compra del alimento balanceado D. sus vacas, que le permiten tener una buena calidad D. leche para venderla al precio justo.

Inocencia es una clienta conocida para Edpyme Alternativa, siendo este su segundo crédito con nosotros. Su primer crédito  lo canceló totalmente anticipándose en la mayoría D. sus cuotas, lo que demuestra que Inocencia es responsable y puntual en sus pagos.

Esta familia D. esposos trabajadores cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
Inocencia is a hard working, 61-year-old mother living with her son and husband in the rural part of TambogranD. District, Piura.  Inocencia’s house does not have the basic utilities of electricity, water and sewage.

Inocencia raises cattle that produce daily milk that she sells; she’s been in this line of work for 5 years.  She has appropriate, spacious corrals.  Inocencia and her husband also farm.  They have a hectare of mangoes that they farm in a proper way to obtain good yields.

Inocencia asks Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan which will be used to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her cows that will make it possible for her to obtain good quality milk to sell at a fair price.

Inocencia is a very well known client of Edpyme Alternativa; this is her second loan with us.  Her first loan was repaid in full paying most of her installments ahead of time which shows that Inocencia is responsible and punctual with payments.

This family of hard working spouses has very good personal references.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced cattle feed.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn, 53, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a widow and mother to two children, one married and one already working. She manages her household while operating her business. She also employs a helper in the store. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
Jocelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Jocelyn earns an income by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. Her store is open 24 hours a day, unlike other stores in the community. She also sells repacked charcoal as an alternative to LPG for cooking and she also has e-load phone credits for sale at her store. She earns a minimum of 1,200 PHP in sales every day.
To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and e-load credits to increase her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Jocelyn hopes to find a good location for her business and eventually be a dealer of grocery and other products in her community. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery products and inventory items for her variety store.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia de 44 años de edad es soltera, labora para el Hospital Asuncion como enfermera desde hace 19 años. Esta solicitando su 9no credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda, y espera seguir contando con el apoyo de kiva, esta vez para compra de cemento y hierro para hacer una plancha que servira como base para construir un cuarto en la planta alta de su casa y asi brindar mayor comodidad a su familia.  Alicia expresa sentirse agradecida con AFODENIC pues todos los creditos los ha utilizado para mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Alicia is 44 years old and single.  She has worked as a nurse for the Asuncion Hospital for 19 years.

She is requesting her ninth loan in order to improve her home.  She hopes to continue counting of Kiva’s support.  This time she will use the loan to buy cement and iron to make a slab, which will serve as a base in order to build a room on the top floor of her house.  This way she will make her family more comfortable.

Alicia says that she is grateful to AFODENIC.  She has used all of the loans to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
