For the past six years, she has been selling dry fish at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenges of high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. She dreams of owning a retail shop in the future. 

With this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase five sacks of dry fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of dry fish for sale.

loans.name: Gabriel Abelardo

texts.es:
Gabriel Abelardo tiene 20 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con el hijo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, por la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembren maíz y arroz.

Gabriel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Sin Rival y Comercial Suarez y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes .   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como plagas en los cultivos.Su sueño es tener una casa propia y un negocio propio.

En los tiempos libre le gusta jugar boly en compania de los amigos.
texts.en:
Gabriel Abelardo is 20 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and son in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The San Jacinto community bank is located in Campo Alegre, in Guare parish, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture.  They grow corn and rice.

Gabriel is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He buys his products in Comercial Sin Rival and Comercial Suarez and makes his sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Gabriel is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  He will buy supplies and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as pests attacking his crops.  His dream is to own his own home and business.

In his spare time, Gabriel enjoys playing volleyball with his friends.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Rudorico

texts.es:
Rudorico de 43 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Callayuc que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesanía.

Rudorico se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra café y caña de azúcar actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años, además de ser un producto que se consume diariamente por las personas, una vez que realiza su cosecha lo comercializa en los diferentes mercados, también comercializa aves de corral y con los ingresos que adquiere en ambas actividades  puede brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

A observar que su negocio va creciendo a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar abonos naturales para el cultivo de café, lo que permitirá una mejor cosecha, al igual que un buen producto y así podrá ofrecerles a sus clientes a un mejor precio, con las ganancias  que obtenga podrá pagar su crédito otorgado.  Rudorico es un padre de familia trabajador y responsable que se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia porque quiere que se superen.
texts.en:
Rudorico, 43, lives with his wife and children in their own home, that doesn't have basic services.  Their house is located in the district of Callayuc belonging to the department of Cajamarca. This area is characterized by agriculture, livestock and crafts.

Rudorico works in agriculture and has his own farmland where he has been growing coffee and sugarcane for 8 years. Coffee and sugarcane are products that are consumed daily by people.  Once his crops are harvested, they are sold in different markets.  He also sells poultry and the income that he earns from both activities can provide a better quality of life for their children.

Observing that as his business grows, he needs to borrow 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy natural fertilizers for the cultivation of coffee.  This will allow a better yield as well as a good product, and he can offer his customers a better price.  With the earnings, he can pay back the requested loan. Rudorico is a hard working and responsible father of a family.  He cares about the welfare of his family because he wants them to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase natural fertilizers to improve his farmlands.

loans.name: Carlos Asmel

texts.es:
Carlos, vive con su esposa y sus suegros, es padre de un niño de un año de edad, él se dedica a la venta de medicinas, inicio con el negocio por influencia de su suegro, quien es comerciante de medicinas, salen juntos a vender de forma ambulante, no tiene un horario fijo para sus ventas.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de medicamentos para el negocio, la necesidad de comprar es analgésicos, vitaminas, antibióticos, estos medicamentos en distintas presentaciones como tabletas, jarabe e inyecciones.
El propósito de Carlos es tener el negocio surtido de los medicamentos que son mayormente demandados, mejorando así el servicio a la clientela.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his wife and parents-in-law.  He is the father of a one-year-old son and sells medicine for a living.  He started his business thanks to his father-in-law, who is a medicine salesman.  They go out together as street vendors and do not have a fixed work-day schedule.

He is requesting a loan to buy medicines for his business, since he is in need of analgesics, vitamins, and antibiotics in tablet, syrup and injection presentations.

Carlos aims to have a well-stocked business so he can respond to demand and improve customer service.

loans.use: To buy analgesics, vitamins, and antibiotics for his business.

loans.name: Nyakahanga Tukore Group

texts.en:
Francis, who is 43 years of age, makes about 400,000 Uganda shillings of profits per month from his business of selling foods such as beans and peas.

The married father of five operates his business in Ntungamo food market. Francis says he has greatly achieved in the five years he has manned this business. He is not only hardworking but also a social man and this has attracted many people to particularly run for his beans and peas. Francis always thinks in terms of development, which is why he is also involved in agriculture as his other source of income.

With the Kiva loan he plans to buy more foods like beans and peas to resale.

loans.use: to buy more beans and peas to resale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 27 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Gulu region of Uganda. He is single and has no children. Patrick has a small retail shop that sells electrical items. He has had this business for less than one year.         

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase electrical items for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Patrick hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for himself. In the future, Patrick hopes to build a house of his own. Patrick is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase electrical items for resale.

loans.name: Feature Ladies Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Feature Ladies” group. They are petty-businesswoman from the city of Kenema, in eastern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs have applied for a loan of SLL 800,000 SLL for each in order to expand their businesses. In this way, they will make more sales, more profit and consequently improve their living conditions.

Hawa is the group’s leader. A native of Pujenhun, the 55-year-old is married to a trader and they have four children – three of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Hawa has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. She sells shoes, plastic bowls, clothes, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy shoes, plastic bowls, clothes, etc. in large quantity to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy shoes, plastic bowls, clothes, etc. in large quantity to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 31 years old. She is a single mother and blessed with two children who are five and two years old, respectively. She has been in a green grocer business for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Esther will use the loan to buy fruits and vegetables for her business.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hope is to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a buying and selling of herbal medicine business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of herbal medicine to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of herbal medicine to sell.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann, age 27, is a humble villager from the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is married to Chen and has one lovely child living under her care. This couple is working hard toward their dreams: they want to secure their family from poverty and develop their business more successfully for the future.  

Mrs. Vann is a hog raiser. She has been involved in this business for 4 years, that’s why she has enough skill to fatten up her pigs rapidly and avoid her pigs from illness. From this business, she typically earns about $2 per day to cover her daily expenses. 

This year Vann plans to purchase a plowing machine to use on her farm as well as to hire out to the people around her community in exchange for money. But she doesn’t have sufficient capital to buy one. Therefore, she is seeking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to add to her existing capital in order to buy a plowing machine. She would like to say thanks to all lenders who kindly help her family.

loans.use: buy a plowing machine

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda una madre abnegada de 2 hijos de 14 y 1 año de edad convive con Walter, su pareja hace 16 años. Olinda y su familia viven en la casa de su tía en el caserío de Huaylahuichan. La principal actividad a la que se dedica junto a su esposo, es la agricultura, en las parcelas de su propiedad y algunas que son arrendadas, siembran arvejas, papas y maíz. A la vez se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, los que vende a 15 y 18 soles. Olinda es una mujer hogareña, mientras Walter se encuentra en el campo, ella cuida de sus hijos y se encarga de preparar los alimentos. Olinda cuenta que, a veces en la siembra de maíz, solo recupera lo invertido, “eso se debe a las heladas y enfermedades, y por no saber como aplicar los insecticidas”, agrega. Con el pasar del tiempo ella se ve en la ciudad de Lima, viviendo con su familia, ya que Kevin, su hijo mayor, terminará de estudiar la secundaria y piensa matricularlo en una academia para que tenga posibilidades de estudiar una carrera universitaria o lo que él elija. Con éste sería el crédito número 13 que Olinda obtendría de MFP, por eso ella necesita de su ayuda para concretar sus proyectos. Lleva un buen tiempo trabajando con su banco comunal, de lo que menciona sentirse bien y cómoda con los integrantes de su grupo. El dinero del préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de arvejas, 3 sacos de abonos, lo que asciende a 1500 soles por parcela, y Olinda piensa sembrar en 2.
texts.en:
Olinda is a self-sacrificing mother of two children who are 14 and 1 year old.  She lives with Walter, her partner of 16 years.  Olinda and her family live in her aunt’s house in the hamlet of Huaylahuichan.  Her main activity is farming with her husband on parcels they own and some that they lease.  They grow peas, potatoes and corn.  She also raises guinea pigs that she sells for 15 and 18 soles.

Olinda is focused on her home.  While Walter is in the fields she takes care of the children and prepares the meals.  Olinda relates that sometimes with the corn crops she only recuperates her investment.  “This is due to the freezes and illnesses and not knowing how to apply insecticides correctly,” she adds.  

In time, she sees herself and her family living in the city of Lima since Kevin, her oldest son, will finish secondary school and she hopes to enroll him in an academy so that he’ll have the opportunity to study a university career or whatever he chooses.

This will be Olinda’s 13th MFP loan.  She needs your help to make her projects a reality.  She’s been working with the communal bank for some time and she mentions that she feels good and comfortable with her fellow members.  The money from the loan will be used to buy pea seeds and three sacks of manure which adds up to 1500 soles per parcel and Olinda plans to plant on two parcels.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and three sacks of manure.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a 33-year-old hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last ten years, Kennedy has been involved in the car wash business to support his family. He also runs a retail shop to supplement his income. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. Kennedy has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a water tank. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy a water tank for his car wash.

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
Jovie is 33 years old. She is a farmer, and her husband helps her to improve their poor standard of living. Farming is their primary source of income, which they use to meet the expenses of everyday living. Over the 10 years they have operated their farming business, Jovie and her husband have experienced a lot of struggles due to typhoons. In spite of this, they stand up, hand in hand.

Jovie is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase two bags of seeds and fertilizers and to pay someone to sow the crops. With their strong determination and hard work, she hopes they will earn a higher income in the coming season.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Marianita is a widow and has four grown-up children. 

To make a living, Marianita owns and operates a business selling clothes and shoes to the local community. Marianita has been in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,900 PHP a month.

Marianita is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items so she can expand the range of goods she sells.  

In 2008, Marianita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to expand the range of goods she sells.

loans.name: Glenda Galud

texts.es:
Glenda Galud tiene 33 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 3, 8 y 14 años de edad en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.
Es integrante de la VRC LAS BRISAS, se encuentra ubicada en las calles 6 de Octubre y Asad Bucaran Sector el hospital, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Se dedican a labores comerciales en general.
Glenda vende productos Avon, perfumes, talco, shampoo, cremas. Las compras lo hace por catalogo a los 8 días le llega la mercadería. Y Vende en el campo.
Solicita el crédito para incrementar más el negocio, comprar perfumería por catálogo. Con la ayuda del crédito y podrá invertir en los productos y obtener mejores ganancias.
El sueño es poder tener mejores ganancias y poder reunir para construir una casa. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música como la salsa y de toda música alegre.
texts.en:
Glenda Galud is 33 years old, is in a live-in relationship and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children, ages 3, 8, and 14 in Ventanas, within the Los Ríos province.

She’s a member of the “VRC LAS BRISAS” communal bank, located on the corner of “6 de Octubre” street and “Asad Bucanran Sector el Hospital,” within the Ventanas settlement. The members are general merchants.

Glenda sells Avon products, perfumes, talc, shampoo, and creams.  She buys through a catalog and the merchandise arrives in a week.  She sells in the countryside.

She is asking for this loan so she can grow her business and buy beauty products via catalog.  This loan will help her invest in the products and increase her income.

Her dream is to have a greater income and be able to save up to build a house.  She has not had any problems.  She likes to listen to music, like salsa and other happy music.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah, a 31-year-old businesslady, is married to Allan, and they are blessed with a three-year-old child. Fridah has been running a beauty salon for the past three years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

Having been introduced to KADET by a staff member, Fridah is applying for her first loan with KADET to buy cosmetics to add to her beauty shop. With the anticipated extra profit from the business she will educate her child.

Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop which will help her improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Alba Maria

texts.es:
Alba tiene 48 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada Brasilia, en la provincia de Alajuela. Por esa área se da mucho el turismo por motivo del Volcán Arenal ubicado en sus cercanías, con el bosque nubloso de Monteverde y las tierras bajas del norte del país. En Alajuela existen cinco parques nacionales, una reserva nacional de fauna silvestre, cinco zonas protectoras y varias reservas forestales. 
También en la provincia se ubica el Museo Juan Santamaría, el cual exhibe artesanías producidas localmente. Esta zona ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña.
 
Desde hace varios meses  Alba se dedica a su negocio. Ella brinda sus servicios a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad.

Actualmente Alba está solicitando un microcrédito de 600,000.00 (seiscientos mil colones), para la compra de muebles para la cocina de su soda, ya que quiere darles a sus clientes una mejor calidad de servicio, necesita solventar y tener otro ingreso económico para su hogar. 

Ella es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Brasilia S.A, razón por la cual está  muy agradecida por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Alba is 48 years old and she lives with her family in Brasilia, in the province of Alajuela. This is a touristic area because of the Arenal Volcano located on the outskirts, the cloudy forests of Monteverde and the low lands in the north of the country. In Alajuela, there are five national parks, a national wildlife reserve, five protected areas and various forest reserves.

The Juan Santamaría Museum is also located in the province. The museum exhibits locally produced handicrafts. This area is in first place nationally for the production of coffee and sugar cane. 

For several months, Alba has been working in her business. She offers services to neighbors in the community who are very satisfied with the quality.

Now Alba is requesting a micro-loan of 600,000.00 colones (six hundred thousand colones) to purchase furniture for the kitchen in her soda (small restaurant). She now wants to give her customers a better quality of service. She needs to settle and have other income for her household. 

She is a member of the “Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Brasilia S.A,”. She is very grateful for the opportunities of access that the loans provide, so that she can carry out her life projects.

loans.use: purchase kitchen furniture for her soda.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.en:
Alfonso is from Barangay, Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occidental. He is married and blessed with seven children. Alfonso is 66 years of age. His wife is a housewife who takes care of the children.

Alfonso is in the agricultural business, taking cared of a boar/male swine. People in the community request his male boar for breeding purposes. Subsequently, when the female boar gives birth in four months, Alfonso gets one of the piglets as his share.   

Alfonso raises the piglets he gets  from his male boar used for breeding. He raises them for sale to earn a living.  He has been in this business for over 10 years and earns 6,400PHP a month. Alfonso plans to expand his business because it gives him a good income. 

Alfonso joined GDMPC in 2008 to gain financial access. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000PHP to purchase pig feed.

Alfonso's plan for the future is to be able to purchase additional male swine to use for breeding.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

location.town: Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Villa

texts.en:
Villa is 54 years old and lives in Mitazan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four children.
 
Villa has a dried fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to add capital for her dried fish vending business.
 
Villa has been a member of PMPC for one year. Villa hopes to have more savings, in the future.

loans.use: to add capital for her dried fish vending business.

loans.name: Deybi

texts.es: El señor Deybi tiene 29 años, es soltero, no tiene conviviente y tampoco hijos ni dependientes, termino el colegio y estaba estudiando en la universidad, iba en el primer año pero no logro terminarlo por falta de recursos económicos, vivió con sus padres, los cuales decidieron quitarle la ayuda económica para que su hijo fuese más independiente. Actualmente alquilo una habitación en la zona de Quintanilla - Sacaba - Chapare y vivió solo. El solicitante trabaja en el servicio de transporte urbano, tiene 2 años de experiencia, trabaja de lunes a sábado, en el radio taxi línea dorada, sus principales gastos son la reparación, mantenimiento del vehículo y la compra de combustible diario.  El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un nuevo motor, ya que el actual se arruino y el cliente no tiene el suficiente ahorro para comprar uno nuevo, además de que este préstamo será destinado al pago de los servicios de un mecánico que realizara el cambio de motor.
texts.en: Deybi is 29 years old and single. He does not live with a partner nor has any children or dependent relatives. After finishing high school, he started university but had to drop out before completing his first year because of his lack of financial resources. He was living with his parents but they decided to stop supporting him in order to help him become independent. Deybi then rented a room in the Quintanilla - Sacaba - Chapare area and started living on his own. He has been working in urban transport for two years. He works Monday to Saturday as a taxi driver, and is member of a taxi network called "Línea dorada" ("Golden Line"). His costs include repairs and maintenance on his vehicle, as well as the cost of daily petrol refills. He asks for this loan in order to buy a new engine, since the current one is all but done for, and he does not have enough funds at the ready to buy a new one. The loan will also go towards paying for the mechanic who will change the engine.

loans.use: to change his taxi's engine.

loans.name: Asma Jibril

texts.en:
Asma Jibril is 23 years old. She studies at Gollis University College, faculty of medicine. She is a senior student and preparing her graduation research paper.

Her main challenge is the lack of a laptop to prepare the thesis book. She approached Kaaba Microfinance Institution for a laptop. Kaaba provided the laptop, which she can pay for in monthly repayments. 

After finishing university, Asma wants to work as a nurse.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia Kayandjieva is 20 years old. She has graduated auto transport in high school and now is a second year university student in “Public Security” subject. Being a student she has worked in her mother’s bookstore but six months ago she decided to start a business alone. She bought a booth that is situated on a strategic bus station in the city and started its business. She sells papers, cigarettes, candies and refreshments. Now she wants to install a coin coffee making machine and applies for a $ 1 800 loan.

loans.use: To install a coin coffee making machine

loans.name: Quyet

texts.en: Mr. Quyet mends punctures and operates a food processor for people. His business is not as successful as it used to be because there is more competition. The Quyet family also raises rice with an average yield of about two tons a year. After they eliminate the production costs, the profit is not very high. Mrs. Quyet) sells fruit when she has the money to buy stock.  Mr. Quyet is requesting a loan of $50 from Thien Chi Center and KIVA so they can expand open a business selling products for the home, which will add to their other income streams.

loans.use: Buy stock for home products business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Mrs. Josefina is married and has a 7 years old son. She started her beauty salon 20 years ago, when she and her husband went through economic difficulties: he had only a temporary job and occasionally didn't have an income to sustain his family. At that moment, they decided to start this business together.

Later, Roque, her husband, had the opportunity to work in the United States, and with the money he saved, they grew the beauty salon, ever offering better services.

At this moment, Josefina needs a loan of $150 that she will use to remodel her salon. The number of customers has increased and she wants to offer a quality service and a larger and more comfortable space.

She plans to pay back the loan in a period of 3 to 6 months.

Be a core part of the growth of this business. Josefina and her family sincerely thank you for your trust and help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Josefina es casada, tiene un hijo de 7 años. Ella inició su salón de belleza desde hace 20 años, ella y su esposo atravesaban por momentos difíciles económicamente, porque él tenia un trabajo temporal y en ocasiones no contaba con un ingreso para el sustento de su familia, fue entonces que juntos decidieron emprender este negocio, después Roque, su esposo, tuvo la oportunidad de trabajar en Estados Unidos y con el capital que ahorraba han hecho crecer la estética, ofreciendo siempre un mejor servicio.

En estos momentos Josefina requiere de un préstamo por $ 150 dólares que empleará en la remodelación de su local, se han incrementado sus clientes y quiere brindarles un servicio de calidad y un espacio más amplio y cómodo, ella se ofrece regresar esta cantidad en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Se parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, Josefina y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and to renovate her business

loans.name: Faasegi

texts.en: There are thirteen members of Faasegi’s family. Three of her children are attending school. Her business is mainly in bakery products. She bakes German Buns and donuts, which support her family mainly by selling them in school compounds. It is the best place to sell her goods because there are no competitors like her, which gives her the best opportunity to get a higher income. Her sale for one day is about $90 tala profit and  $300 per week. She intends to save a bit of her profit in her savings account for emergency after all her expenses have been deducted.

loans.use: Faasegi would like to buy bags of flour, sacks of sugar, oil, yeast and a frying pan for her bun & donut shop.

loans.name: Karen Yulissa

texts.es:
My name is Karen O. and I deal in selling creams, lotions, and shampoo. I've been in business for a year and the sales are going well now that I sell my products out of various private and governmental offices in our capital city. I need a bit of money so that I can buy more products and increase my sales. I need the profits to be able to feed my new-born baby daughter. I don't receive any help from her father as I'm a single mother.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Karen O. me dedico a la venta de cremas, lociones, shampoo, tengo mi negocio hace un año, mis ventas son muy buenas ya que mi producto lo vento en diferentes oficinas privadas y gubernamentales de nuestra ciudad capital, necesito un poco de capital para poder comprar mas productos y tener mayores ventas las ganancias las necesito para poder alimentar mi hija recien nacida porque no tengo la ayuda del padre ya que soy madre soltera.

loans.use: For the purchase of creams, lotions, and shampoos

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma Y. is 22 years old and married. She sells clothes on credit, and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Her husband, Amin, is a worker who earns a salary of $33 per month. Irma hopes to earn more to supplement her husband's income. She usually earns $5 per day and the profit will be used to buy more goods for their business. Irma Y. is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
This is 27 year old Naima S.. She is married to Juma, and has two children, Saidi, 4, and Neema, 18 months. Naima runs a business selling bed sheets and clothes in the semi-rural town of Tandika, about 20-30km out of Dar es Salaam. She requires a loan of $225 to purchase additional stock.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothes and bedsheets for sale.

loans.name: Denis Alberto

texts.es:
Mr. Denis G. is a 44-year-old married father of 3 underage children. His wife is a homemaker who looks after their children. Mr. G. has a business in Villa Flor, one of the oldest neighborhoods in Managua. He sells motor oil, and he also offers carwash services. Mr. G. started out with a small inventory, but it has slowly increased. With this expansion, he has been able to set up a carwash. Currently, his goods and services are in high demand, so Mr. G. needs to invest in his business, thus further expanding it.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Denis tiene 44 años de edad, casado y con tres pequeños menores de edad. Su esposa es ama de casa y es quien se encarga de cuidar a sus tres niños. El Sr. Denis tiene un negocio en el barrio Villa Flor, uno de los barrios más antiguos de Managua, él vende lubricantes para vehículos y tambiñen tiene un autolavado. Don Denis empezó su negocio con un pequeño inventario de estos productos, pero ha ido creciendo y con ese crecimiento tambien pudo poner el autolavado, actualmente el negocio está experimentando una mayor demanda de productos por lo que Don Denis necesita invertir más en su negocio, para así poder crecer más y hacer más grande tanto su negocio como su autolavado.

loans.use: Purchase of motor oil

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose I. is 39 years old, and is married with four children. She sells beef (meat) for sale. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She has been a LAPO member for a year. She needs a loan of $350 to buy more  beef  for sale.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Luz Idalia

texts.es:
Luz Idalia Lopez has been selling clothes and footwear in the market of Somotillo for three years. At the beginning it was very difficult as she did not have enough merchandise and she was often outside without earning a single cent on some days. Nowadays this problem has got better and she has stocked her business with a variety of clothes and shoes for all ages. She has achieved this thanks to Ceprodel as she has been able to obtain loans with them in order to buy merchandise.

Nowadays she again needs to get more merchandise to sell. This is how she helps to develop her home and betters her business' financial situation, which really needs this investment.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La dama Luz Idalia L. se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado en el mercado de Somotillo desde hace 3 años. Sus inicios son muy duros por el motivo de que no contaba con suficiente mercadería y vendía al aire libre en ocasiones sin ganar ni siquiera un centavo. Hoy en día ha mejorado este problema y ha surtido su negocio con variedad de ropa y calzado para todas las edades. Este avance lo ha logrado desde que se alió con Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le han dado lugar a la compra de su mercadería.

Hoy en día su necesidad es adquirir una vez mas su mercadería para comercializarla. Es esta manera contribuye al desarrollo de su hogar y mejora de la situación financiera de su negocio que tanto necesita una inmediata inversión.

loans.use: To buy clothes/Compra de ropa

loans.name: Grace's Alovera Group

texts.en:
Grace, age 40, is single with one son of six years. She has a charcoal business that she started one and a half years ago and she also began selling food two months ago. Grace works from 7am to 6pm daily, and she is able to make a monthly profit of about $45 from her work.

Grace hopes to take out a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more food to sell. She will share this loan with her group, Alovera, whose members sell fish, cooking utensils, shops, quarry, charcoal boutique, cosmetics and broilers. This group has a total of 19 members.

In the picture, Grace is sitting in the front row, fourth from the left.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more food stock

loans.name: Villa Pachamarca Group

texts.en:
“Villa Pachamarca” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari project, which provides its credit with education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and is a challenging place in which to live because it is a very mountainous area (the altituD. ranges from 2,000 – 5,000 meters above sea level), it is very cold, it is a difficult place to grow crops, and the area lacks an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems. BCR “Villa Pachamarca” is located approximately 2,500 meters above sea-level in the community of Pachamarca and the province of Churcampa. The small town of Pachamarca is at the end of a road that winds through the mountains, but the road is not continuous and, as a result, transportation is very limited.

The main activities of the people in the region are related to agriculture. The valley of Pachamarca has an excellent climate for agricultural purposes because of the relatively low altituD. and the availability of water throughout the year. In fact, the climate makes it possible to grow a great variety of fruits and vegetables such as corn, beans, tara, avocado, pacay, lucuma, banana, cherries, oranges, cucumber, carrots, and lettuce. In addition to cultivating all of the aforementioned foods, most people dedicate a good portion of their time to raising small animals such as guinea-pigs, chickens, ducks, and rabbits, as well as bigger animals such as cows and bulls.

Currently, the bank is starting its first loan cycle with 12 female borrowers and a total loan of 5,900 soles (approximately $2,100). The individual loans range from 200, 500, and up to 600 soles. As the group is just starting its first cycle, the group was not able to save money except for the initial loan to start their operations, but all of the group members agree to save in the future. The members of the new village bank have various hopes and dreams by virtue of the requested loans, ranging from their desire to be trained in marketing (e.g., how to improve their business with better marketing) and to receive technical assistance in raising small animals like guinea-pigs, rabbits, and chickens (e.g., how to avoid diseases).

One of the members of the community bank is Marcelina L. P.. Marcelina is seeking a loan of 600 soles and she has been elected the “president” of the new village bank. She runs a small restaurant where she also sells clothes and soft drinks. With the proceeds from her loan she will increase her merchandise by purchasing more clothes, soft drinks, and meat. Moreover, she raises guinea-pigs. Marcelina´s dream for the future is to utilize her farm for raising guinea-pigs and rabbits, to have a bigger (and better) restaurant, and to make improvements to her house. Further, due to her involvement with FINCA Peru, she would like to learn and to continue saving so that she can improve her business.

By way of further example, another group member is Paulina S. B., who has her own shop in town; in reality, Paulina's shop is more of a mini-market where she sells almost everything: tools for the kitchen and for cooking, all kinds of groceries, and shoes (her husband has a shoe-repair shop!). With the proceeds from the 600 soles loan she is seeking she would like to buy more goods for her shop. Much like Marcelina, Paulina hopes that her experience with FINCA Peru will teach her to save more money and to be more financially responsible in order to pay back her loan. The loan she is seeking will be used to pay for her children's education because her dream is to see to it that her children become professionals!

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies for the group members' various businesses

loans.name: Monika

texts.en: Monika Ale, 33, is married with 5 children.  She has many year(s) of experience in the tomatoes, cabbages, cucumbers and long beans. business. She sells to the villagers/public 3 days per week. She has 4 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~83 USD).  SPBD loans are Monika’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will help her to improve her vegetable farm and the other part is for her home repairs.

loans.use: back sprayer, vegetable seeds, wheel barrow, barbed wire, calvanize iron, cements,nails and fares.

loans.name: Nafissatou

texts.fr:
Nafissatou B. is 34 years old and single with two children. She has been a member of the Boucotte Est village bank for five years. She hopes to strengthen her catering business. She has a refreshment area on highway 54 in Ziguinchor, where she sells bottled and canned drinks, breakfast, and sandwiches and thiacry, a Senegalese dessert, for dinner. The refreshment area was converted and equipped for her old revenues. She would like to improve the living conditions for her family and pay for all of the expenses. She is taking out a loan that will be repaid in six months with one single payment.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Nafissatou B., 34 ans, célibataire avec 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Est depuis 5 ans. Elle compte renforcer son activité de restauration. Elle dispose d’une buvette sur la 54 à Ziguinchor ou elle vend de la boisson(en bouteille et canette), le petit déjeuner et le diner (thiacry, sandwich). La buvette a été aménagé et équipé par ses revenus antérieurs et elle veut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et se prendre entièrement en charge. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Stocking the refreshment area so as to sell breakfast and dinner

loans.name: Luz Arodith

texts.es:
Luz is 25 years old, married, and has a little girl who is attending primary school. Together, with her husband Arnulfo, who works in merchandise sales, they try to reach one goal, to keep going forward in order to give their daughter everything she needs for her studies. Luz sells vegetables and general goods in the local market, and has done so for many years now. She works all day, without a break, in order to earn more profits. Thanks to her great attention and dedication to her clients, Luz now sells items in bulk, which makes her very happy, since her business did a 360 overnight. She does not want to lose this opportunity since she worked so hard for it. Luz is requesting a loan in order to improve her location, because it is not very accommodating with all the products she has, with hopes to later rent a larger space in order to provide her clients a more comfortable experience. Support this young mother who desires to move forward, she will not let you down.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Luz tiene 25 años, casada, tiene una pequeña que está cursando estudios primarios, junto a su esposo Arnulfo, que se dedica a la venta de mercaderías, se trazaron un objetivo, el de salir adelante para darle a su pequeña lo necesario para sus estudios. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y abarrotes en el mercado de su localidad, desde hace varios años atrás. Trabaja todo el día, sin descansar, para obtener mejores ganancias. Gracias a su buena atención y dedicación hacia sus clientes, ahora Luz vende al por mayor, y eso le da mucho gusto, ya que de la noche a la mañana dio un giro de 360°, y no quiere perder esa oportunidad ya que todo es gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación. Luz solicita este préstamo para ampliar su local ya que no le es muy cómodo con todo el producto que tiene, posteriormente alquilar un local más grande para dar comodidad a su clientes. Apoyemos a esta joven madre tiene esos deseos de seguir adelante, ella no te defraudara.

loans.use: Improvement of her location, where she sells vegetables and general goods.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel tiene 31 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casado y tiene dos hermosos hijos de 6 y 9 años de edad, su esposa trabaja en en ventas en un mercado de Managua. Manuel tiene un carretón de caballo que lo utiliza en servicios de acarreo, pasa todo el día en un mercado esperando por clientes que soliciten el servicio de acarreo tiene diez años de experiencia, inició vendiendo leña en el carretón y con ahorro compró su caballo. La solicitud que esta haciendo es para construcción de la sala de su casa ya que es pequeña y quiere aumentar para tener más espacio y poder estar más cómodo, para lo cual debe comprar arena, cemento, piedra, entre otros. A largo plazo es poder ofrecer siempre el servicio a sus clientes con mejoras a su carretón ya que en el mercado son de mucha utilidad para los que llegan a comprar, así como seguir haciendo mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Manuel is 31 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. He is married and has two beautiful sons who are 6 and 9 years old. His wife works in sales at a market in Managua. Manuel has a horse cart which he uses to provide transportation services. He spends all day at the market waiting for customers. He has ten years of experience, and started out selling fire wood using his cart. He was then able to buy his horse with his savings. The request he is making is to build a room on his small house, as he would like to expand to have more space and to be able to live more comfortably. He needs to buy sand, cement and stone, among other items, for this renovation. Long term, he wants to make improvements to his cart to continue providing his services at the market as they are very useful to those who come to the market to make purchases. He would also like to continue making improvements to his house.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction on his house.

loans.name: Pasi

texts.en:
Pasi L., 35, is married with 4 children. She has 3 years of experience in the fishing business. Her husband is one of the most skillful fishermen in the village, and he helps Pasi with the business. Pasi sells to the village people and the public 2 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 100 Tala (~41 USD).

Pasi has two previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. The loan will be use to buy an extra canoe, fishing net, spear, and goggles for the business.

loans.use: Purchase canoe, fishing net, spear, and goggles

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Originaire de Hêvié dans le département de l'Atlantique, elle est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à NOUVOESSI Firmin, employé des travaux publics. Elle est mère de 03 enfants. Couturière de formation, elle exerce ce métier à temps partiel. Son activité principale consiste à la vente de produits (Fruits) saisonnier. Depuis 04 ans,elle s'est lancée dans la vente des fruits qu'elle achète à l'intérieur du pays et revend en gros à ses clients. Elle sollicite ce sixièmme prêt de 120000fcfa pour relever le niveau de son activité.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is 35 years old and originally from Hêvié in Atlantique County. She is married to Firmin NOUVOESSI, a public works employee. She is the mother of three children and is trained as a seamstress, a trade she practices part-time. Her main work consists of selling seasonal produce (fruit). Four years ago, she got started in selling fruit that she buys from inland areas and resell in bulk to her customers. She is requesting this sixth loan of 120,000 francs CFA to enhance her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 40 sacks of pineapples

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: La Sr. Fátima tiene 40 años de edad, es casada, con dos preciosos hijos de 9 y 13 años de edad. Habitantes de barrio memorial Sandino de la capital de Managua. Su esposo es de profesión pintor automotriz. Posee un pequeño negocio de frutas, verduras y ocasionalmente comida ya que no existe algunas veces trabajo de pintura y con esos ingresos ayuda más a la economía del hogar. Sus planes son construir toda sus casa para que su familia este protegida y segura. También que su negocio sea una pulpería en un futuro no muy lejano. Gracias a los prestamos de Afodenic sus planes se lograran y le dará a su hogar una mejor comodidad, la expansión de su negocio y la seguridad de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Fatima is 40 years old and married. Her two adorable children are 9 and 13 years old. The family lives in a neighbourhood known as Sandino in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. Fatima's husband works as a painter in the automotive industry and she has a small business selling fruit, vegetables and occasionally, prepared meals. Because there is sometimes a lack of painting work for her husband, the extra income Fatima earns helps to balance the household budget. With this loan, she will undertake some construction work on her house so that her family is more protected and secure. In the future, she also hopes to expand her business into a full fledged grocery store. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, her plans will be accomplished: she will live in a more comfortable home, her business will continue to grow, and those she loves will be cared for.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina B. sells a local meal popularly known as 'Kenkey' which is made out of corn. It is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country and it is normally eaten with hot sauce and fried fish at Ntsiman near Elmina. She also manufactures palm oil for sale. Sabina has received schooling through junior high. She is married and has 3 children. Sabina has been selling 'Kenkey' and producing oil since 1993. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees, utility bills and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her purchase of maize, fresh fish and other ingredients which she uses to prepare the Kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to improve upon the quality of education for her children.

Sabina is shown in the picture making the oil

loans.use: To increase her purchase of maize ,fresh fish and other ingredients which she uses to prepare the Kenkey.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo y prendas de vestir, hace 2 años comenzó apoyando en las ventas a sus sobrinos que se encargan de confeccionar ropa, y así empezó ofreciendo estas prendas, primero a sus amistades y también ahora ofrece a los padres de familia de la escuela donde estudia su hija, de esta manera tiene los ingresos necesarios para apoyar en la economía de su casa. Susana pasó un mal momento no llegaron a pagarle por sus productos y tuvo que enfrentar esta mala temporada, esto se convirtió en una lección que le ha enseñado a ser más precavida al momento de elegir a sus clientes. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y trabajando en su banco comunal tiene una actitud muy positiva frente al trabajo en equipo y a la garantía solidaria que se tiene, donde todos se apoyan y garantizan mutuamente. Con el dinero que esta vez solicita comprará polos al por mayor, cosméticos, y en especial joyas para tener en stock y ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Susana is 33 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in her parent’s home. She earns a living by selling cosmetics from a catalog and articles of clothing. Two years ago she began selling clothing that her cousins make. First she sold to her friends and now she also offers her goods to the parents of her daughter’s classmates. In this way she earns the necessary income to help support her family. Susana went through a bad time when her customers never came to pay the products she had sold them and she had to endure those hard times. This turned into a lesson for her to be more cautious when choosing her clients. This is her 2nd loan with MFP. She works with her community bank and always has a positive attitude regarding working as a team and the solidarity that they have to mutually help each other. With this loan she will buy polo shirts at wholesale prices, cosmetics and jewelry to have in stock and offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! Sauda N. is 31 years old and from Mbeya. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 3 and 14. Sauda has been running a retail shop business since 2006. Her business is purchasing basic home commodities and reselling them.

She works at the business 9 hours per day, and 6 days per week. Sauda currently earns about $120 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 525 USD in order to purchase items like sugar, soap, rice, and other basic home needs to sell in her shop. In the future, she plans to start a new business as well. Sauda graciously thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase items like sugar, soap,rice, and other home basic needs for reselling in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve her bedroom

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort T. is a single parent and has 2 children. She has received schooling through senior high. Comfort sells soaps at Elmina, which she has done since 2007.  Comfort uses her income to assist her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Comfort will use the loan as additional capital to enable her increase the sale of soaps to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to reinvest for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Comfort will use the loan as additional capital to enable her increase the sale of soaps to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Bih Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with seven children and lives in Ntamulung, Bamenda, in Cameroon. Elizabeth runs a small "buy and sell" provision store in her compound at Ntamulung. With this loan, she plans to buy five bags of rice, three bags of pig feed, and the clearing and hoeing of farm food crops for market. Her business plan shows she will invest 50,000 CFA (approximately $100 USD) of her own savings as well.
 
This will be Elizabeth's second loan from GHAPE. She has been quite successful in the past with her “buy and sell” business due to her location in the quarter and her reasonable prices. She purchases most of her products where they are much cheaper in bulk, and retails them at her store. She has a strong customer base and is confident that she will be able to increase her sales. 
 
With the profits from this loan, Elizabeth plans to send her children to school and support them after school. She will also consider buying more piglets for her pig farm. Her profits will also provide her with the security of knowing she can afford hospital bills and health costs.

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy rice and pig feed and the clearing and hoeing of farm food crops for market

loans.name: Gaby

texts.es:
Gaby es socia del bancomunal Grandioso Milagro.
Gaby es casada tiene 60 años, tres hijos de 37, 36 y 29, que están casados.
Gaby  es arequipeña, le gusta trabajar y empezó su negocio con el préstamo de Finca empezó comprando  y vendiendo  cerveza, gaseosa y con el tiempo empezó a dar almuerzo los fines de semana, viernes, sábado y domingo, así ella se mantiene para pagar los gastos de su casa.
Gaby necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, para la compra de mercadería de zapatos por docenas.
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió a la importancia de ser unidad, colaboradora entre las socias se apoyan mutuamente comparten ideas de negocio.  
El sueño de gaby es tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Gaby is a member of the Grandioso Milagro communal bank. She is married and is 60 years old. She has three children, who are 37, 36, and 29 years old and are married. Gaby is from Arequipa. She likes to work and she started her own business with the loan from Finca. She began by buying and selling beer and soft drinks. After a while, she began offering lunches on the weekends: Friday, Saturday, and Domingo. With this business she is able to pay her household expenses. Gaby needs a loan of 2,400 PEN to buy shoes by the dozen. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned the importance of being supportive and collaborative with the other members, who mutually support each other and share business ideas. Gaby's dream is to have a store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gaby needs a loan of 2,400 PEN to buy shoes by the dozen.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet O. is 43 years old and married with five children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. Janet says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en: O. Alijon is a hard-working farmer because he knows that the only way he can support and provide for his loved-ones is through hard work and dedication. Consequently, he leaves home every day at dawn to work on his farm and to look after his cattle. Alijon wishes to expand his business by purchasing young cattle and fodder for them. That is the reason that he is asking for a loan. Alijon will always cherish the memory of all those who gave him a helping hand when he needed it by granting him his request. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more young cattle and fodder for them

loans.name: Daisy Nabukalu Group

texts.en:
Daisy is the leader of four members of a group. She is 56 years old and married with five children aged between 20 and 35. Two of her children go to school. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she is living with three people. She takes care of five additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets two meals a day.

Daisy resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She operates a retail shop in Kanyanaya, one of Kampala’s suburbs. She sells to an average of forty people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week.

Daisy buys home product items from Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala, and uses public transportation to and from shopping. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last nine years. Her main challenge is the ever-rising price of commodities which affects her customers because she can’t easily increase the prices at which she sells her commodities.

Daisy has been with MCDT for over six years and is servicing her eighth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more commodities like sugar, soap, cooking oil, salt and wheat flour. Daisy hopes to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premises.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es: La señora Emerita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Próceres”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es una mujer soltera, tiene 52 años y 02 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes y con familia.Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Emerita, se siente con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emerita belongs to the “Los Próceres” cooperative bank in the district of Tarapoto, in the province of San Martin, in the department of San Martin. She is single, 52 years old and has two children who are independent with families of their own. Her character and the longing to achieve her dreams motivated her to undertake her own business. She sells groceries whose earnings contribute to the maintenance of her home. From the beginning she has grown her customer base. Today a fixed group of customers depend on her store to make their purchases. Her store has all the products a housewife would need. Mrs. Emerita serves her customers with the warmth of her character. With this loan of 1,000 soles she will buy rice, sacks of sugar, cookies, noodles, packages of salt, milk, many varieties of canned fish, cartons of eggs and personal hygiene items. She will purchase these items in order to continue giving the best service to her customers. Emerita would very much like to continue working and is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement that gives assistance to women like her so that she has the opportunity to develop and the means to do it.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy rice, sacks of sugar, cookies and noodles.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg Tomor is a 42-year-old single mother. She currently lives with her three teenage children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. All her three children are students in local universities, meaning that she pays tuition money for three children.

Erdenechimeg has a small retail business in food products. She mostly sells convenient food products, including soft drinks, wheat products, candies, etc. She has been in the food retail business since 2006 and she runs the food retail business with her sister. When she started her business in 2006, her business capital was just under 300,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT), and the current business capital has more than doubled to 800,000 MNT. She mostly purchases her inventory products from the local wholesale market or sometimes from the larger wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She requests a loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

She says that she is in middle of building a small house for her family. As the business goes well, she would like to finish off her house with the extra business profit.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her retail food business

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo is 44years old, married with 3 children; she lives in Lagos State Nigeria. She sells ladies shoes, bags, jewelries and clothes. She has been in this business for over 23years. She has been with LAPO Micro finance for a year. Titilayo is requesting for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more ladies shoes, bags and Jewelries also to expand her business to enable her meet her customer’s needs. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, jewelries,ladies shoes and bags

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chamroeun H., 47, is widow with two daughters. All of them have a full-time employment. Besides of her children, she also has her nephew is living with her. Chamroeun lives in a small village along national road number two about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chamroeun has been a cleaner since 1998. She works for a garment factory. She travels to work by her bicycle very often. But, she now wants to purchase a motorbike; it will be more easily for her to manage to work. Hence Chamroeun is applying for a loan of $1,000 to make the purchases.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to drive to work.

loans.name: Digmelia

texts.es:
Digmelia tiene 47 años, en su casa implementó una guardería, a la que se dedica prácticamente todo el día, ya que el cuidado de niños no es una tarea fácil. Las madres usualmente dejan a sus  pequeños desde las 7 u 8 de la mañana, cuando por motivos de trabajo salen de sus casas a buscar el sustento para su familia. Digmelia acondicionó la parte trasera de su casa con juegos didácticos con los que distrae y enseña a los niños para estimularlos al aprendizaje. Pero ella no trabaja sola, ya que tiene dos jóvenes ayudantes, quienes también atienden a los niños con mucho cariño. Para el futuro, Digmelia quiere agrandar su nido y contratar a otras personas con el fin de que otras madres se vayan tranquilas a trabajar mientras sus hijos están en buenas manos.
Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y ella siempre se ha caracterizado por ser puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de juegos didácticos y algunos muebles para mejorar los ambientes de su guardería y así brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Digmelia is a 47-year-old woman who set up a daycare center in her home, working practically all day since looking after children is no easy task. Mothers usually drop their children off at 7 or 8 in the morning, when they leave their homes in order to earn a living. Digmelia equipped the back part of her house with educational games that she uses to both entertain and teach the children, which stimulates learning. However, she does not work alone; she has two young assistants who also look after the children very affectionately. In the future, Digmelia would like to expand her nest and hire more staff so that the mothers can rest assured that their children are in good hands.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. She has always been noted for being punctual with her payments. With the money that she is requesting, she will purchase a greater amount of educational games and some furniture to improve the atmosphere of her nursery, thus offering better services.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture and educational games for her daycare center

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is already 28 years old and still single. She is a responsible daughter and helps her parents in supporting their daily needs through her direct selling business of AVON products.  She is persevering to succeed in the business to give her family a progressive living someday. Her family is residing in the agricultural based community of Barangay Villa Magat San Mateo, Isabela. Framing is their family main source of income. 

Christina wanted to request for an additional loan from the KIVA lenders lenders amounting to PHP5, 000. She will use the amount in purchasing more AVON cosmetics, apparels and other products that she can offer to her customers.  She believes that the more capital she will roll in her direct selling, the higher the income she could get.

loans.use: Additional capital for her personal product sales

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Direct selling is a tried and tested alternative source of income for many Filipino housewives, and Annalyn G., 27 years old, is one of them.  She lives with her family in Silang, Cavite.  Annalyn is married to Joel, 26, a maintenance worker.
 
Annalyn started with her direct selling of cosmetics and apparel only last year.  She did this to augment the meager income from the operation of their motorized tricycle.  She now earns close to P14,000 a month, especially during peak months nearing the Christmas season.  From her profits, she was able to purchase a brand new washing machine for the family and she was able to renovate their kitchen sink.  

In 2007, she joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative.  She is applying for a loan in the amount of P12,000 so she can purchase more items to sell.  

She is working hard to help her husband cover their basic daily needs.  She dreams of seeing her family living in their own house and on their own lot soon.  She dreams of having her own service center for cosmetics and apparel.  She also hopes to acquire a car for the family.

      

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en:
Dupe sells drinks, chemicals and insecticides in her stall. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. Dupe has been in business for nine years. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. Dupe is happily married with five children and she is 48 years old. She hopes to be a major drink distributor in Lagos State in the future. She is a LAPO member. She is hoping for a loan of 150,000 naira to purchase more drinks and insecticides to sell. 
She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and insecticides to sell

loans.name: Norma Lizeth

texts.es:
la sra. Norma Lizeth F. cuenta con un comedor frente a la terminal de Transporte de la ciudad de Danli,  Opera  bajo el Nombre de Comedor Mary,  es casada tiene y tiene 40 años de edad,  en su matrimocio ha procreado 4 hijos los que estan cursando educacion primaria y secundaria tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que le genera ingresos para cumplir con sus gastos del hogar y de su familia.
Actualmente ella necesita mejorar un poco su negocio para darle una mejor apariencia y tener mucha comida para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Norma Lizeth F. manages a diner in front of the bus terminal in the city of Danli. Her business operates under the name “Comedor Mary”. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children who are enrolled in either primary or secondary school. Norma has many years of experience in this type of business, which allows her to generate income to cover the household expenses of her family.

She currently needs to improve her business a little bit by giving it a better appearance and having more food to offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies

loans.name: Njeri

texts.en:
Njeri is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She has a shop where she offers printing services and also sells stationery. She has been in the business for a period of about five years with a profit of about 80000 KES a month. 

She has not borrowed from another MFI and was introduced to KADET by a friend. With his loan, she plans to buy a fax machine, add stock of printing papers and stationery and to buy other accessories to sell to customers. This is her first loan with KADET and with the profits from this loan, she hopes to expand her areas of business and to start importing cars from abroad to sell to locals.

loans.use: To buy a fax machine and to add stock of printing papers and stationery and accessories.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta B. is from the village of Nangcaan in Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a 58-year-old widow with three adult children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a general store and she grows rice. The main source of her income comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. However, she also earns revenue from rice production, too. Julieta has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to finance her rice production. This will be Julieta's 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English

loans.use: For farm supplies, such as fertilizers

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 48 years old. She is a widow with six children. She is a client of Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She sells used clothing to make a living. She supports her children’s education. She purchases her used clothing from Lagos to sell in Benin City. She has been in this business for a long time. 


She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more used clothing to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio ANSELMO, pertenecen al banco comunal “PRO DESARROLLO”, El socio vive en Pisac situado en la provincia de Calca departamento de Cusco, está a 40 minutos de la ciudad, es un pequeño pueblo heredero de unas bellas construcciones incas, aquí lugar obligado de paso para todo aquel turista que visita la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos de 27, 25, y 23 años, Nuestro socio es comerciante, el socio compra ropa al por mayor de las ferias en Cusco ciudad y las trae a vender los días de feria a Pisac, el se ubica en la feria los días martes, jueves y domingos, El socio solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio de compra y venta de ropa.

El  socio agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner ANSELMO belongs to the "Pro Desarrollo" communal bank. He lives in Pisac, located in the Cuzco department of Calca province, about 40 minutes away from the city. It's a little town that is heir to some beautiful Inca construction, and is a must-see spot for all tourists who visit the city of Cuzco. Anselmo is 56 years old, is married and has 3 sons aged 27, 25, and 23 years old. Our partner is a businessman. He buys clothing in bulk from the trade fairs in Cuzco and brings it to sell on market days in Pisac. He can be found at the market Tuesdays, Thursdays and Sundays. He is seeking this loan to invest in his business of buying and selling clothing. He is grateful for and values the oportunity being offered through this channel, and promises to repay the debt in the allotted time.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk and sell it on Tuesday, Thursdays, and Sundays at the Pisac market

loans.name: Mr. Sophat Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of thirteen people located in Preak Svay village in Kandal province. Mr.Sophat T. is a village bank president who has been selected by the group members. They all use the loan for different purposes. 

He and his wife, Mrs.Te Oran, are farmers who rent land to cultivate rice to support their family. This family has a problem in that the soil in their rice field is infertile. Mr.Sophat T., therefore, decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to increase his rice yield this year. 

He is the father of five children. Three of them help their parents to farm, while the others are attending the local public school. All the group members are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Jehova Jireh  3 Group

texts.en:
Higinio is the coordinator of his group, Jehova Jireh, and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). His group is located in the outskirts of San Pedro, a town once based on the sugar cane industry but which has more recently been in decay, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure as a single father with his child.
Higinio is excited to be taking his first loan with Esperanza and pleased to have access to capital at low interest rates. He plans to use this loan to invest in his bakery business by purchasing pre-packaged bread to sell alongsiD. the pastries that he bakes.
