He will use the profits to invest in shoes and school supplies for his child, as well as purchasing a washer and improving the floor in his home. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase pre-packaged bread to sell in his bakery

loans.name: Melvin Antonio

texts.es: Don Melvin de 26 años de edad es Soltero, trabaja como docente de educaciòn secundaria desde hace 8 años en la escuela Rafaela Herrera de Nueva Guinea. Està solicitando su 4to crèdito y espera seguir siendo beneficiado por el fondo kiva, ya que con el anterior logro satisfactoriamente  construir una habitaciòn, con este  nuevo crèdito pretende  repellar y hecharle el piso a  la habitaciòn y asì tener mejor comodidad en el hogar. Melvin actualmente se encuentra estudiando su 5to año de la carrera Ciencias de Educaciòn, pues desea poseer mayores conocimientos para impartirlos a sus alumnos, es un joven muy responsable ya que asume los gastos familiares del hogar y los compromisos  adquiridos ya que son  una familia bien unida.
texts.en:
Melvin, 26, is single and has been employed as a secondary school teacher for 8 years at Nueva Guinea's Rafaela Herrera school. He is asking for his 4th loan and hopes to continue to be favored by Kiva because his previous loan made it possible for him to build a room. He intends to use these new funds to seal the walls and lay a floor to increase his home's comfort level. Melvin is in his 5th year of studies toward his bachelor's degree in Education. He wants to learn more so that he can be a better teacher. He is a responsible young man in that he has taken on the responsibility for his family's household expenses and other family obligations because they are a very unified family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To seal the walls and install flooring in the bedroom.

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es: Doña María Vásquez cuenta con 43 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos” cuenta con un taller, habita junto a sus 2 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, Ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 8 años de laborar Cortes Tipicos  en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío la Centro, de la Aldea Vásquez, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña María Vásquez is 43 years old, married, and works as a craftswoman who makes traditional skirts in her workshop. She lives with her husband and two children. Doña María and her husband manage their business with the help of two employees who do the same work. She has been producing traditional skirts for eight years from her home, which is located in Caserío la Centro in the village of Vásquez, Department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. The demand from her customers is currently growing, but her financial condition is not sufficient to generate additional capital. For this reason, she has come to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan with the intention of buying raw materials so that she can increase her sales. Doña María also hopes to succeed for her family and provide them better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for making traditional skirts

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of  five members who are located in Krang Chheu Neang village in Kandal province. Mr. Khun C. is a 27-year-old married man and he is the leader of the group who has selected by the members. Each member will use the loan to support a different purpose.

Mr. Khun C. and his wife, Mrs. Sreypov Voeun, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate watermelon. In order to support this farming, Mr. Khun C. decided to ask for a loan to buy watermelon seed and to pay for a farm laborer to support their farm.

This couple has two children who are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy watermelon seed and to pay a farm laborer

loans.name: Juana De Fatima

texts.es:
Juana Prado de 31 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral (lugar muy humilde, rodeado de un estero) de Guayaquil. Su esposo es cobrador en una empresa, ellos tienen dos hijos de 12 y 4 años de edad. 

Juana trabajaba en una empresa pero por reducción de personal la liquidaron y se quedo sin trabajo, con esfuerzo y dedica invirtió sus ahorros comprando cargadores de celulares, soporte de celulares y un triciclo para ser vendedora ambulante en todo Guayaquil. 

Por las lluvias que ahora hay en Ecuador no ha podido vender todos sus accesorios para celulares, los compra en la bahía (mercado de venta y compra al por mayor y menor de todo tipo de productos), con el préstamo quiere comprar cargadores y soportes para celular para su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local para su negocio ambulante y también poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Juana Prado, 31, lives in a periurban area along Guayaquil’s beltway (a very humble area surrounded by a swampy marsh). Her husband is a bill collector for a firm and they have two children who are 12 and 4 years of age. Juana used to be employed by a firm but a staff reduction left her unemployed. With much effort and dedication she invested her savings in the purchase of cell phone rechargers, cell phone supplies and a three-wheeled cart in order to peddle her wares all over Guayaquil. Because of Ecuador’s current rainy season she hasn’t been able to sell all her cell phone accessories. She buys them in La Bahía (a wholesale and retail market for all kinds of products). She will use the loan funds to buy cell phone chargers and stands. In the future she would love to have a fixed location for her itinerant business and to improve the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phone chargers and supplies.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye N., âgé de 50 ans, est un charretier (caleche) de métier et gère parallélement sa boutique pour diversifier et augmenter ses revenus.  C'est depuis 8 ans que son frère lui avait acheté un cheval avec lequel il menait une activité de transport urbain dans la ville de Bambey. Il compte beaucoup d'expériences dans ce métier et a un amour très profond du cheval qu'il continue de chérir dans son métier.
Cet homme marié et pére de 3 enfants souhaitait un crédit pour acheter un cheval .
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye N., who is 50 years old, is a horse-drawn carriage driver by trade, and at the same time he manages his shop in order to diversify and increase his income. His brother bought him a horse eight years ago and with this horse he ran an urban transport activity in the town of Bambey. He has a lot of experience in this business and a deep passion for the horse which he continues to hold dear in his trade. This married man who is father to three children wanted a loan to buy a horse.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a horse

loans.name: Adjarath

texts.fr: Née en 1970 à Djougou, dans le Nord du Bénin, I. Adjarath est mariée à DJALO Mamadou et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Adjarath vit depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Ahoussa à Cotonou, avec son mari et ses enfants. Adjarath n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et contribuer aux charges familiales, Adjarath mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits (sucre en poudre, lait, conserves de sardines, papier hygiéniques, savons, etc.) à son domicile. Adjarath achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Adjarath mène cette activité depuis dix sept ans, et est à son deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Adjarath a bien remboursé son premier prêt. Ce deuxième prêt permettra à Adjarath de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter le stock de ses produits, en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Djougou, in northern Benin, Adjarath I. is married to Mamadou Djalo and is the mother of three children, all in school. Adjarath has lived for about ten years in the Ahoussa area of Cotonou with her husband and children. She never attended school. To meet her needs and provide for the family, Adjarath runs a business selling various products (powdered sugar, milk, canned sardines, toilet paper, soap, etc.) at her house. She buys her products at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Adjarath has run this business for seventeen years, and is on her second loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners). She repaid her first loan properly. This second loan will allow her to strengthen her business and increase her stock of merchandise, with the goal of better satisfying her customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell sugar, canned goods, milk, soap, etc.

loans.name: Koem

texts.en: Mr. K. is an older man whose wife appears on the photo. K. has learned a skill in building wooden houses and currently uses his knowledge to earn money. He has a few employees to help him. K. has one child still at home, while the other four children are ready married and have started new homes. He has a life partner in his wife who is a rattan cupboard maker. Recently, she received a big order from her customer but does not have the stock to fill it. Mr. K. is requesting a loan for his wife to order the raw materials to make cupboards for her client.

loans.use: To order raw material to make cupboards.

loans.name: Rowenda

texts.en:
Rowenda S. is from the village of Baclay, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 39 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she sells daily use products such as sugar, salt, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Rowenda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rowenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rowenda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Cherelyn

texts.en:
Cherelyn L. is a married woman who lives in Barangay St.Martin, Carmen, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, an auto shop and a computer games business. Her husband, William L., who is 47 years old, works in an auto shop to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between the ages of 10 mos. and 23 years old. 

Cherelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she wanted for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cherelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of 9,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of $420, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 4th cycle loan, she is borrowing 14,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital for improving and expanding her general store (sari-sari shop) and her computer gaming business so that she can continue to save up for a brighter future and for the education of her children. Cherelyn L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

To help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines, join our team by clicking on the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es:
La Señora María Cruz G. es socia del banco comunal Divino niño Jesús, vive en la comunidad de Paccha la misma que es reconocida por su hermosa naturalezal, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

La Señora. María Cruz se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y aprovecha su tiempo para hacer lo que más le gusta que es realizar sus manualidades, ella teje chompas, ponchos, gorras y todo su producto lo vende en su casa a sus amistades, esta labor aprendió gracias a una amiga y lleva 40 años en esta actividad, también cría pollos, chanchos y los vende en su comunidad.

Nuestra socia tiene 69 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad que son casados y viven de manera independiente, también  tiene una hija adoptada que la crió desde los 9 meses de edad pero ahora ya es casada y también vive de manera independiente, su esposo se encuentra enfermo debido que sufre de diabetes lo que le impide trabajar, pero con el trabajo conyugal y gracias al MIDUVI (Ministerio de Desarrollo Urbano y Vivienda) tienen su casa propia.

La Señora. María Cruz es nuestra socia hace 6 años, los créditos le han servido mucho para su hogar y su negocio de animales, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de hilo para sus tejidos y también va a comprar pollos y alimento para sus animales, su meta el crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
María Cruz G. is a member of the community bank "Jesus, Divine Child." She lives in the Paccha community, which is renowned for its natural beauty. Locals raise animals and work in agriculture. María Cruz works on household chores and takes advantage of her time to do what she likes most--handicrafts. She knits sweaters, ponchos, and hats, selling her wares from home to her friends. She has been knitting for forty years after being taught by a friend. She also raises chickens and pigs, which she sells to the local community. María Cruz is 69 years old. She is married and has three grown children who are married and live outside the home. She also has an adopted daughter she raised from 9 months of age, but she is also married and lives independently. María Cruz's husband is sick and suffers from diabetes, which prevents him from working. Thanks to María Cruz's work and the support of the Ministry of Urban Development and Housing, the couple has their own home. María Cruz has been a member of the community bank for 6 years. The loans have helped her in her home and her business raising animals. She will use her new loan to invest in the purchase of yarn to use in her knitting. She will also buy chicken and food for her animals. Her goal is to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying thread, chicken, and food for animals

loans.name: Santa Barbara Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “Santa Bárbara” es un grupo antiguo, está iniciando su ciclo número 28, es parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, cuenta con ocho integrantes, a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra una mesa directiva compuesta por Presidenta, Tesorera y Secretaria, de acuerdo a la norma de la institución.  

La  presidenta, doña Nancy se dedica la elaboración de ropa para bebé, estudió tejido a máquina y poco a poco “levantó su negocio”, actualmente son 20 años que desarrolla esta actividad.   Este es su noveno ciclo como parte de la asociación “Santa Bárbara”. Su primer crédito de Bs.1000.- le sirvió para comprar lana, la solicitud actual es por Bs.3000.-, el mismo que también invertirá en la compra de lana, en diferentes colores y texturas.  Una vez elaborada la ropa de bebé ella la vende en una Feria llamada “Tihuanacu” los días jueves y sábado de horas  cuatro a siete de la noche.

Así como doña Nancy ha establecido su negocio , el resto de las socias también tienen los suyos,entre ellos tenemos: elaboración de Deportivos, venta de lana de alpaca y oveja, venta de ropa de bebé, venta de chompas, venta de detergentes, bordados, venta de artículos varios.
texts.en:
The Santa Bárbara Communal Bank is a long-standing group. The group is starting its 28th cycle as part of the Santiago II Community Center. There are eight members. It is headed by the board of directors comprised of the president, treasurer, and the secretary; which is the norm for the institution. Nancy is the president. She makes baby clothes. She studied knitting with a machine, and little by little she “raised her business”. She has been in this business for 20 years. This is her ninth cycle as part of the Santa Bárbara Communal Bank. She used her first loan for 1,000 Bs to buy wool. Her current request is for 3,000 Bs, which she will also use to buy different colors and textures of wool. Once she has made the baby clothes she sells them in the Tihuanacu fair on Thursdays and Saturdays from four to seven at night. As Nancy has established her business, the rest of the members have also established theirs. Among them is making sportswear, selling wool from alpacas and sheep, selling baby clothes, selling sweaters, selling detergents, embroidery, and selling various things.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different colors of wool wholesale

loans.name: Arleen

texts.en:
Arleen Q., from the village of Batangan, Valencia City, is 38 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Arleen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over eight years, she earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Arleen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Arleen's third loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 40-year-old single man. For his living, he is tea farmer and has fish ponds. He has been in the industry for a period of one year with a monthly profit of about 16,000 KES. 

He was introduced to KADET by a friend. He wants to use the loan to improve his fish pond and his tea farm. He intends to use the accumulated savings to buy his own land. This is his second loan after repaying the previous one successfully without a problem.

loans.use: To improve the fish pond and his tea bush

loans.name: Tumentungalag

texts.en:
Tumentungalag B. is a 30-year-old single mother with a ten-year-old son. She and her son live in Harhorin, the ancient capital city of Mongolian Empire. Her son attends a local secondary school. 

Tumentungalag operates a beauty salon in a rented space at the Manlai-Tod market. She began her business in 2001 with her mother and brother. All of the hairdressers are her family members. They are now planning to open and run an accessory selling business by renting another stall at the local market. She is a modest and hardworking woman who says, "I want to expand my business and increase my income." 

She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a variety of accessories and fancy articles that will be sold in her new stall.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of accessories

loans.name: Nohemí

texts.es:
La  Sra. M. es originario del municipio Santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de León donde tiene más de 15 año de laborar como secretaria en el MINSA de esta localidad.
Cuenta con su propia casa de habitación  la que piensa mejorar con el crédito que se le  otorgado  comprando los materiales indispensable para realizar las mejora.
Esto le permitirá a la clienta mejorar las  condicione en que vive su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. M. is originally from Santa Rosa Del Peñón, in the Leon department, where she has worked as a secretary for the MINSA (Ministry of Health).

She has her own home which she plans to improve with the money from this loan, by buying the necessary materials.  This will allow her to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS (BLOCKS, CEMENT, SAND, AND IRON) TO BUILD A BACK WALL FOR HER HOUSE, FOR GREATER SECURITY

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El Sr. Hernández es un hombre muy trabajador el cuenta con cuatro años laborando para el municipio en el area de imagen urbana, es una persona responsable con su familia y siempre dispuesta a sacarla adelante en este momento vive en casa propiedad de su suegra tiene 10 años a partir de que se caso viviendo en dicho domicilio, su suegra vive en un racho situado en las afueras de la ciudad, y es por eso que desde entonces el se ha hecho cargo de la casa que sabe que es el patrimonio de su hija debido a que ella sera la veneficiaria de dicha propiedad, a base de gran esfuerzo el ha estado terminando y mejorardo la vivienda. Es por eso solicito el credito para seguir dandole mantenimiento a la misma.
texts.en: Mr Hernández is a very hard-working man who has been working for the town council in the field of urban design for four years.  He is a responsible person who is always ready to get his family ahead.  He currently lives in his mother-in-law's house.  He has been living there for 10 years since he got married.  His mother-in-law lives in a ranch on the outskirts of the city.  He has been taking care of the house because he knows that it is her daughter's estate and she will be the beneficiary of the property.  With a lot of hard work he has been finishing off and improving the house.  He is requesting a loan so that he can continue doing maintenance work on it.

loans.use: To finish plastering his house

loans.name: The Women´s Bank Promujer (Prowoman) Group

texts.en:
The Women´s Bank Promujer (Prowoman) consists of 6 members who all live in Villas Darizara, Puntarenas located in the southern region of Costa Rica. The members of this group are involved in commercial activities including catalogue sales, sewing, and food and clothing sales. This loan will be used by each woman in this group to make investments in their productive activity as she sees fit. Examples of two loan uses are to purchase catalogue products, such as cooking items, tools and perfumes, and to purchase items necessary for food preparation, as well as sewing materials (needles and thread). 

Blanca, the elected president of this group, is a 57 year old single mother who lives with her children in Villas Darizara. She has a business selling fast foods, such as hamburgers, sandwiches and casados, which she prepares in her home from door to door in her community. She plans to use this loan to invest in raw materials necessary for food production. Blanca's goal is to one day open a centralized sales post, from which she would be able to sell her fast food products. She says that a main obstacle for her business has been the low prices at which she must sell her food in order to make sales. Blanca says that the main advantage of the group lending moD. is that it is a source of support and friendship.

loans.use: To purchase various commercial items, such as clothing, food and catalogue items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy ladies jeans/trousers to sell

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 42 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su pareja Rocío de 40 años y de sus dos pequeños hijos; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Este trabajador hombre se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta y transporte de ropa, al por mayor, labora en el negocio junto a su esposa, quien le ayuda en la ardua labor de compra de ropa en los grandes emporios de la ciudad. Le gusta mucho el trabajo, pues luego de comprar la variada  mercadería en ropa, la distribuye en los mercados de las  distintas ciudades del país y la va dejando con su pequeño camión que él mismo maneja. Trabaja durante todos los días, y muy pocas veces descansa durante los fines de semana, casi 12 horas diarias, pero esta muy satisfecho pues obtiene regulares ganancias, y es por esta razón que cada vez aumenta más el volumen de sus ventas. Además tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de comprarse un camión más para transportar mayor cantidad de prendas. Es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Luis tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en cantidad de ropa variada, para distinta época, pues tiene varios pedidos por fin de año que espera concretar.
texts.en: Luis, age 42, lives in his own house with his partner Rocio, age 40, and their two small children. Together, they work hard every day to get ahead. This hard-working man has worked for 5 years selling and transporting clothing, wholesale. He works in this business with his wife, who helps him in the arduous labour of buying clothing in the big trading centers of the city. He enjoys his work greatly, as after buying the varied clothing, he distributes it to various cities in the country in his small truck which he drives himself. He works every day, and he rarely rests on the weekends. He works almost 12 hours a day, but he is very satisfied because he makes regular earnings; thus, each time he increases his sales volume. He also has many plans for the future, such as buying another truck for transporting more clothing articles. This is his fourth loan with MFP and he promises to pay his quotas punctually, since he does not want to disappoint those who are making this loan possible. This loan will allow him to continue working in the search of progress. He plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of merchandise; varied clothing, for a certain season, as he has several orders for the end of the season that he hopes to fill.

loans.use: to stock up on clothing for various seasons.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en: Firas is a young man from Jenin. He is married and the father of one son. Firas is a promising singer and musician who produces Arabic fusion music. Firas is known in the Jenin area and in some of the Palestinian cities in the north. He took out a loan from Faten to purchase an electronic guitar in order to produce different kinds of music.

loans.use: to purchase an electronic guitar

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es:
El senor Jairo C., tiene 36 anos de edad, originario de la Comarca El Jocote, situada a 25 kms del Municipio de Condega, del Departamento de Esteli; casado, con 3 hijos, se dedica a la agricultira y ganaderia.
Recuerda que comenzo a trabajar desde la edad de 8 anos, ayudando a su Papa en las actividades agricolas (ayudaba a sembrar) y en la Ganaderia (cuidando el ganado).
A los 16 anos de edad, decidio independisarse, y comenzo a trabajar como Capataz en una finca; en donde ahorro dinero y se compro 7 manzanas de tierra.
Actualmente siembra 6 y la otra la utiliza para el pastoreo del Ganado.
Se dedica a la siembra de Granos Basicos y Hortalizas, tales como: Chiltoma, Papa, etc.
Solicito este credito para comprar un Novillo, para de este manera incrementar su Ganado
Su meta es recoger algo de dinero para comprar mas terreno y Ganado, para mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Jairo C. is 36 years old and is originally from the El Jocote region which is located 25 kilometers from the municipality of Condega, in the department of Esteli. He is married, has three children and works in agriculture and  raising livestock. 

He recalls that he started working when he was eight years old helping his father with the farming (he helped sow) and with the livestock (tending to the livestock). 

When he was 16 years old he decided to become independent and he started working as a foreman on a farm where he was able to save money and buy 12 acres of land. 

Currently, he plants on about 10.5 acres and uses the rest for livestock grazing. He plants basic grains and vegetables such as chiltoma (a sweet pepper), potatoes, etc. 

He is requesting this loan to buy a steer to increase his livestock. His goal is to make money to buy more land and livestock to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of livestock.

loans.name: Bisiriyu  Oyeramiyi

texts.fr: Monsieur  Bisiriyu  a 48 ans et marié. Il a habite à Agoè.  Pour répondre aux besoins de ces enfants, il fait la vente de matériaux  électrique. Il achète  les  matériaux  au      grand  marché de Lomé et  revend dans  une boutique  non loin de  super marché  Leader Price à Agoè.  Il    a  commencé  en 1992 l’activité. Il    sollicite  un  prêt  pour  acheter  2 douzaines d’ampoule réglette, 2  douzaines d’ampoule économique, 3 rouleaux  de câble  VGV et 5 cartons de  boîtes  ronde.
texts.en: Mr. Bisiriyu is 48 years old and married. He lives in Agoè. In order to meet the needs of his children, he runs a business selling electrical equipment. He buys his goods at the grand market in Lomé and re-sells them at a store not far from the Leader Price supermarket in Agoè. He begin this business in 1992. He is seeking a loan to buy 2 dozen track light bulbs, 2 dozen energy-saving bulbs, 3 rolls of VGV cable, and 5 boxes of round tins.

loans.use: To buy electrical supplies

loans.name: Maryury Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maryury, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de ropa, ya que deseaba incrementar las ventas de sus productos y por sobre todas las cosas desea diversificar y no vender solamente un producto. Maryury nos cuenta, que gracias a los esfuerzos y al apoyo que siempre le ha brindado Fundación León 2000 y Kiva cuenta con este medio para realzar las compras de sus productos. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima.  Ella sueña siempre tener una tienda grande ubicada en el mercado, que brinde estabilidad económica a ella y su familia en general.
texts.en:
Sra. Maryury sells clothes. She wants to increase her sales, so she does everything she can to diversify her inventory and not sell just one product. Maryury says that she is grateful for all of the efforts and the support that Fundación León 2000 and Kiva have always given her so that she can acquire her products.

She is currently requesting this loan in order to buy merchandise. Maryury has always dreamed of having a large store in the market, which would provide financial stability for herself and her family.

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire merchandise

loans.name: Meur

texts.en: Mrs. Meur P. is a widow who has been living in a rural area of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She can make around $3 a profit each day from selling fresh fish at the busy market. She has no a life partner as her husband died of illness for years. Mrs. Meur P. has three children: Two are married and live outside of the family home, while the other one is no longer in school and is employed at the garment factory. She has one son who earns money by driving motorcycle taxi (Tuk Tuk) in and around his community, earning an income on average of $5 per day to share responsibility with Mrs. Meur P. for the family’s expenses. He always picks up the fishes for her before he starts providing his taxi service. Unfortunately, an existing motorbike often has broken down during use. Because of that, Mrs. Meur P. has decided to seek a loan of $1,200 from Kiva, which she will use to change the broken motorcycle for her son.

loans.use: To change the broken motorcycle of her son.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is a married woman living in Surallah, South Cotabato with her family. She is 65 years old and has seven children.

Enriquita is a farmer. She primarily grows rice to sell. She also grows vegetables that she sells as well. Enriquita works hard to build her business. She wants to be able to support her family financially.

Enriquita's loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with eight children; five attend school while three are adults. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For over ten years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her local neighbours and passersby. Mwanasha faces a major challenge of inflation in the market of her products.

With the Kshs 40,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of sugar.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Juana Irma

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Wiñay” ubicado en el distrito D. Puno, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 55 años D. edad.  Está separada y tiene 06 hijos (2 dependientes y 4 independientes).  La señora estudió educación superior técnico. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace más D. seis años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. productos D. quinua (cereal) y venta D. joyas y cosméticos por catálogo.
Ella requiere un nuevo crédito por la suma D. S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar treinta conos D. lana D. diferentes colores para sus tejidos D. chales, comprará quinua y solicitará productos D. Avon, como colonias y desodorantes.  La señora trabaja sola.  
Su sueño es tener un kiosco en el centro o en el muelle D. la ciudad para poder vender con comodidad sus productos D. quinua.	
Lo que le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es la responsabilidad y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank named "Winay", located in the district of Puno, of the province and department of Puno. She is 55 years old, separated, and she has 6 children (2 are dependent and 4 are independent). She has achieved post-secondary technical training.

She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for more than six years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/. 300 nuevos soles. The funds were invested in her quinoa cereal business and her jewelry and cosmetics sales business.

She requires a new loan in the amount of S/. 2000 nuevos soles, funds that will be used to purchase thirty cones of wool of various colors to knit wraps. She will also purchase quinoa and Avon brand products such as colognes and deodorants. She works alone. 

Her dream is to have a store in the downtown area or at the city dock to be able to sell her products more comfortably. 

She enjoys the responsibility and the timeliness of her communal bank.

loans.use: to purchase quinoa cereal, wool and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy molds, insoles and a machine to repair shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter, es socio del Banco Comunal Marcela, tiene 32 años, es soltero. Se dedica a la venta de mochilas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería.
Walter tiene un puesto de venta de mochilas en le Jr. Grau, ingreso a FINCA Perú, por la invitación de su hermana, con éste es el segundo ciclo que ésta. Le gusta le parece interesante la forma de trabajo. Está ahorrando para tener más capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Walter is a member of the “Marcela” communal bank.  He’s 32 years old and single.  He sells backpacks.  The loan he’s requesting will be used to buy merchandise.

Walter has a stand selling backpacks in Jr. Grau.   He joined FINCA Perú invited by his sister.  This is his second cycle.  He likes it; he thinks the way it operates is interesting.  He is saving up in order to have more working capital.

loans.use: to buy assorted backpacks.

loans.name: Eusebia Paulina

texts.es:
Eusebia de 47 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Es soltera y tiene dos hijos. Su actividad es la venta de comida.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás vendiendo de poco a poco sus almuerzos y después fue creciendo con el tiempo hasta llegar a tener una buena clientela. Ella labora diariamente con su hermana desde en la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción para arreglo de casa y local. En un futuro desea tener un buen negocio para lograr una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Eusebia is 47 years old and lives in an urban area of Las Orquídeas (which is so called because there were originally a lot of orchids to be found there), in Guayaquil.  She is single and has two children.  Her business is selling meals.

Eusebia started her business some time ago, selling lunches.  Over time, she grew her business and she now has a good customer base.  She works every day with her sister, from the morning until two in the afternoon.  With the help of this loan, she would like to buy building supplies to fix up her house and business premises.  In the future, she would like to have a good business so that she achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and blocks

loans.name: Maria Sebastiana

texts.es: Maria Sebastiana tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene 6 hijos y reside en la Comunidad de El Triunfo. Actualmente es una pequeña productora de café e inició su vida laboral como cortadora de éste en una Finca local, luego de un tiempo ella adquirió un poco de experiencia sobre el cultivo y con la ayuda de su padre y de un dinero que tenía ahorrado sembró una y media manzana de tierra. Ha tenido algunas pequeñas dificultades por falta de dinero, pero ahora que FAMA la está apoyando con este prestamo espera que las cosas mejoren. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de insumos agricolas como lo son: urea, abono, altocien y bolsas. Maria cree que con el apoyo de este prestamo logrará que su finca produzca mas y mejor grano de calidad, tambien espera que los ingresos obtenidos le ayuden a satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. Su meta es tecnificar su finca para llegar a ser una gran productora de Café y ayudar a sus hijos a terminar con sus estudios. Es el primer prestamo que recibe de FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas para que la Institucion la sigua apoyando.
texts.en: Maria Sebastiana is 50 years old. She is married and has 6 children. She lives in the community of El Triunfo. At present, she is a small coffee producer. She began her working life as a coffee cutter in a local farm. After a time, she acquired a little experience about the crop and with her father's help and some money she had saved she planted 150 meters. She has had some problems due to a lack of money, but now that FAMA is supporting her with this loan, she hopes things will improve. She is asking for this loan to buy farming materials such as: urea, fertilizer, fungicide and bags. Maria believes that with the supoort of this loan she will be able to make her farm produce more beans of better quality. She also hopes that with the income she obtains she will be able to satisfy her family's needs. Her goal is to technologize her farm to be anle to become a great coffee producer and help her children finish their studies. This is the first loan she has received from FAMA and she expects to make her payments on time so that the institution will keep supporting her.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials

loans.name: Nery Noemi

texts.es:
Nery Noemi, tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, y reside en la Comunidad de El Quebrachal. 

Desde hace un año y medio Nery se dedica a la cría y venta de aves de granja y decidió hacerlo porque diariamente observaba a sus vecinos en sus granjas de pollos y que les iba muy bien con las ventas. Nery necesita el préstamo para comprar 400 pollitos y luego de seis semanas venderá su carne en los negocios locales de la comunidad. Uno de sus cinco hijos la ayuda con el trabajo de la granja, así que de las pocas ganancias que le queden de este préstamo, las irá invirtiendo en la granja para ampliarla. 

Su meta es ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio para que ellos sean profesionales o que tengan su propio negocio para que se ganen la vida honradamente. Desde que es clienta de FAMA su vida y la de su familia ha mejorado económicamente. Ya tiene dos ciclos de préstamos y tuvo algunos pequeños atrasos en el pago de sus cuotas por bajas en las ventas, pero al final pudo ponerse al día con sus pagos. Y en este préstamo espera en Dios cumplir con sus pagos y no tener atrasos.
texts.en:
Nery Noemi is 50 years old, and is married with 5 children.  She lives in the community of El Quebrachal.  

For a year and a half, Nery has been working raising and selling poultry.  She decided to do this because every day she would watch her neighbors in their poultry farms and saw that they fared well with sales.  Nery needs the loan to buy 400 chicks, and six weeks later she will sell the meat to the local businesses in the community.  One of her five children helps her with the poultry farm work, so the small profits that she will earn from this loan will be invested in enlarging the farm. 

Her goal is to help her children study so that they become professionals or have their own business, so they can earn a living honestly.  Since becoming a client of FAMA, her life and that of her family has improved economically.  She has already had two loan cycles and had some small delays in making repayments due to low sales, but in the end she was able to catch up with her repayments. And with this loan she hopes in God to meet her repayments and not be in arrears.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Yenis Maria

texts.es:
Yenis de 46 años tiene un hijo en la edad de 9 años y vive en el municipio de San Jacinto, lugar ubicado en el departamento de Bolívar y muy conocido por el tejido vertical que en manos de las mujeres lo transmiten de generación en generación, con las técnicas milenarias que aprenden que cada una aprende desde la edad infantil y constituyen, la expresión más compleja y más elaborada de la estética artesanal. Esta es justamente la actividad que siempre ha tenido Yenis, pues elabora mochilas y otras artesanías, actividad combinada con la de venta de insumos para la fabricación de las mismas, además de una comercial que es una pequeña droguería. Al principio solo vendía medicinas y sus tejidos los practicaba por hobby, posteriormente, le dio a su negocio un giro enfatizado más hacia artesanías,  porque aprovechó su punto comercial y la actividad que mas le generaba ingresos, y que también serviría a mujeres que necesitaban insumos para su manualidad, eso sí, sin dejar de practicar la de comercializar de medicamentos alopáticos de libre consumo. 
Yenis ha recibido 4 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, su credikiva es el quinto y con él comprará en mayor volumen, insumos para la venta y para la elaboración de sus mochilas y medicamentos de mayor rotación en su droguería. Pues con el  buen manejo de sus créditos durante 5 años con esta organización, Yenis ha salido adelante con su hijo y por eso quiere continuar con su meta de crecimiento de su negocio, pues ya ha comprado vitrinas y organizado su punto comercial y ahora surtirá mucho más su negocio  y esto la hace muy feliz, porque tiene un nuevo capital de trabajo, que  bien invertido le genera una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 11%.
texts.en:
Yenis is 46 years old, has a nine year old son, and lives in the town of San Jacinto, located in the department of Bolivar.  It is very well known for its vertical weaving that the women pass from generation to generation.  Everyone learns the thousand year old techniques as a child and they are the most complex and elaborate expression of craftsmanship.  

This is the work that Yenis has always done, making bags and other crafts.  She also sells the materials to do weaving, and has a small pharmacy.  Initially, she only sold medicines and wove as a hobby, but later she turned her business towards selling crafts because she could take advantage of her store and it generated more income and also served women who needed materials for their handiwork.  She did this without stopping the sales of her conventional medicines.  

Yenis has received four loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and this Kiva loan is her fifth.  With this loan, she will purchase a larger amount of materials for sale, and to make her bags and for more medicines in her pharmacy.  With the good management of her loans during her five years with this organization, Yenis has improved her life and the life of her son, and for this reason, she wants to continue with the goal of growing her business.  She has already purchased display cases and organized her store, and now has much more business.  This makes her very happy, because she has new working capital that well invested will generate a return on sales of no less than 11%.

loans.use: to purchase a larger amount of materials for sale, to make her bags, and purchase medicines for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
The man whose picture appears above is Ricardo. He is 31 years old and is married. Living with him in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, are 4 school-aged children. Ricardo and his spouse are much happier having the children. He was able to send all his children to school through his gardening activity. 

Ricardo plants a variety of crops and sells them to multiple buyers when they are grown.  For 11 years, he never ceased and has learned to love the work he does for a living. Every month, he receives a total of PHP 11,440 from gardening.

Earlier this year, Ricardo joined GDMPC to have easy access to financial services. His approved loan application from the cooperative is worth PHP 5,000. He will use it to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Some of these are eggplants, root crops, shrubs and many more.  With the help of the new investment taken from the cooperative, Ricardo hopes to bring in the right and productive crops. He plans to gradually expand the cultivated area and plant more to increase his usual income generated each month.

loans.use: buy seeds and seedlings

loans.name: Kandai

texts.en:
Kandai is 38 years old and married with three children. He has been a mixed farmer for the last 10 years.

He was introduced to KADET by a registered client. He has been loaned KES 70,000. This is his second loan, which he has planned to use to purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals. 

He intends to use the return from the loan to put back into farming and to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his kids to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah is a hardworking business man. He is 41, married, and blessed with two children who are still in school. For the last 4 years, he has been practicing poultry farming and running a grocery store. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his poultry business to meet the high market demand. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fruits and vegetables. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save part of his income.

loans.use: To buy fruits and  vegetables

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a hardworking businesswoman aged 27 and she is married. For the last two years, she has been managing a pharmacy to make a living. She has improved her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy medicines.

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 57 years old and a widow with 7 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail gasoline business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Tessie has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the gasoline business for 7 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Tessie aspires to save enough money so she can provide a secure future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn runs a sari-sari store business in Talibon, Bohol. She sells items like coffee, milk and canned goods. Rubelyn also sells fish at the market. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him sell his catch. 

Rubelyn has requested this loan to buy more fish and items to sell at her store and to pay for her children's tuition fees. Rubelyn hopes for her businesses to improve. She also hopes to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more fish and items to sell at her store and pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy glassware.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Kabini

texts.en:
Kabini is a 62 year old married woman with seven children who are all independent. Her husband Ngwamba is a farmer who contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Kabini has operated a retail shop for the past ten years; her potential clients are villagers from the local area. She faces a major challenge which is of people who owe her money not paying their debts on time. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, beans, maize flour and soap for her shop. She decided to join Yehu to access funding to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, beans, maize flour and soap for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more retail stock, e.g., sugar, flour, rice, and sodas

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Mercedes, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 35 años, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, el mayor ya es independiente y la segunda estudia el nivel inicial.
Siempre le gustó generar sus propios ingresos, para ayudar a su esposo, que trabaja en construcción civil, con los gastos de su hogar y los estudios de su hijo mayor, es así como el primer préstamo que recibió del banquito comunal lo destinó para comprar frutas y venderlas en la vereda de su casa, le fue bien por un año, hasta que la competencia abrió una tienda de comestibles donde adicionaron la venta de frutas y verduras, es por ello que decide cambiar de negocio por el de alquiler de mototaxi, donde recibe diariamente el pago, para ahorrar y le da tiempo para dedicarse a otras labores como es el cuidado de niños en su casa. Es así como viene luchando día a día, junto a su esposo para salir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00,  lo utilizará para dar mantenimiento a su unidad móvil y dar la inicial para adquirir otro, que le permitirá tener más ganancias y ahorrar para terminar de construir su casa. 
Rosa Mercedes, es una mujer luchadora que tiene muchas ganas de seguir aprendiendo, su sueño es terminar de construir su casa,  para implementar una tienda de venta de frutas de todas la Regiones del Perú. Por todo eso agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, porque le da la oportunidad de seguir adquiriendo nuevos conocimientos para aplicarlos en su vida cotidiana
texts.en:
Rosa Mercedes is a member of the “Mujeres de la Colina II” community bank in Tarapoto district, in Tarapoto province, in San Martín department.  She is 35 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  Her eldest child lives independently and her youngest is in elementary school.

Rosa Mercedes has always enjoyed earning her own income to help her husband, who works in the house-building trade, with their household expenses and the education expenses of their eldest child.  She used the first loan that she received through her community bank to buy fruit which she sold on the sidewalk outside her house.  Things went well for a year, until the competition opened a grocery store in which they also started selling fruit and vegetables.  For this reason, she decided to change business and she now hires out a motorcycle taxi.  She receives payment every day and is thereby able to save.  She also has time to spend on other tasks such as looking after children in her home.  In this way, Rosa Mercedes works hard, day by day, alongside her husband, so that they can get ahead and make their dreams come true.

Rosa Mercedes will use this loan for 2,000 soles to have her vehicle serviced and make a down payment to acquire another one.  This will allow her to make more profits and save up so that she can finish building her house.  Rosa Mercedes is a tenacious woman who has a great desire to continue learning.  Her dream is to finish building her home and to set up a store where she will sell fruit from every region in Peru.  She thanks Movimiento Manuela Ramos for all this because they give her the opportunity to continue acquiring new knowledge to apply to her daily life.

loans.use: to have her vehicle serviced

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is a 53 years old. She is single. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City and makes money by selling soft drinks. 

For the past fifteen years, she has run a drink stall to cover her family's daily living expenses. The business is going smoothly and she would like a loan to buy many kinds of beverages to provide to her customers.

She hopes this will increase her income, help her to improve her living conditions, and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of beverages to provide to her customers.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y sociable, es conviviente con Jhonny quien es pescador, vive en compañía de su pareja, sus dos hijos de 10 y 3 años de edad, su cuñada y sus dos sobrinos, habitando su propia casa. El negocio que tiene Liliana es la venta de pescado que su pareja pesca en los lagos de la localidad como el lago de Yarinacocha. Para eso cuentan con un pequeño bote donde su pareja sale a realizar las faenas de pesca, para luego ella venderlo al por mayor entre los comerciantes de los mercados de la localidad, y una parte lo vende al por menor en un puesto que tiene en el puerto. Contando solo con el apoyo de su pareja para ésta actividad que vienen realizando desde hace 10 años. Le gusta su negocio ya le ha generado muchas satisfacciones tanto personales como económicas ya que con los ingresos ha podido solventar los gastos de su hogar, así como comprarse enseres del hogar entre otros gustos. Además comenta que con las buenas ganancias que le deja sobre todo en tiempos de escasez, tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y hacerlo crecer para así tener más ingresos. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para avanzar con su negocio, además de sentirse bien con su banco comunal ya que hasta ahora no ha tenido problemas y ve que son buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles tiene planeado invertir en la compra de materiales para pesca como trampas, y mejorar su puesto de venta, como el techado por las constantes lluvias.
texts.en:
Liliana, 29, is a hardworking and dedicated woman, in addition to being cheerful and sociable. She is in a committed relationship with Jhonny who is a fisherman, with whom she lives along with her two children of 10 and 3 years of age, her sister-in-law and two nephews, inhabiting her own home. The business Liliana has is selling the fish that her partner fishes in the area's lakes such as Yarinacocha Lake. For this purpose they have a small boat in which her partner goes out to do the work of fishing, so that she may then sell it wholesale among the merchants in the area markets. Another portion of it she sells retail at a fish stand she has at the port. 

She relies only upon her partner's support in this business, which she has had for ten years. She likes her business as it has generated many satisfactions both personal and financial. With the income she has been able to pay the costs of running a household as well as purchase household furniture and fittings along with other things they wanted. She comments in addition that with the good earnings she receives, above all in times of scarcity, she has plans to expand her business and make it grow so as to bring in more income. 

This will be her second loan with the MFP institution. She is grateful for the financial support she has been receiving to move forward in her business. She is also pleased with her communal bank since so far she has not had any problems and sees that they are good people. With the requested sum of 1,000 Peruvian soles she plans to invest in the purchase of materials for fishing, such as traps, and improve her fish stand, specifically the roof which has been affected by the constant rain.

loans.use: to purchase fishing tools such as traps, as well as improving the roof of the stand where she makes her sales.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is a 46 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Ho Chi Minh City.  Her husband earns an income working as a laborer on construction sites. Mai earns a living running a general store, which she has done for four years. 

Mai is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy goods, such as snack foods, biscuits, soft drinks, and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods, biscuits, soft drinks, and confectionery.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah has never set foot in any higher learning institution nor does she have any work experience, only her wits and her desire to succeed in life. She is a very hardworking, progressive, and honest farmer from a very remote village in Etono in the Kenyenya area of Kenya. This area is very fertile, with favorable weather patterns that support farming activities. 

Annah is happily married and the proud mother of one child, and together they live on a small piece of land that she really treasures. Her primary sources of income are eggs, milk. Although this humble and industrious mother makes a profit, she faces the challenge of not being able to produce enough to meet the ready market that is available. 


Therefore, she is seeking funds from Kiva lenders to buy farm inputs like good fertilizer and good quality seeds. 

Through this loan, she will double her production, and this will translate into increased income. She then intends to save more money in the future so that she can develop her farming. This loan will help Annah to realize her dream of getting out of poverty, and she will be able to secure her family's future.
Annah patiently waits for your support during this festive season!

loans.use: To buy farm implements.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa R. owns a small business selling goods from Bahia like clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. Every week she features a new item in her store, something distinct that she knows her customers cannot find anywhere else. Elsa gains loyal customers from the nearby open-air market, festival celebrations, and street traffic. With five years of experience under her belt, Elsa runs a very tight operation. Having been left by her husband seven years ago, Ms. R. has done very well as a single mother trying to raise three children. Life continued to throw challenges in Elsa’s way when her daughter of 14 had a baby. Rather than complain and quit, this hard-working entrepreneur pulled herself up and put extra effort into her job to raise her children and grandchild. Elsa’s parents run a similar shop in Guayaquil, and they were able to advance her some inventory of clothes to help her get started in her own business. 

Ms. R. is asking for this loan so that she can incrementally increase the volume of her business. She plans to buy seasonal clothes such as sweaters and rain jackets, and if she pays in cash, she cant benefit from the distributor’s discounts. Elsa is 41 years of age, and although she has experienced many hardships in life, she wants people to know her for working hard and supporting her three children, all of whom attend school and enjoy good health. They live in a modest house which was passed down from Elsa’s mother, but this house is the focal point of her small business which Elsa hopes to grow into a very profitable venture.

loans.use: Ms. Rivera is asking for this loan so that she can incrementally increase the volume of her business. She plans to buy seasonal clothes such as sweaters and rain jackets, and if she pays in cash, she cant benefit from the distributor’s discounts.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: I am a widow, mother of 7. I sell mangos to earn a living for myself and my children. The loan will help me diversify and expand the business so as to be able to cater for my family’s needs with ease.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 23 years old, is married, and has three children. Her husband works as a mason’s assistant. Veronica embroiders blouses and shawls. Since she doesn’t have a place where she can sell her products where she lives, she takes them to the city’s tourist market. With the loan, she hopes to buy more fabric, in order to increase her production and thereby increase the income she is able to contribute to her houselhold. Veronica is part of the “Clouds Group 7”.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

VERONICA , TIENE 23 AÑOS , CASADA TRES HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO AYUDANTE DE ALBAÑIL. ELLA SE DEDICA AL BORDADO DE BLUSAS DE MANTA , COMO NO TIENE LUGAR FISICO DONDE VENDER SUS PRODUCTOS DONDE ELLA VIVE, LOS LLEVA AL MERCADO TURISTICO DE LA CIUDAD AHI LOS VENDE A PEDIDO .ESPERA CON EL CREDITO PODER COMPRAR MAS TELA PARA AUMENTAR SU PRODUCCION Y DE ESA FORMA INCREMENTAR LOS INGRESOS QUE APORTA PARA SU CASA.PERTENECE AL GRUPO NUBES 7.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making embroidered blouses and shawls

loans.name: Fizza

texts.en:
Fizza is a 44 year-old, married woman with two children. She and her husband (as seen in the picture) started their own business in 1998. In 2005, Fizza received her first loan from Normicro Baku branch. In time, their business received a second loan.

Fizza invested these two loan amounts she received from Normicro to complete the building of her shop and to buy electronic control instruments. She hopes to further grow their business by purchasing new electronic equipment to aid in additional repair services. Fizza is requesting a loan amount of $1,000 to accomplish this.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for shop

loans.name: Tram

texts.en: Mrs. Tram is 37 years old and her husband is 38 years old.  They have three children. Only the youngest child still attends school.  They have no land apart from their hut.  Everyday Mrs. Tram sells rice cake from door-to-door.  The family income is $7 per person/month. She hopes to receive a loan of $75 to support her in her business. She will repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to sell rice cakes from door-to-door

loans.name: Aygun

texts.en: Aygun (her husband is pictured) is 23 years old. She does not have children. She lives in Khacmaz region in the Gimil-Gushlag village. Four years ago she started this business. She needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticide for improving her farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en: Bashorat T. lives in Khujand, Tajikistan.   She is married and has 3 children.  She has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006.  She trades in the Friday and Sunday bazaar. She has a good assortment of  women's suits and coats that she sells. Working in this business, she has competitors so now she requires a loan of $300 for increased purchases and business development. Bashorat intends to purchase inter-season coats which she hopes will make her business more successful.

loans.use: To purchase inter-season coats

loans.name: Horacio

texts.es:
Mr. Horacio B. is a 41-year-old photographer who lives in the 28 de Marzo district of Managua. Because of the penchant for photography that he has had since childhood, he decided to start his photographic business, which is his family’s source of income. His 18-year-old daughter has also developed this same affinity, so she currently helps him shoot pictures. Mr. B. also offers video services. He is requesting this loan in order to start the construction of a photographic studio, thus broadening his business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Horacio tiene 41 años de edad y es fotógrafo, vive en el barrio 28 de Marzo en Managua. Don Horacio debido a una afición de pequeño decidió introducirse en el negocio de la fotografía el cual es el ingreso de su familia. Su hija de 18 años también ha desarrollado esta afición y actualmente le ayuda en la toma de las fotos. También ofrece grabación de video. Necesita el crédito para empezar a construir su estudio fotográfico y establecerse más ampliamente en este negocio.

loans.use: Construction of photographic studio

loans.name: Ida

texts.en: Ida, 31, is married to S. who has no fixed job which means they don’t have a regular income. To cover the family needs, she raises ducks and sells them, earning $5 with $3 worth of profit every quarter. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of $100 to buy more ducks so she could earn more income for the family. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more ducks

loans.name: Ileyda

texts.es:
Mrs. Ileyda R. is in the hair and beauty business, and for the past 16 years she has had a small salon in her house in the town of Condega. She is the mother of two school-aged children, and she puts a lot of effort into maintaining her business.

Mrs. Ileyda R. needs tools like scissors, haircutting machines, gelatins, combs, etc. She currently does not have these resources, so for this reason she is seeking support from Ceprodel to obtain loans that will allow her to acquire her tools and continue with her hard work. Her current credit record is seven loans paid on time and as prescribed.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ileyda R. se dedica al negocio de corte de pelo y belleza tendiendo su pequeño salón desde hace 16 años ubicado en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Condega. Es madre de 2 hijos en edad escolar y con el deber de mantener su negocio con mucho esfuerzo.

Para llevar a cabo esta actividad, la señora Ileyda R. necesita de herramientas como tijeras, maquinas de corte de cabello, gelatinas, peines, etc. Actualmente no cuenta con estos recursos y por tal razón busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan adquirir sus herramientas y continuar con su ardua labor en su localidad. Su record crediticio actualmente es de 7 créditos pagados en tiempo y forma según lo estipulado.

loans.use: To purchase tools for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Issifou

texts.en:
Issifou A. is 33 years old and the married father of 3 children.  Two of his children are enrolled in primary school and one works with him in his store.  To provide for his family, Issifou opened a general store in Adèta, a medium-sized town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He sells a variety of items ranging from candies, soap and canned goods to prepaid cellphone cards.  His store is located in the center of town and bustles with activity. 
With this loan, Issifou would like to replenish his stock and also enlarge his inventory.  He hopes that by increasing his commercial activity he can respond to the needs of his family and to continue to participate in the development of his community.

loans.use: Replenish stock and enlarge his inventory of his general store

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina y Paulino, are both very industrious and enterprising parents, since they formed their family they have dedicated themselves to countless activities so their 3 beloved children do not experience economic constraints.

Paulino, purchases and sells building bricks while Bernardina has a country store. In addition, 2 years ago the couple purchased a motorcycle taxi to rent it and earn extra money for family expenses.

The couples wish is to increase the amount of capital for their brick business; both believe that by increasing their capital they will also increase their profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Bernardina y Paulino, son padres muy laboriosos y emprendedores, desde que formaron su familia se dedicaron a innumerables actividades con el fin de que sus 3 queridos hijos, no pasen limitaciones económicas.

Paulino, se dedica a la compra y venta de ladrillos de construcción, mientras que Bernardina se dedica al negocio por campañas, adicionalmente a sus labores hace 2 años adquirieron un mototaxi con el fin de alquilarlo y obtener ingresos extras para el gasto y sustento familiar.

El deseo de esta pareja es aumentar el monto de inversión de su negocio de ladrillos, ambos creen que aumentando su capital incrementarán también sus beneficios.

loans.use: Increase in capital to raise the production of bricks.

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en: Faaiuga F., 45, is married with 2 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the pork cakes business. She sells to the school children and village people 6 days per week. She has had 6 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $208 USD.  SPBD loans are Faaiuga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to pay for her children's school fees and the rest to  make improvements in her business. Her husband helps in operating  the business in order to support the family.

loans.use: to make improvements in her canteen business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is 24 years old and completed 11 years of school. She lives with her only son, her husband died three years ago. She is one of the leaders of Mulla Contihueco, in the Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno region, Peru.

She sells embroidered tapestries and raises cattle. With the first loan she received from Las Kantutas Wilkauta Common Bank of $115 in 2007, she invested in 16 meters of material and 3 kilograms of colored wool yarn, allowing her to improve her income.

With this loan of $200, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 20 meters of material, 3 kilograms of wool, and other needed supplies. Overall, Rosa is very happy, especially since her improved earnings have increased her production. Her biggest dream is for her son to become a professional and that she can continue to capitalize in order to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa tiene 24 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, vive con su único hijo, su esposo falleció hace tres años. Ella es una de las líderes del Centro Poblado de Mulla Contihueco, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, de la región Puno. Ella se dedica a la actividad económica de venta de bordado de bayeta y crianza de ganado. Con el primer crédito que recibió del Banco Comunal Las Kantutas Willkauta fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles en el año 2007, lo cual invirtió en la compra de 16 metros de bayeta y 3 kilos de lana de color, esto permitió mejorar sus ingresos. Con este préstamo de S/.500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 20 metros de bayeta, 3 kilos de lana y otros. Por todo ello, ella esta muy feliz, ya que con la ganancia viene ampliando su producción. Su sueño más grande es que su hijo sea profesional y capitalizarse más para ampliar su producción.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of embroidery supplies.

loans.name: Kin

texts.en:
Kin V., 43, grows vegetables and sells them out of her home in Sa Ang. She works together with her husband, Tuy Ky, and they typically make US$3 each day. They are supporting their two children who are students in the local public school system.

Kin V. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase more vegetable seeds to expand her crops. She believes that through increasing her yield and expanding her inventory, she can reach more customers and increase her profits. High food and gas prices have led to a difficult economic situation in Cambodia; however, Kin V. is optimistic and looks forward to seeing the results of her investment.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seeds

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 34 años, vive con su hijo de 12 años. Desde que empezó a trabajar como secretaria en el Terminal de Transporte de su ciudad, inició la venta de miel y de pisco, ya que es muy rentable y no descuida su trabajo, ya que en su misma agencia aprovecha en vender estos  productos.Lo que le agrada, es que las personas ya la reconocen y tiene clientes quienes le solicitan  varios pedidos de miel para llevarlos a sus ciudades, pero lo difícil es atender a sus clientes y al mismo tiempo a los pasajeros de la agencia, ya que si desea vender tiene que ser muy hábil en hacerlo para no incomodar a unos, ni dejar de atender a los otros.
Martha tiene en su hijo, su mayor motivo de  trabajo y esfuerzo, ya que es el único con quien comparte sus penas y alegrías.
Ahora, tiene pensado incrementar sus productos y tener mayor venta, con el tiempo poner un puesto de miel y pisco en el Terminal de Trasnportes, donde trabaja.
texts.en:
Martha is 34 years old and lives with her 12-year-old son. Ever since she started working as a secretary in the bus station in her city she began selling honey and pisco, which is very profitable and doesn´t cause her neglect her job since she sells these products from her same office. What she likes is that people now recognize her and she has customers who place orders for honey which they take to their own cities. What is difficult is taking care of her customers and at the same time the agency´s passengers. If she wants to sell she has to be very careful to do it in a way which doesn´t make any customers uncomfortable or causes her not to attend others.

In her son, Martha has her greatest motivation for working hard, as he is the only person with whom she shares her sorrows and her joys.

She is now thinking about increasing her products so she can have more sales. In time, she will set up a stand for honey and pisco at the bus terminal where she works.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase quantities of the products she sells, honey and bottles of Peruvian pisco.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia F., 28, is married with five children. She has 4 years of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the village people and public 3 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~$83 USD). SPBD loans are Sofia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase mutton flaps, chicken franks, onions, soya and salt. Her husband helps her with the business.

loans.use: Sofia would like to purchase Mutton flaps, chicken franks, soya, onions and salt for her BBQ business.

loans.name: Nukra

texts.en: Nukra is the mother of three wonderful kids. She has her own business selling perfume and other small items. She has a constant place at the market and many clients. She usually goes to other towns to buy goods and sells them at the market where she lives. But since everything has been getting so expensive, the money she uses for business isn’t enough. So she decided to borrow more money to buy more goods to sell. This way she can have more profit and provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: Nukra would like to expand her perfume business.

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Mr. Kosal Y., 25, is a motorcycle taxi driver. He also works as a construction supervisor who employs workers to provide a building service. He currently earns approximately $10 per day. His wife, Mrs. Houy Oum, 21, is local grocery seller. They live in Loloksar Commune in Pursat Province.

Kosal has applied for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a grocery store for his wife, to repair his motorcycle, and to pay his workers' salaries. The loan will supplement their incomes to support their family’s living expenses sufficiently.

loans.use: To purchase a grocery store, repair a motorcycle, and pay workers' salaries

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
