Our friend is a very hard-working woman and, in order to cover her expenses, years ago she started working in commerce, selling natural products, and both personal products and products for the home (irons, shoes, blenders, etc.).  She sells these through a credit system.  She makes her sales door to door.  She has been in business for 15 years and has done very well.  She will use part of her loan to give to her son for his business as he sells cheese in the local market.

Ciria will use this loan to buy natural products, products for the home and cheese for her son's business.  She has belonged to her loan group for 11 years and she likes it because they have helped her a lot with the loans.  Her dream is to have business premises in her home.

loans.use: to buy natural products, household products and cheese

loans.name: Nilo

texts.es: Nilo de 26 años convive con Yova de 28 años, fruto de esta relación tienen un hijo. Viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en el distrito de Sivia. Nilo, es un joven de gran visión y le gusta explorar cosas nuevas. Su primer trabajo fue en la actividad agrícola, específicamente el cultivo y comercialización de piña en el cual viene consolidándose en su localidad. Actualmente, siguen trabajando en la misma actividad pero debido a la calidad de su producto y a un precio competitivo su margen de ventas ha aumentado; La necesidad constante de mejorar la calidad  y aumentar la cantidad de sus productos requiere un mayor esfuerzo. Por ello Nilo trabaja arduamente en compañía de su familia, la cual le brinda su apoyo incondicional, sin embargo durante las temporadas de cosecha tiene a cargo a sus peones para facilitar la extracción de sus productos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que esta comprometido en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. En tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que pueda concretar sus objetivos. Nilo es la persona que siempre esta siempre al tanto de las reuniones de su banco comunal. Con los 1,500 comprará fertilizantes para fertilizar su parcela.
texts.en:
Nilo is 26 years old and lives with Yova, who is 28. They have a son and live in a rented house located in the district of Sivia. Nilo is a young man with a grand vision and likes to explore new things.

His first work was in agriculture, specifically cultivating and commercializing pineapple, which is becoming common in his locality. At present, he still works in the same activity, but due to the quality of his production and its competitive pricing, his sales margin has grown.

The necessity of constantly improving the quality and increasing the quantity of his products requires a ever greater effort. For this, Nilo works arduously in the company of his family, which offers its  unconditional help. Nevertheless, during harvest season he has to use laborers to facilitate the picking of his pineapples.

This is Nilo's first loan with MFP, and he is committed to making the scheduled payments punctually. He hopes for the help of each one of you so that he can realize his objectives. Nilo is the one who is always up to the mark at his communal bank's reunions. With the 1,500 new sols he will buy fertilizers to spread on his parcel of land.

loans.use: buy sacks of fertilizers for his pineapple crop.

loans.name: Lucewin

texts.en:
Lucewin is married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lucewin is 41 years old and has four children who are in school.

Lucewin has a sari-sari  (variety) store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Lucewin has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lucewin would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with three children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is fuel.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothing boutique, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge from the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kshs loan, Elizabeth wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: service motorcycles and buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Eva's Group

texts.en:
Eva's Group is comprised of three hard-working women. Eva is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past six years, Eva has been working hard to manage her small restaurant, which provides an outside catering service to local families and businesses. 

To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy corn and food for resale, and will help Eva to generate greater profits and take care of herself. Eva hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Eva is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Eva's future prospects by helping her to improve her business knowledge.

loans.use: to buy corn and food for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children who attend school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. Fatuma owns a house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a leso (kanga) selling business for the past three months. Her potential clients are her neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of high prices of lesos which have reduced her profit. She dreams of having a one stop shop for all varieties of the traditional lesos. (Lesos, or kanga, are traditional Kenyan women's clothing. See picture above.)

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more lesos and rent a business premises. She decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase more lesos and rent a business premises.

loans.name: Avelita

texts.en:
Avelita is 46 years old and lives in D'ban Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 
Avelita has a handicraft business and earns approximately PHP 4300 each month doing this type of work. She has  requested a loan of 14900 to  purchase assorted stocks of handicrafts worth 14900. Avelita has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.

loans.use: To purchase assorted stocks of handicrafts

loans.name: Beker Francisco

texts.es: Becker Francisco tiene 35 años, tiene 5 hijos y todos están bajo su cargo. Su actividad es una pulpería, que con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado adelante. A pesar de no generar muchos ingresos con su negocio el trata de obtener algo de ganancia. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, fideos, crema, golosinas, refrescos, sopas y papel higiénico él quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio. El  está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Beker Francisco is 35 years old and has five children who are all in his care.  Beker has a grocery store business which, with a lot of effort, he has managed to make progress in.  In spite of the fact that he doesn't make a lot of income from his business, he tries to make some profits.  He is requesting this loan to buy rice, beans, oil, noodles, cream, candies, soft drinks, soup and toilet paper as he would like to expand and improve his business.  He is happy to be receiving his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, noodles, cream, candies, soft drinks, soup and toilet paper

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: La señora Eva es comerciante, vende ropa y todo tipo de muebles en distintas ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mas mercadería en este caso ropa para niños ya que se acerca la época de navidad y las ventas suben. Vive en casa en alquiler la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que Eva obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y también en Kiva.
texts.en: Eva’s a merchant.  She sells clothes and all types of furniture in various street markets in the city of El Alto.  She needs the loan to buy more merchandise, in this case children’s clothes, because the Christmas season is approaching and sales increase.  She lives in a rented house in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz.  This is the first time Eva has gotten an IMPRO and a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes.

loans.name: Lucie

texts.fr: Lucie est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Nicodem. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Lucie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Pour assurer ses différentes charges et contribuer aux besoins de sa famille, Lucie mène comme activité la vente de tissus par le système de distribution. De façon secondaire, Lucie vend des arachides grillés. Lucie exerce cette activité depuis deux ans. Lucie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour améliorer son niveau de vie, Lucie sollicite pour une quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Lucy is 42 years old and is married to a driver named Nicodemus. The couple has four children, all attending school and under their care. Lucie lives together with her children and her husband.

To manage her various responsibilities and contribute towards family expenses, Lucy's business activity has been to sell fabrics through the distribution system. Secondarily, Lucy also sells roasted peanuts.

Lucie has been in business for the past two years. She resupplies from a market in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and improve her standard of living, Lucy is requesting a fourth credit loan from ALIDé. The first three loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: Buy fabrics and bags of peanuts.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 25 years old and single. He runs a cyber café business in Mikindani, Mombasa, and the business has been in operation for two years. The business is doing well and he has been able to serve many people. He also runs an M-pesa money transfer business in Mikindani.

This marks Solomon’s first borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business, and with the money he plans to purchase more float for his M-pesa. With the anticipated profits he hopes to be able to repay his KADET loan and to expand his businesses even further.

In future Solomon hopes to open up a new cyber café in a different location in Mombasa.

loans.use: to purchase more float for his M-pesa

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is a 30-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest child is 11 years old.

Benita and her husband run a fishing business in Trinidad, Bohol. They earn 7000 PHP per month with this business. 

Benita does her best to support her husband and children. She applied for a loan to purchase fishing nets and other materials. 

Benita hopes to have a stable income to help sustain her family, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other materials

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 38 years old and married and has four children who are in school.  To earn a living, he recycles metals to make door and window frames. He has been in this business for six years. He also gets contracts for painting houses and earns extra income from this. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Thomas has been trained in business management.  This has helped him to improve his business and hence his living standards.

Thomas hopes to grow his business in the future.  He has requested a loan for 30,000 Kenya shillings, which he will use to buy scrap metals and metallic rods for his business.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals and metal rods.

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roger , es habitante del municipio de Masaya , junto a su familia , desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de yuca , la mayor afectación que se le presento durante la cosecha fue , que por problemas económicos emigro hacia Costa Rica , pensando que allá tendría más oportunidades de trabajo y no fue asi ; dejando a cargo la producción  de yuca a su esposa y su hijo mayor los cuales no tienen la experiencia sobre la plantación , dejándola  sola mucho tiempo sin ningún cuido , lo que aprovechar a robarle gran parte de la misma ; ahora él se encuentra en un una situación muy difícil ya que no cuenta con recursos económicos para seguir trabajando dignamente en su país ; ya que su experiencia vivida le sirvió de mucho y con mucha tristeza y lagrimas en su cara dice que jamás volverá a  dejar a su familia y su país.
texts.en:
Roger lives in the town of Masaya with his family.  He has worked growing yucca for several years.  The greatest challenge that presented itself during the harvest was that he emigrated to Costa Rica because of financial problems, thinking that he would have more job opportunities there, but it was not the case.  He left his wife and oldest son in charge of the yucca production, but not having experience in the field, they left it alone with no care for a long time, which took the opportunity of cheating him of a large part of the production.

Now he finds himself in a very difficult situation since he has no economic resources to continue working with dignity in his country.  He says with great sadness and tears on his face that he will never leave his family and his country again, since the experience he had served him very well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en:
Nhanh, 56 years old, is married and has four children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a worker in a nearby company. 

Nhanh supports her family with the income that she earns running a grocery store. She intends to use her loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of vegetables such as sweet potatoes, onions, gingers, and garlics to sell.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of vegetables such as sweet potatoes, onions, ginger, and garlic

loans.name: Bughoye Thuyikolere Group

texts.en:
Georget is 32 years old  and married, with two children, one still in school.

She has been in drug shop business for eight years, and she also does farming as additional income. She started her business for self-sustainability and to increase her family income.

She hopes to expand her drug shop and transform it to a big pharmacy in Kasese town.

She is a member of Bughoye Thuyikolere group, where each member guarantees the others to get a loan. However, bad debtors and expiration of drugs are challenges she faces.The photo has captured six out of the eight clients. 

Georget intends to use the loan to buy more drugs to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drugs to sell.

loans.name: Ingrid Lilibeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señorita Ingrid, tiene 19 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus abuelos, ella estudia Administración De Empresas en una universidad de la localidad, este es su tercer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta el grupo porque es unido y los créditos son de mucha ayuda. 
Ingrid es una joven  que le gusta ganarse la vida con su esfuerzo  y así ganar lo necesario para seguir adelante en sus estudios siempre pensando en su porvenir, para esto ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, ella y su abuela salen a vender por toda la localidad  y también vende en la universidad donde estudia pues allí cuenta con muy buena clientela, de esta forma ella logra ganar algo para sus estudios y colaborar con sus abuelos, lleva 2 años con esta actividad y le encanta lo que hace.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y otras prendas. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios.

loans.use: comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y otras prendas.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
A year ago Alicia began her shoe sale business; she is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working woman. She is married and her husband works as a self-employed driver, so their income varies a lot. They have two children, 13 and 16 years old. More income is needed because their children’s education is getting more expensive. This is why she decided to begin her own business of selling shoes among her neighbors. She has no employees; her children often help with her business.

She needs a loan for $250 USD to purchase merchandise and to fulfill some existing orders. Her clients recommend her to other people every day, which has helped her business grow. She requests a term of 3-6 months to repay the loan. With your help she is sure that the loan will increase her utility and will benefit her family.

** Translated from Spanish by Julie Lerch:

Hace un año que Alicia inició su negocio de venta de zapatos, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora. Esta casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer por su cuenta y es por eso que sus ingresos son muy variables, tienen dos hijos, de 13 y 16 años y es precisamente por la necesidad de contar con mayores ingresos ya que la educación de sus hijos cada vez implica mayores gastos, que ella se decidió a iniciar su negocio de venta de zapatos entre sus vecinas. Ella no tienen empleados, sus hijos son quienes en ocasiones le ayudan con su negocio.

Ella requiere un préstamo por $ 250 USD para comprar mercancía diversa y poder surtir algunos pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes, quien cada día la recomiendan con mas personas por lo que se ha venido incrementando su clientela. El plazo que solicita para pagar el préstamo es de 3-6 meses y con tu ayuda ella esta segura que incrementará sus utilidades y traerá beneficios a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase diverse merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Pork

texts.en:
Mrs. Pork S., 26 years old, lives with her husband and 1 child in SiemReap province, Cambodia. She and her husband run a small grocery store at home and typically generate around US$8 per day in revenue, which is enough to cover most of the family's expense. However, S. is asking for a loan of US$500 to keep running her business. She intends to purchase more grocery items and a simple motorcycle which would help her transport products from the local market. 
In the future, S. hopes, she will be able to purchase a greater variety of products to satisfy the needs of her clients. She also hopes to be able to afford better education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and a motorcycle to operate the business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia R., 26, grows vegetables in the rich soil in the highlands of Guatemala. In her rented plot of land she grows lettuce and onions. She is able to grow two crops in one year on the two plots or cuerdas she rents, totaling about 80’x80’ (28x28 meters). With this loan she will buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides. 
Her goal for the future is to to expand into cattle because the market is favorable for cattle right now. Alicia is married, has 3 children and owns her home. Though she never went to school and cannot read or write she knows education is important and works hard to send her children to school. The youngest one is 4 years old and will be ready to enter school next year.Alicia's village is nestled right against the side of the Santa Maria volcano, part of a complex of volcanoes that regularly rumbles  and that completely destroyed the village in the early 20th century. It's a place of beautiful green hillsides and lush plots of corn and vegetables, all divided into little sections called cuerdas. The poorer women often rent just one cuerda and try to grow their own corn for the family and sell some vegetables from it. Those who have more sometimes own two or more cuerdas, and sometimes rent even more. It's hard work, and they always refer to their life as a "battle" or "struggle", but they continue with the battle to feed their families and keep the kids in school.
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Anver

texts.en: Anver is a 32-year-old resident of Khachmaz town, which is located in northeastern Azerbaijan. For the last 10 years, he has rented a stall in a local market where he has sold various food products to his customers. He would like to expand the size of his business and attract more clients by increasing the number and variety of items he sells in his shop. To do this, he has applied to Normicro Khachmaz for a loan of $400, which he will use to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods for sale

loans.name: Aofiafilifaieseaupuo

texts.en: Aofiafilifaieseaupuosamoais is single, 30 years old and runs a very successful business selling pancakes to the people of her village and to students in local schools. She would like to increase her income, and has applied for a loan of $300 to buy ingredients -- such as flour, sugar, fat and yeast -- that she needs to make and sell more pancakes. She is very happy with the way her business is growing, and hopes that this loan will help it continue to expand and make possible more growth and more loans in the future .

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her pancakes business

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: I am Parveen A. from Lahore, a big city in Pakistan. I am married with three children, all of whom attend school. I am a housewife and my husband makes and sells shoes. He is the only breadwinner of the entire family. We are finding it hard to manage our household expenses and we feel the need of an extra income. Please lend us $350 to invest in our shoe business. My husband plans to buy the necessary materials in bulk required in shoemaking to lower our costs.

loans.use: To expand shoe business

loans.name: Lucia Adelaida

texts.es:
Doña Lucia is 48 years old, and she lives in the neighborhood of Laureles in the North of Managua. She is a baker, and has her business in her house. She makes all sorts of cakes and pastries. She also sells her goods through the corner stores. Doña Lucia is married and has an 18 year old daughter. Her husband is a security guard and he helps her with the supporting their family. She’s a well-known pastry chef in the neighborhood, because she has put a lot of effort and commitment to her work. She needs the loan to buy an oven in order to produce more. Her goal is to be able to increase her earnings with the oven and to be able to improve her home in the near future.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Doña Lucia tiene 48 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte de Managua. Ella es panadera, y su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación, ella hace todo tipo de tortas y repostería, y también vende a las pulperías por encargos. Doña Lucia es casada y tiene una hija de 18 años, su esposo es Guarda Seguridad y la apoya con la manutención del hogar. Es una reconocida repostera en el barrio porque le ha puesto mucho esfuerzo y empeño a su trabajo. Necesita el crédito para comprar un horno para poder extender su producción ya que con el que tiene actualmente muy poco puede producir. Estos ingresos le ayudarian para mejorar su vivienda que en un futuro próximo es su meta.

loans.use: Buy an oven for her bakery

loans.name: Mansouratou

texts.fr:
Born on January 20, 1952 in COTONOU, the economic capital of BENIN, Ms. Mansouratou L. it married and a mother of 5 children. Being a baker for several years now, she also started the artisanal production of sweet bread three years ago. The high demand from her customers obliges her to increase her production, which is why she is asking for a loan to satisfy her customers' needs.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 20 janvier 1952 à COTONOU capitale économique du BENIN , elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Revendeuse du pain il y a quelques années, elle s’est lancée dans la fabrication artisanale du pain sucré depuis trois ans. La forte demande de sa clientèle l’oblige à accroître sa production d’où la nécessité de se référer à un crédit pour satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 20 bags of corn flour and 5 caster sugar bags

loans.name: Ni Made Martini

texts.id:
Ni Made Martini’s stall opens at 2 pm, because since morning Ni Made Martini works in an organization within the village. Although Ni Made Martini’s stall only open from the afternoon, but the customers that visit are constantly crowded. Ni Made Martini set up her stall in front of her home, which actually is by the main road, a place crowded with people passing by. The items sold are purchased from the public market in the city. Capital required for funding merchandise for 3 days amount to Rp. 300.000.- (about USD33) and generate daily profit of Rp. 35.000 (USD4). Usually frequently purchased by customers are soup and fried rice. This stall is opened until 10 pm. Her daughter and husband who support this effort assist Ni Made Martini. The income generated provides the need of the household. For her future plan, Ni Made Martini intend to develop her business by improving the condition of her stall so that customers feel comfortable buying at her place.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha Warung Ni Made Martini dibuka setiap pukul 02.00 siang, karena dari pagi Ni Made Martini bekerja di lembaga di desanya. Walau warung Ni Made Martini buka agak siang, tetapi pelanggan yang datang tetap ramai. Ni Made Martini membuka warung didepan rumahnya yang kebetulan berada dipinggir jalan utama, tempat ramai orang lalu lalang. Barang yang dijual dibeli dipasar umum dikotanya. Setiap 3 hari sekali Ni Made Martini membeli barang untuk dijual. Modal yang diperlukan untuk membeli barang dagangan dalam 3 hari sebesar Rp. 300.000.- dan mendapat keuntungan perhari Rp. 35.000.- Biasanya yang ramai dibeli oleh pelanggannya adalah Soto dan Nasi Goreng. Warung ini dibuka sampai pukul 10.00 malam. Ni Made Martini dibantu oleh 1 anak perempuan dan suami yang sangat mendukung dalam usaha ini. Keuntungan yang didapat sangat membantu kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Untuk rencana kedepannya, Ni Made Martini ingin mengembangkan usahanya lebih besar dengan memperbaiki kondisi warungnya agar pelanggan merasa nyaman berebelanja di tempatnya.

loans.use: Improve condition of stall so that customers feel comfortable to buy (Memperbaiki kondisi warungnya sehingga pelanggannya merasa nyaman berbelanja)

loans.name: Bar Biova Group

texts.en: Bar Biova is a group of 4 people who started a restaurant in the central market of Adéta, a medium-sized town about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo.  The popular Bar Biova was created by Abra A., 42, her son Koffi Gros A., 18, and 2 of Koffi’s friends, Noutala D., 20, and Dovola V., 22.  This tight-knit group of family and close friends opened their restaurant in the center of the bustling marketplace, a location that allows them to attract hungry customers as they doing their weekly shopping.  Bar Biova specializes in ‘Fufu Agouti,’ a traditional Togolese dish made from yam paste in ‘Sauce Agouti.’  Agouti is a tasty groundhog-type animal that lives in the forests of this region of Togo.  The patrons of Bar Biova hope to use this loan to purchase more yams and agouti to increase their production and to, in turn, use the profits from their business to provide for their respective families.

loans.use: To purchase more yams and agouti (ingredients of a popular Togolese dish)

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina has always been the main character in her own development, and her economic independence has made her very sure of herself and of the change she can make through working. She sells cosmetics and some handmade items that she herself makes. She offers them to friends and she is constantly looking for new clients to expand and improve her sales. At the same time she also sells delicious sweets on the street.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Carolina, siempre ha sido protagonista de su propio desarrollo, su independencia económica la ha llevado a ser muy segura de si misma y del cambio que puede realizar con su trabajo. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y de algunas manualidades que ella misma elabora, los ofrece entre sus amigas y está en búsqueda diaria de nuevos clientes para expandir y mejorar sus ventas y a la vez también ofrece ricas gelatinas que vende al paso.

loans.use: To increase her capital to be able to offer more products/Incremento de capital para elevar la oferta de sus artículos.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George O. is 45 years old and is married with 4 children.  He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  George is involved in the sales of provisions and drinks.  He needs the loan amount of $525 to buy more provisions and soft drinks to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: To buy  more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ou

texts.en: Mrs. Ou K., a widow,  is a farmer as well as selling traditional Cambodian cakes (Num Banhchhev). She has two children and one of her daughters is a vegetable seller who helps K. with repayments. They both live in Chreytbong Village, Siem Reap Province. Their incomes cannot support the family’s expenses sufficiently so K. needs to expand her business to increase their income. She is now asking for a loan to purchase a plot of farmland to expand her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland to expand her farming business

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
Bin C. N., 40, works in a local garment factory, while her husband, Top Sophal, works as a construction foreman. She and her husband makes $2.50 and $4 each day, respectively. They live in Phnom Penh with their three children and have taken out a loan to start a new business to open up a new stand to sell some goods.

She has asked for a loan of $500 to purchase a stand to begin to sell some beauty products near her home. She sees this diversification of her income as a good investment for her family and looks forward to seeing how it can benefit her family.

loans.use: Purchase a stand to sell beauty products

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julián tiene 27 años, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 10 y 5 años.
Es ganadero, tiene vaquitas a las que cría y pastea todas las mañanas, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 5 años y considera rentable.Esta actividad le toda la mañanas para llevarlos a los pastizales a que se alimenten, luego de haberlos cuidado durante varios meses, los lleva a vender, etapa que se hace complicada por motivos del transporte, al no tener un propio vehículo, debe amoldarse a los tiempos y precios que le ofrezcan.Esporádicamente también se dedica a la agricultura, pero no lo hace de lleno, porque considera que los tiempos han cambiado mucho para que sea una labor satisfactoria.
Julián tiene en sus dos hijos, sus motivos de seguir luchando como ganadero y agricultor. 
Ahora, desea invertir en la mejora de su ganado vacuno, los cuales son más rentables en los mercados.
texts.en:
Julian is 27 years of age, and he lives with his wife and two children, ages 10 and 5. He is a livestock breeder; he has little cows which he breeds and grazes every morning. He has been doing this for the past 5 years and considers it very profitable. He takes his livestock to the pastures every morning for nourishment. Then, after caring for them for several months, he takes them to be sold, but this phase is complicated due to transportation issues. Because he does not own his own vehicle, he must adjust to the schedules and prices that are offered to him. He also sporadically ventures into agriculture, but he does not do this full-time because he believes that times have changed considerably like for it to be a satisfactory occupation.

Julian’s two children are his reason for continuing his efforts as a livestock breeder and farmer. Today, he wishes to invest in the improvement of his beef cattle, which is more profitable in the markets.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the improvement of the quality of his beef cattle.

loans.name: Loimata

texts.en:
Loimata I. is 29 years old and is married with three children.  She has many years of experience selling taro and bananas. She sells to the villagers about three days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD as well.  

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about 145 USD). SPBD loans are Loimata's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She works hard to support her kids at school and attend church on a consistent basis. Her husband and her brothers are fully engaged with her business as well.

loans.use: To purchase taro tubers, weed killer, pesticides, chemicals, shovels, bushknives, and labour wages for her brothers helping her husband plant crops.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: Dame G. Yvette est née le 11/03/1963 à Cotonou et est originaire de Ouidah dans le département de l'Atlantique. Elle eut un bref cursus scolaire jusqu'en classe de Quatrième au Collège d'Enseignement Général de Dantokpa à Cotonou avant d'abandonner les classes suite au décès de son papa. Elle alla par la suite en apprentissage. Dans un premier temps elle apprit la couture et ce pendant  2 ans. Finalement elle opta pour la tresse  et la coiffure. Elle exerce le métier de Tresseuse Coiffeuse depuis 25 ans déjà. Parallèlement à son métier, elle vend les mèches synthétiques. Depuis 2 ans, elle a commencé par diversifier son activité en y associant la vente de bonbons et autres friandises. C'est pour le renforcement de ses activités qu'elle sollicite ce troisième prêt de 140000f pour s'approvisionner en mèches, bonbons et savons. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yvette G. was born on March 11, 1963 in Cotonou and comes from Ouidah in the Atlantic Department. She was briefly in school until fourth grade in the "Collège d'Enseignement Général" of Dantokpa in Cotonou before dropping out of school following her father's death. She then went on to learn a job. In the beginning, she learned sewing for two years. In the end, she chose braiding and hairdressing. She's been a hairdresser and braider for 25 years now. In parallel to this activity, she sells synthetic hair extensions. Two years ago, she started diversifying her activity by selling various kinds of sweets and other food products. To bolster her business, she's seeking this third loan of XOF 140'000 (ca US$ 280) to purchase hair extensions, sweets, and soaps. Married, she's the mother of four children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 6 dozens of hair extensions, 21 packs of sweets, 4 packs of chewing-gum, and one box of soap.

loans.name: Bhagan Saleem Masih Group

texts.en:
Bhagan baji is a 40-year-old woman who resides in Kasur, Pakistan, a city famous for its sweetmeat. She has been living in this city for the past 25 years. Her husband, S. M., is a government employee. She has five children: two sons and three daughters. Her elder son is in the 8th standard grade and her younger son is in the 2nd standard grade. Her elder daughter is in the 7th standard grade, the next daughter is in the 6th standard grade, and her youngest daughter is in the 3rd standard grade. 

Bhagan baji has a business selling clothes. She runs this business to share her income with her husband, so that he is able to meet all of their household expenses and the desires of her children. 

She successfully repaid her three previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to expand her clothing business. 

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy leather to resell. Salma baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Asia baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama M. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de céréales au marché de Lavie, un village situé à environ 135 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans et demeure sa principale source de revenus. Elle souhaite avec ce troisième crédit augmenter son stock pour répondre aux besoins de ses clients. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Adama M. is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three. She is a retailer of grains at the marketplace of Lavie, a village located about 135 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She has been in this business for five years, and it remains her principal source of income. She would like to use this third loan to increase her inventory to meet the needs of her customers. She is counting on this opportunity to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, and peanuts for retail sale

loans.name: Mrs. Navy Bun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people in Boeng Tras village, in Kampong Cham province, have formed a village bank loan group and Mrs. Navy B. is the village bank president. She owns a small restaurant where she sells rice soup as a breakfast food to the villagers. Her husband, Mr. Kul Saroeun, is a fisherman wH. catches a small quantity of fish to support the family. In order to catch more fish, Mrs. Navy B. is requesting a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is 48 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are fishermen while the other is a grocer, wH. owns a small store. 

Four members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets for fishing.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiền năm nay 45 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương đã được 10 năm. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhưng sau đó chị đã đầu tư đi học nghề may Hiện tại chị đang là chủ hiệu may tại nhà còn chồng chị đi làm thợ xây. Với mức thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị Hiền đang ngày càng ổn định hơn Vòng vốn tới chị Hiền mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm vải về may quần áo phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con địa phương.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 45 years old. She has been with TYM Fund for 10 years. In the beginning, she borrowed funds to invest in livestock raising, but after learning how to sew, she opened her own tailor business. Her husband works as a construction worker. At the income of 2,000,000 VND per month, her family's life standard is becoming more stable and improving. She would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in more fabric for sewing to meet the needs of her local customers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Chou

texts.en: K. is 43 years old and resides in Pursat Province, Cambodia, where she makes an income by raising pigs at home. She is also a local chef for wedding parties and buys rice supplies to sell in the village to gain additional income. She is married to Chomroeun, 47, who owns a car which he uses to provide taxi service. The couple have four children who attend school. Two are in primary school and the others are in high school. As the rice harvesting season is approaching, K. is requesting a loan amount of $1100 from HKL, in order to purchase rice supplies to sell.

loans.use: To purchase rice supplies for sell

loans.name: Patricia Marilú

texts.es: Patricia Marilú G., reside en ciudad Arce junto a su esposo e hijos. Ella posee un negocio frente al Instituto Geriel, su venta de es pupusas, comida típica salvadoreña hecha de masa de maíz revuelta con queso, frijoles y chicharrón, así también vende refrescos y golosinas, ella posee una imagen muy limpia y ordenada y se destaca por ser una mujer muy trabajadora. Patricia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir más su negocio, ya que a pesar que sus ventas son hasta cierto punto estables, no le es suficiente para todos sus gastos personas, es por ello que el mayor deseo de Patricia es el de poder aumentar sus ingresos para poder colaborar juntos a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, con el fin de brindarles una mejor vida a sus hijo.
texts.en:
Patricia Marilú G. lives in the city of Arce, along with her husband and children. She has a business in front of the Geriel Institute where she sells pupusas, a typical Salvadorean food made with corn meal, cheese, beans, and fried pork. She also sells beverages and snacks. She has a reputation for being extremely clean and neat, and stands out for being very hard-working. Patricia requests a loan through which she could better supply her business. Even though her sales are stable up to a certain point, her income is not always enough to cover her personal expenses. This is the reason why Patricia’s greatest wish is to be able to increase her income, so she can contribute to the household expenses with her husband. Her goal is to provide a better standard of living for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Isabelle

texts.fr:
JOHNSON Isabelle est âgée de 45 ans et est mariée à TOMETISSIN Claude. Isabelle a avec son mari deux enfants tous scolarisés. Isabelle et sa famille résident à Gbégamey un quartier populaire de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Isabelle a pour activité la vente de céréales et de divers (bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.) dans l’un des  marchés locaux de la ville de Cotonou. Isabelle, grâce à cette activité arrive à supporter une partie des charges de sa famille notamment la scolarisation des enfants. Isabelle avait bénéficié de crédit à ALIDé pour renforcer son activité et elle l'avait bien remboursé. Actuellement Isabelle sollicite un nouveau prêt à investir dans son activité pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Isabelle Johnson is 45 years old and married to Claude Tometissin. She and her husband have two children, both of whom attend school. She and her family live in Gbégamey, a working-class district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Isabelle makes a living selling cereals and sundries (candy, cookies, cartons of milk, canned goods such as sardines, tomatoes and sugar, pasta, laundry and dishwasher detergents, bathroom soap etc.) at a local market in Cotonou. Her business enables her to ensure that a portion of the family expenses is covered, her children’s school education in particular. Isabelle previously obtained a loan from ALIDÉ to develop her business and paid it back without issue. She is currently looking to obtain another loan to invest in her business to better meet customer demand. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Fon, Benin’s regional language. Benin is a small West African country next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. ALIDÉ offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sundries (detergent, household soap, canned goods, toothpaste, toothbrushes, pasta and cereal grains: maize, beans, rice, millet, cassava flour.)

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
DORA S. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SHIPIBAS” vive en el Jr Israel Mz.193.Lt.6, yarinacocha, tiene 51 años de edad, 7 hijos, y su pareja es maderero (venta de madera).

Se inició en el negocio de venta de abarrotes, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró arroz, azúcar, huevos, etc. para vender, cuenta con clientes frecuentes y su negocio ha ido creciendo.

Ella ha progresado con su familia y el negocio ha mejorado.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de más gaseosas y productos diversos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, otros..

“si no fuese por estos préstamos que dá Manuela Ramos creo que no tendría mi negocio, por ello estoy feliz de pertenecer a esta institución.
texts.en:
DORA S. R. is a member of the “MUJERES SHIPIBAS” Microfinance Institute. She lives in Yarinacocha . She is a 51-year-old mother with 7 children. Her husband sells lumber for a living.

She started her own general store with her first 300.00 PEN loan. She purchased rice, sugar, eggs, etc. to sell them in her store. She has a fixed clientele, and her business has been growing.

She and her family have made progress, and her business has improved. With this 1,200.00 PEN loan, she will purchase more soft drinks and an assortment of goods, such as rice, sugar, noodles, and others.

“If it weren’t for the loans that Manuela Ramos has given me, I don’t think I would have my own business. For this reason, I am happy to be a part of this institution.”

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and other products (sugar, eggs, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Khalifa Ababacar

texts.fr: MR F. EST NE LE 21 JUILLET 1959 A THIES .IL EST MARIE ET EST PERE DE CINQ ENFANTS .IL LOGE AVEC SA FAMILLE AU QUARTIER CITE LAMY DE THIES.IL EST PLANIFICATEUR AU MINISTERE DE L'ECONOIE ET DES FINANCES.IL SOLLICITE CE PRET DANS LE BUT DE FAIRE FACE A UN BESOIN SOCIAL URGENT.
texts.en:
Mr. F. was born on July 21, 1959 in Thiès. He is married and the father of five children. He is housed with his family in the CITE LAMY district of Thiès. He is a planner at the ministry of the economy and finances. He’s requesting this loan with the goal of addressing an urgent societal need.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Societal need

loans.name: Djodassi

texts.fr: Cette femme a entamé en 2002 le commerce de miel qu’elle met dans des bidons de 1.5 litres, ses clients achètent chez elle le miel pour boire ou pour faire des médicaments. Ce commerce lui réussit bien et elle veut l’agrandir, c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 04 bidons de 25 litres elle est mariée et a 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady began selling honey in 2002. She puts it in cans of 1.5 liters. Her customers buy honey from her to drink or to make medicines out of it. This business is successful and she wants to expand it. For this reason she is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 4 jerry cans of 25 liters. She is married and has 2 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: achat de miel

loans.name: Benedict Okoth

texts.en: Benedict Okoth is married with three children. He runs a butcher shop in Kisumu city, which he started after accessing his first loan from KADET. He sells predominantly beef products and also runs a small café, jointly with his wife. He hopes to use the money from this, his second loan, to re-stock his butcher shop and to diversify into other meat products like chicken. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To improve his butcher business and to sell other meat products like poultry

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en: Mahir

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep and two calves

loans.name: Katalina

texts.en:
Katalina is a member of the Mgodi North borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is a 46-year-old woman, married, and the mother of six children. Her children are aged 34, 32, 29, 27, 23, and 20 years.

Katalina started her own business selling charcoal two years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 60,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Katalina’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 TSH in order to buy charcoal. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Katalina hopes to save money, get more food for her family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Copo De Nieve Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Copo de nieve” pertenece a la familia de pro-mujer hace tres años aproximadamente, se reúnen en el centro focal  Villa Exaltación,  ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con dieciséis miembros activos y han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.
Actualmente su presidenta es  Marina Catillo. Diversos son los  negocios de este grupo, como ser; venta de tubérculos ( papa, oca,  chuño y tunta ),elaboración y venta de comida,  venta de ropa, verdura, víveres  y otros. La asociación Copo De Nieve desea  comprar  mercadería y/o insumos, de esta manera aumentaran sus ganancias con el único objetivo de mantener estabilidad económica de sus hogares.
texts.en:
The Copo de Nieve Association has been a part of the Kiva family, Pro-Mujer, for approximately three years. The members meet in the Villa Exaltación centre which is located in the town of El Alto. Currently there are sixteen active members—they have shown themselves to be a well-organised group with regard to their loan repayments. At the moment the president of the group is Marina Catillo. The members have a variety of businesses, for example selling vegetables such as potatoes, oca, chuño (freeze-dried potato), and tunta (dried potato). Other members prepare and sell food, clothing, vegetables, groceries, etc. The Copo de Nieve Association would like to buy more merchandise and/or ingredients so they can increase their profits in order to have financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and food ingredients

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael O. has been a mechanic in Naivasha town for the last eight years. He is married to Millicent O. and they have a four-year-old child. This will be Michael's first loan with KADET and he plans to use the loan to buy motor vehicle spares to use in his garage. In future, Michael plans to add a retail section in his garage to sell motor vehicle spare parts to diversify his income stream. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy motor vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
“Be patient and always put your trust in the Lord in everything you do,” Esperanza says. Esperanza raises hogs. She is married to Castor and they are blessed with six children: Edeza - 14 years old, Carlo - 13 years old, Castor JR - 11 years old, Cathleen - 9 years old, Chenlie Joy - 3 years old, and the youngest is Charm Paul - 1 year old. They live in the village of Parog-Parog Solana, Cagayan. Through the business she manages, Esperanza is able to assist her husband in providing their family needs.

Esperanza has applied for a loan of 23,000 PHP from Kiva lenders that will be used as additional capital for her hog raising business. She will also use the loan to help her husband purchase farm supplies and feed for their hogs. She is hoping and praying for lenders to lend her the requested loan amount.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Mrs. Heng Hin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people who live in Svay Chal village in Takeo province made up the village bank loan and they will use the loan which they obtained in different purposes. Mrs. Heng H. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a fruit seller. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit to re-sell and she would use the rest of the loan to buy fishnets for her husband’s fishing business. Her husband, Mr. Prum Sitha, is a construction worker and fisherman. Mrs. Heng H. is 39 years old and the mother of four children three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is staying at home because that child is too young to work or stuD.. 

Three members in this village loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fruit to re-sell and she would use the rest of the loan to buy fishnets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Silvia Angélica

texts.es: Silvia Angélica S. D. H.  resiD. en Sacacoyo en el departamento D. La Libertad. Silvia tiene 41 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y cuatro hijos D. 18, 14, 13 y 10 años D. edad todos se encuentran estudiando. Silvia y su esposo se apoyan mutuamente en los gastos familiares, ya que sus cuatro hijos se encuentran estudiando simultáneamente, para esta pareja es muy difícil todos los gastos mensuales, es por ello que Silvia se decidió apoyar a su esposo; con una pequeña tienda que ha instalado desD. su casa, la cual ahora por medio D. este crédito pretenD. surtir, para generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Silvia Angélica S. D. H. lives in Sacacoyo in the La Libertad department. Silvia, 41, lives with her husband and their four children. The children are 18, 14, 13, and 10. They go to school. Silvia and her husband mutually support each other with the family expenses. Since their four children are all in school at the same time, meeting the monthly expenses is difficult for this couple. That is why Silvia decided to help her husband by setting up a small store in her house. With this loan she now aims to stock the store in order to generate greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes M. is 45 years old, married with five children aged between 7 and 25 years, and she takes care of one dependent as well. Agnes lives in the Gatsibo district, approximately four hours drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

It is in this area that, since 2004, Agnes has operated her business of selling petroleum (gasoline), a much-needed household supply in Rwanda. The hours of her business require that she works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Although Agnes has been in this business for five years, she would like a loan in order to expand her working capital which will help her to pay her suppliers and get lower rates for her products. All of this should result in increasing the profits of her business. For that to happen, she is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company.

With this business expansion, Agnes hopes to get more customers. She will will likely reinvest any potential profits in the business as well as take better care of her family's needs and begin to build a more secure future for them.

loans.use: To buy petroleum containers

loans.name: Encarna

texts.es: Encarna Q. es una socia muy colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 64 años, es madre de seis hijos (todos mayores de edad), ella tiene una bodega en su casa, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de su esposo. Encarna forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Divinas” desde hace cuatro años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en la compra de productos para la venta de menús. En la actulidad Encarna necesita un crédito de 3000 que será utilizado una parte en artículos para su bodega y otra parte invertirá en material para el arreglo del piso de su negocio, así poder dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. La meta de Encarna es implementar su negocio y tener una variedad de productos para tener más clientes.
texts.en:
Encarna Q. is a very helpful member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 64 and has six children (they are all adults). She has a convenience store in her house. She does this work with her husband’s support. Encarna has been a member of the Las Divinas Communal bank for four years. Her first loan for 300 PEN allowed her to buy products for the sale of her à la carte meals. Encarna currently needs a loan for 3,000 PEN. She will use part of the money to buy items for her convenience store. She will use the other part to buy material to fix her business’ floor. That way she will be able to give her customers better service. Encarna’s goal is to set up her store and to have a greater variety of products to get more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy items for her convenience store and material to fix her business' floor

loans.name: Akwal

texts.en:
Akwal M. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.  Akwal is 55 years old and is married to a husband that is a peasant. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Khumor

texts.ru: Хумор Джаборова проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст 47 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж работает на стройке. Сын на данный момент находится в России на заработках. Сама клиентка занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном торгует детской одеждой. Эти видом бизнесом занимается более 2 лет. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Khumor Djabarova lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is 47 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband works in construction. Her son is working in Russia at this time. She sells on the market. She mainly sells children's clothing. Khumor has been doing this business for more than two years. She is asking for a loan to increase circulation of goods.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase circulation

loans.name: Service To God Group

texts.en: Adriana is a 34-year-old married mother of four children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a mostly commercial community. Adriana trades in bags and underwear for ladies. She hawks and treks to sell. Adriana is the leader of a trust bank group called Service to God. The members of the group are mainly traders. They are hard working, trust themselves and want the loan to invest in their businesses. Adriana is the one standing in the group photograph.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Luz Y Amor Group

texts.es: El  grupo Luz y Amor está integrado por tres mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras ella son Yenny Vanessa G. P.   quien vende ropa y  cosméticos de la Avon, Silvia Rosa H. hace y vende frijoles cocidos y nacatamales los cuales son muy demandados debido a que en  la mesa del nicaragüense a cualquier tiempo no debe faltar los frijoles y los nacatamales especialmente los fines de semana y  Norma  Felicitas Espinoza  comercializa ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The group "Luz y Amor" (Light and Love) is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women. Yenny Vanessa G. P. sells clothing and Avon cosmetics. Silvia Rosa H. makes and sells cooked beans and pork tamales, which are very much in demand, because at no time should a Nicaraguan table be missing beans and pork tamales, especially on weekends. Norma Felicitas Espinoze sells clothing and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca L. is from the village of Nampicuan. She is 57 years old. Rebecca is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rebecca is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, she raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes  from raising pigs for sale. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for more than 8 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Rebecca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Rebecca from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly, D. 49 años, es una madre soltera muy amorosa y trabajadora tiene 5 hijos pero actualmente solo vive con 3 D. ellos: Abigail D. 20, Wendy D. 18 y Gisela D. 15 años, sus otros dos hijos ya tiene familia y son independientes. Actualmente vive en casa D. su madre, Doña Cirila D. 74 años. 

Nelly trabaja diariamente con su inseparable carretilla donD. transporta sus deliciosas golosinas, para ello se ubica en las puertas D. un D. los colegios D. la ciudad D. Tarma, donD. tiene muchos clientes, pues es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes D. comprar más D. lo que en un inicio querían.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas D. venta, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer bajo el inclemente sol todos los días, puesto que es agotador. Para el futuro, espera juntar más dinero para instalar una tienda D. abarrotes donD. pueda atender a sus clientes con mayor tranquilidad.

Este es el sétimo préstamo D. Nelly con MFP y sabe que tiene que cumplir con los pagos D. todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 49, is a very loving and hard-working single mother. She has five children but only lives with three of them: Abigail, 20, Wendy, 18, and Gisela, 15. Her other two children are independent and already have families of their own. Sho lives at home with her 74-year-old mother, Doña Cirila. Nelly works everyday with her trusty little cart carrying delicious candies, and she places herself at the door of one of the high schools in the city of Tarma, where she has many customers. She is a very persuasive saleswoman, and she always ends up convincing her customers to buy more than they initially want. What she likes the best about her job is being able to chat with her fellow businesswomen. She has been at this job for 8 years, and she considers staying under the merciless sun every day as the most difficult part, as it is an exhausting place to be. In the future, she hopes to get together enough money to be able to construct a grocery store where she can more easily tend to her customers. This is Nelly's seventh loan with MFP, and she knows that she must meet the monthy repayments on time. She is a very joyful and supportive member of her community bank. She plans to use the 1,000 nuevos soles to buy more candies in order to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise selection

loans.name: Manuel Carlos

texts.es:
Manuel C. es socio del banco comunal Prod Natura, vive en la comunidad Chilcapamba en la parroquia Santa Ana, su principal  actividad económica es la agricultura y el turismo siendo uno de sus principales atractivos  turísticos  el Cerro de Mama Tepal  aquí encontramos una pequeña capilla donde se celebra todos los años las fiestas de las cruces y además podemos disfrutar de la maravillosa vista de la urbe cuencana y parte de Azogues.

Manuel tiene 28 años  es soltero a pesar de tener su casa propia en Santa Ana prefiere arrendar una casa  en Chilcapamba por la facilidad de llegar a su trabajo , nuestro amigo es comerciante de productos naturales  lleva 2 años en este negocio, nos comenta que le va bien porque el producto ha mejorado su calidad y mantienen  un stock variado y suficiente para abastecer los pedidos de su exigente clientela puesto que hace siete meses existía escasez de los mismos.

Lleva dos ciclos trabajando con la fundación, con el primer credito se abasteció de mercadería escaza para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes y ahora con el nuevo credito solicitado comprará vitaminas, nutrientes, suplementos alimenticios, etc. para mantener un stock variado para ofrecer a su distinguida clientela.

Su gran sueño adquirir  un auto  para movilizar con sus productos y dar un mejor servicio y rápido a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Manuel C. is a member of the “Prod Natura” Communal Bank. He lives in the community of Chilcapamba in Santa Ana Parish. The main business activities are agriculture and tourism. One of its main tourist attractions is the Mama Tepal Hill. There you will find a small chapel where “Las Fiestas de las Cruces” (The Festivals of the Crosses) are held every year. One is also able to enjoy the marvelous view of the city of Cuenca and part of Azogues.

Manuel is 28 years old and single. Even though he has his own home in Santa Ana, he would prefer to rent a house in Chilcapamba because it would be easier for him to get to work. Manuel is a natural products salesperson with two years of experience in this business. He says that things are going well because the product has improved in its quality and he has maintained a varied yet sufficient stock to fulfill the orders from his demanding customers. Seven months ago, he suffered from a shortage of products.

This is his second loan cycle with the Foundation. With his first loan, he was able to order merchandise that he was low in supply so that he could complete the orders from his customers. Now with this new loan he is requesting, he will purchase vitamins, nutrients, diet supplements, and other products so that he can maintain a varied stock to offer his distinguished customers.

His greatest dream is to acquire an automobile so that he can travel with his products and provide better and faster service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vitamins, nutrients, diet supplements, and other products

loans.name: Cristina Ramona

texts.es: La señora Cristina Ramona  cuenta con 36 años de edad, casada viven con sus tres hijos actual mente ella reside en el lugar conocido como Caserío Tzamnimasac, del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán Guatemala ella se dedica al comercio en venta de ropa casual para caballeros por las necesidades personales y la de su familia se acercó a las instalaciones de la Asociación Asdir para adquirir un préstamo ya que la demanda de sus clientes son muchas, por lo que ella requiere de más capital para poder surtir su mercadería y como tambien de ampliar y distribuir mejor su negocio en otros lugares ayudando así a familia dándole a sus hijos una mejor condición de vida y educación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cristina Ramona is 36 years old, is married, and lives with her three children. Currently, she lives in Caserío Tzamnimasac in Totonicapán, Guatemala. She sells casual clothing for men. Because of her family's needs, Cristina went to Kiva partner Asociación ASDIR. She asks for a loan which she will use to meet the many demands of her customers. She needs more capital to buy goods and to expand her business to other locations. In this way, she will help her family and will give her children better conditions and an education.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Ruth Marcia

texts.es:
La comunidad San Bartolo se caracteriza por sus bellas praderas, su vegetación exuberante y sus lindos campos y su gente amable y muy cordial como nuestra socia la señora  Ruth Z. es socia del Bankito Progresista hace  dos ciclos, con los préstamos recibidos ha sobrellevado su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras  en el mercado 9 de Octubre  donde labora hace  16 años; ahora con el dinero que reciba comprará fréjol, arveja, zanahoria, remolacha, apio, acelga, naranjas, uvas, fresas, manzanas, guineos, etc.  para abastecer su puesto con productos surtidos.

Ruth tiene 41 años  vive en la comunidad San Bartolo junto a dos de sus tres hijas, la mayor casada con quien comparte la casa y los gastos que en ella se generan y su hija de 14 años que estudia en un colegio de la comunidad;  la segunda hija vive en unión libre de forma independiente con su pareja.  Nuestra socia  se divorció de su esposo hace 14 años porque mucho la maltrataba.
su meta es de poder seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The San Bartolo community is known for its lovely meadows, thick vegetation, beautiful fields, as well as friendly, cordial people, such as Mrs. Ruth Z., member of the Bankito Progresista for two cycles now. Using loans granted, she has maintained her business, which is selling produce in the October 9 Market, where she has been for 16 years. With the money granted her, she will buy beans, peas, carrots, beets, celery, chard, oranges, grapes, strawberries, apples, bananas, etc. to stock her stall with a variety of products. Ruth is 41 years old, and lives in the San Bartolo community with two or her three daughters. She shares a house with the oldest, sharing expenses as well, and her 14-year-old daughter, who is a student in one of the community’s high schools. The second daughter lives independently with her common-law husband. Ruth divorced her husband 14 years ago, because he abused her. Her goal is to continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, peas, carrots, beets, celery, chard, oranges, grapes, strawberries, applies, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr:
Madame Aïssatou M. est une femme mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait le commerce depuis 2004. C'est en aidant son mari dans sa boutique qu'elle prit goût au commerce. Ainsi, elle a décidé de gérer son propre commerce après une bonne comprèhension des affaires. 
Agée de 35 ans, Madame Aïssatou M.  pense que le commerce représente une identité partagée pour les femmes de sa localité, cette activité les valorise davantage et elles sont estimées par leurs maris. 
Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un prêt de 200 000 FCFA pour acheter des tissus, chaussures, parfums et des bols qu'elle va commercialiser.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aïssatou M. is married and the mother of six children. She has been active in commerce since 2004. She initially took an interest in commercial activities by helping her husband in his shop. Having acquired a solid understanding of commercial practices, she then decided to run her own business. Mrs. Aïssatou M. is 35 years old, and believes that commerce is a shared activity among women in her locality, which boosts their sense of self-worth and wins the esteem of their husbands. To strengthen her business she is requesting a loan for 200,000 FCFA, to buy clothing fabric, shoes, perfume and bowls she will then resell.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase various products

loans.name: Jessilyn

texts.en:
Jessilyn A. is from the village of San Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 50 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Jessilyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Jessilyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Jessilyn joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jessilyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marie Florence

texts.fr: S. Marie Florence est née en 1983 au Benin. Marie Florence vit depuis dix ans au quartier Dédokpo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Marie Florence est mariée à TOTTIN Fidèle, un guérisseur traditionnel. Marie Florence est mère d'un enfant scolarisé. Marie Florence partage les charges familiales avec son mari. La famille vit ensemble. Marie Florence exerce depuis huit ans au grand marché international du Bénin (Dantokpa), comme activité principale la vente de divers produits (mayonnaise, lait, sucre, moutarde, petits pois, concombre, berterave, carottes, choux, pommes de terre, etc.). Marie Florence s'approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. Marie Florence a déja bénéficié de quatre concours financiers auprès de ALIDé avec un bon remboursement. C'est toujours pour accroitre son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle que Marie Florence sollicite un nouveau prèt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Marie Florence S. was born in 1983 in Benin. She has lived for ten years in the Dédokpo borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Fidèle TOTTIN, a traditional healer. She is the mother of one child attending school. The family lives together, and Marie Florence shares family expenses with her husband. For the past eight years Marie Florence’s main activity has been the retail commerce of various food products (mayonnaise, milk, sugar, peas, cucumbers, beets, carrots, cabbages, potatoes, etc.) at the great international market of Benin: Dantokpa. She gets her supplies from Lomé in Togo, a neighbouring country. Marie Florence has already been granted four financial loans from ALIDé which were reimbursed satisfactorily. She is now requesting another loan from ALIDé, with the view of increasing her business activity and providing a better response to her customer's demands.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products (potatoes, cabbages, carrots, mayonnaise, milk, peas, etc.)

loans.name: Toun

texts.en:
Mr. N. is a hard-working man who has been earning a living as a fish raiser. He owns a pond in the village where he raises a hundred kg of fish. He catches and sells the fish to middlemen after raising them for four months.
