 Additionally, N. plants a few crops around the pond for extra income. He has a life partner in his wife who works sewing clothes in the garment industry (she also appears in the photo). They married some years ago but don’t have any children yet. 

N. has been feeding his fish for two months but they are not growing well due to the lack of food. Because of that, N. is applying for a loan to be used to purchase many sacks of fish food to fatten his fish and improve his yield.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of fish food to improve fish yield.

loans.name: Nesfora

texts.en:
Nesfora A. is from the village of D'ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Nesfora owns and operates a restaurant where she serves local foods to customers in the local community. Nesfora has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Nesfora joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a bedroom in her house

loans.name: Las Populares Group

texts.es:
Esta unidad de desarrollo (UDE) se llama “LAS POPULARES” ellas le pusieron a su grupo así por que en ese tiempo avía una novela donde salía un grupo de chicas llamado las populares y tambien por que son muy conocidas todas en su localidad. Las UDES son grupos de más de 10 personas que tiene una cuenta de banco y tienen que reunir semanalmente o quincenalmente para realizar sus pagos. Tiene un representante y un comité que lo gobierna. Este grupo está ubicado en la comunidad de Lázaro Cárdenas perteneciente al municipio de Jungapeo en el Estado de Michoacán. El grupo está conformado por 14 integrantes. 

El representante del grupo se llama Rosa María López M.. Doña Rosa cuenta con 40 años de edad, casada desde hace 24 años con el señor Francisco que se dedica a la albañilería, ellos tienen 5 hijos, Erika de 22 años, Cristian de 20 años, Pablo que tiene 16 años quien le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, Dulce María de 8 años de edad y Francisco de 6 años ambos estudiantes de primaria, Doña Rosa pidió su préstamo para invertir en su taller de costura como son hilos, telas, estambres, pinturas para tela, pinceles, sierres etc. Ella hace bolsas, bordados en servilletas, punto de C. en servilletas y almohadones, blusas de manta, después las decora con dibujos y las colorea. Doña Rosa vende las costuras con sus conocidas, lleva con su negocio hace 5 meses, comenta que le satisface su trabajo, sus clientas dicen que es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, sus metas en la vida es sacar a sus hijos adelante que sigan estudiando, y comenta que en un futuro quisiera tener un negocio fijo y con sus ganancias podrá comprarle a sus hijos útiles escolares y los uniformes para el nuevo ciclo escolar y los medicamentos de su suegra.

Isabel Ángeles Hernández es parte del grupo “Las Populares” tiene 23 años y estudio hasta el segundo año de secundaria y la carrera de cultora de belleza, es casada con el señor Yovani desde hace 8 años, ellos tienen dos niños llamados Miguel de 8 años y Jasón de 6 años. Ella se dedica a vender zapatos y ropa por catalogo, también comenta que vende un poco de bisutería que ella  misma diseña, sus clientes la conocen como una mujer muy trabajadora ya que le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, y una buena vendedora ya que les da buenos precios. Doña Isabel solicito su préstamo para aumentar el negocio de los zapatos y ropa de diferentes colores y tallas para cuando le pidan ya tener en existencia en su casa y ya no mandarlos pedir, también para comprar pedrería y plata para diseñar su joyería, con sus ganancias en un futuro ella quiere tener un local estable en su casa para estar al pendiente de la educación y cuidado de sus niños.     

Los otros 12 integrantes se llaman Gabriela M. M. que se dedica a la venta por catalogo de productos para limpieza del hogar, Viridiana O. T. que diseña y vende bisutería, María Luisa Pérez C. que tiene una tienda de abarrotes, María del Carmen M. R. que se dedica a la venta de ropa interior, Marisol P. Hernández que vende ropa para dama y caballero, Lucia Haide E. Girón que tiene una tienda de abarrotes, Iveth Azucena Pérez O. quien tiene una tienda de celulares, María Isabel T. C. que se dedica a los abarrotes, Georgina T. C. quien vende en una cooperativa escolar, Guillermina C. venta de ropa interior, Jorge Cristian Marín Pérez que tiene un talles de hojalatería y pintura y Araceli L. Velázquez  que se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
texts.en:
This development group is called “Las Populares” (the popular ones). They decided on this name because at the time there was a soap opera that featured a group of young women known as “Las Populares.” It’s also because [its members] are very well known in their neighborhood. Development groups consist of more than ten people. The group has a bank account and its members are required to meet every one or two weeks to make their payments. The group is run by a representative and by a committee. This group has 14 members and is located in the Lázaro Cárdenas community of the City of Jungapeo, Michoacan. The group’s representative is named Rosa María López M.. Rosa is 40 years old, and has been married to Francisco for 24 years. He works as a mason and they have five children; Erika, age 22; Cristian age 20; Pablo age 16; Dulce María, age 8; and Francisco, age 6. Pablo helps with the household expenses and the youngest two attend elementary school. Rosa requested this loan so that she could invest into her sewing shop; things such as thread, fabrics, yarn, fabric paint, colored pencils, fasteners, etc. She makes bags, embroideries and cross point on cloth napkins, pillows, and ponchos. She then decorates them with colors and designs. Rosa sells her crafts to her acquaintances and has been running her business for five months. She tells us that she enjoys her work. Her customers say that she is a hard working and enterprising woman with a desire to come out ahead. Her goals are to help her children get ahead and that they continue with their educations. She also tells us that she would like to have a steady business so that she can use her income to buy school supplies and uniforms for her children for the upcoming school year. She also wants to be able to buy medications that her mother in law needs. Isabel Ángeles Hernández is also a part of the “Las Populares” group. She is 23 years old and completed two years of junior high school as well as having studied to work as a beautician. She’s been married to Yovani for eight years and they have two children named Miguel, age 8, and Jasón, age 6. She sells shoes and clothing through catalogs and tells us that she also sells a bit of costume jewelry that she designs herself. Her customers know her as being a hard working woman who helps her husband with the household expenses, and as a good saleswoman because she gives them good prices. Isabel requested this loan so that she could grow her shoe and clothing business. She will buy items in different colors and sizes so that she will have them on have when her customers request them and not have to order them. She will also buy stones and silver to design her jewelry. She would like to use some of her future earnings to establish a permanent location in her home so that she can watch over her children and their education. The other 12 members are Gabriela M. M., who sells home cleaning products througha catalog; Viridiana O. T., who designs and sells nick nacks; María Luisa Pérez C., who has a grocery store; María del Carmen M. R. who sells undergarnents; Marisol P. Hernández, who sells men’s and women’s clothing; Lucia Haide E. Girón, who has a grocery store; Iveth Azucena Pérez O., who has a cell phone store; María Isabel T. C., who sells groceries; Georgina T. C., who sells items at a school co-op; Guillermina C., who sells undergarnments; Jorge Cristian Marín Pérez, who has a tin and paint shop; and Araceli L. Velázquez, who sells Mexican snacks.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie S. is from the village of Guibang. She is 58 years old. Josie is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Josie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josie has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Josie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah N. lives in the Kazo Bwaise neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. Deborah lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity but has piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and rent.

Deborah has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for seven years and she works six days out of every week. Deborah sells her products at the market, either wholesale or retail. She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Deborah include defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children up to the university level and also build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared, 30, is married and has two children. He runs a furniture workshop. He has been running the workshop with two employees. To earn extra income, he also runs a retail shop and his wife assists him in running the business. Jared, who has 10 years of experience in his business, hopes to open more businesses in the future. He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to expand his furniture business.

He was not available for the photo, so we took his wife’s photo in their retail business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: El Sr. Freddy R. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como Asesor legal en la Alcaldía Municipal donde tiene 3 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de computadora e impresora.
texts.en: Freddy R. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón and currently works as a legal consultant for the city hall.  He has worked there for three years.  This will be his first loan through Ceprodel and he will use the money to buy a computer and printer.

loans.use: Computer and printer

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona M. is from the village of Poblacion 3,  Clarin Misamis, Occidental. She is 40 years old and married, with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Alona runs a general store, where she sells products such as sugar, shampoo, noodles, salt, biscuits and juice packs in the local community. Alona has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month.

Alona joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alona is requesting her first loan, for 3000 PHP, to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bebeth

texts.en:
Bebeth is a devoted mother to her three children. She is married to her loving spouse and lives in the beautiful province of Teresa, Rizal. She and her husband are operating a sari-sari (variety) store. Despite many challenges in their life, they never give up the fight against poverty.

During her 4 years at ASHI, she has shown very good performance as a member, and she is trusted by ASHI for her solid record. Aside from maintaining an excellent performance in repayment, business, and attendance in ASHI, Bebeth has also cared for the needs of her children at home and in school.

Bebeth plans to use her new loans to expanded her variety store. This loan will enable her to finally reach her dreams in life: to have a growing business, to build a concrete and spacious home to live in, to have a good life, and to have a happy family as well. She hopes the loans from ASHI, Kiva's field partner, will support the education of all her children. She believes that her business will help her family to rise up and fight against poverty, as well as provide for the educational needs of her children. She is very grateful to ASHI and Kiva for the continuous love and support of her dreams.

Bebeth hopes her business will continue to flourish so she can provide long-term financial stability for her family. Therefore, she is now requesting another Kiva loan, this time for 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), to purchase more groceries for her store. This will allow her to grow her business further so that her three children can fulfill their dreams of completing a college degree and experience a life that’s full of contentment. 

Bebeth is very happy to be a Kiva borrower and says thank you for offering financial support for her business dreams.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the compressor.

loans.name: Teriya (Amitié) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Teriya (amitié) de l‘association Badeya est composé de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans, 4 enfants et vivant dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Heremakono-Centre de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ces  femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt MAMBA D.,la présidente du groupe, compte acheter, une balle de friperie et 20 pièces de pagnes auprès des fournisseurs de Bamako. Elle effectue sa vente en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit, dans le marché de Bougouni. 
Avec ce prêt MAMBA D. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
The Teriya (friendship) group from the Badeya association is composed of married women with an average age of 29 and four children each, living in traditional extended families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children and husbands. These women live in the Heremakono-Centre neighborhood in the town of Bougouni (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through business, family and neighborhood ties.

In order to satisfy their customers, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their second group loan and the previous loan has been fully reimbursed.

With this new loan, Mamba D., the group's president, plans to buy a bale of used clothing and 20 lengths of pagne (brightly colored cloth) from the suppliers in Bamako. She sells her goods both retail and wholesale, for cash and credit, in the Bougouni market.

With this loan Mamba D. hopes to make a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA which will be used in their business activities.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Hada Luz

texts.es:
Hada, tiene 32 años de edad, reside en Usulután, se dedica a la venta de ropa, vive sola es soltera madre de una niña de 2 años de edad, trabaja de forma ambulante en los alrededores del mercado municipal de El Transito, actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar ropa, dicho préstamo le dará impulso para que su negocio se vea fortalecido y pueda atender de una mejora manera a los clientes, ofreciéndoles distintas modas y colores en prendas de vestir.
Su sueño es poder obtener un puesto fijo para la venta, aumentar sus clientes, y generar ingresos para ayudar a su hija y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Hada is 32 years old and lives in Usulután.  Her business is selling clothes.  She is a single mother of a 2 year-old daughter and lives alone with her daughter.  She works as an itinerant street vendor around El Transito town market.  She is currently requesting this loan to buy clothes.  This loan will give her business a boost and strengthen it.  It will enable her to better serve her customers, offering them clothes in different styles and colors.

Hada's dream is to obtain a fixed sales location, to increase her number of customers and to make income to help her daughter and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Jessica Consuelo

texts.es:
Jessica Consuelo M. R. tiene 33 años de edad. Vive en unión libre vive con el compañero y con los hijos, vive en el cantón  Ventanas en la Provincia de los ríos. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ESFUERZO Y TRABAJO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Campos Grandes perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

 Jessica se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es llegar a dar una buena educación de los hijos.

Le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Jessica Consuelo M. R. is 33. She is in a common-law marriage and lives with her partner and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. She has 5 children.

The members of the V.R.C. Esfuerzo y Trabajo ["Effort and Work"] are located in the Campos Grandes neighbourhood belonging to the Pueblo Viejo Canton. The members of this bank have long worked in short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Jessica has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for three years. She buys her products in Agripac and sells them in the market in the same area.

She is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural tools and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. In supporting this loan, you will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to give her children a good education.

She enjoys dancing.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Librada

texts.en: Librada R. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Librada owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Librada has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2006, Librada joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Librada has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. Librada is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Librada from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Omar

texts.es: El joven Omar M. M. es un hombre muy emprendedor pues comenta que hace algunos años se quedo sin empleo y su padre le propuso que lo enseñaría a preparar donas  lo logro y  empezó  con la  ventas  de  donas primero con su familia posteriormente  en algunas  tiendas de  su colonia después consiguió un empleo formal pero comenta que el desea su crédito para la compra de un caso de cobre puesto que  ahora combina su trabajo con la  venta de donas ya  que  realiza  su  venta  con  los  mismos  compañeros  de  trabajo.
texts.en: Omar M. M. is an enterprising young man who says that he lost his job a few years ago.  His father proposed to teach him how to make donuts.  He began selling donuts first to family members and later to a few stores in the area.  Afterwards he secured formal employment.  Omar says that he wants this loan to buy a copper pot.  Now he supplements his job by selling donuts to his co-workers.

loans.use: Purchase a copper pot for frying donuts

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Mrs. Yon San and her husband, Mr. Phin Mao, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have five children – three sons and two daughters. Mr. Phin Mao is a flower farmer and drives a motor taxi when he is free. 

Yon previously ran a beauty business from home, but she transferred the business to her daughters.  She now assists her husband in the farming business.  She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional farmland.

loans.use: To purchase additional farmland

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang T. N. is 33 years old with one child, who attends high school.  Being a farmer, her main activities are growing rice and vegetables and raising chickens.  

After a divorce in 2008, she has had to work more in order to provide a good education for her child. She has increased the numbers of paddies to grow more kinds of vegetables so she can earn a stable income to support her family. 

Participating in our credit program since 2009, she has been a good re-payer and used loans effectively to develop her farming. Currently, she wants a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy food and fertilizer for chickens and rice.

loans.use: to buy  food and fertilizer for chickens and rice.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 56 years old and married with six children. Amparo works very hard to provide for them.

Amparo runs a buying and selling of spices business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spices to sell.

Amparo has been in this business for 26 years and sells a variety of items such as onions, garlic, tomatoes etc. Amparo also earns income from renting a chainsaw. 

In the future, Amparo would like to finish her house.

loans.use: To purchase spices to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen K. M.  is 24 years old, married to Faith Mutindi and does not have children. He has been running a retail shop in Tala town, making an income of 10,000 KES. He learned about Kiva partner, KADET, through group members registered with KADET, and he is applying for his first loan, which he will use to purchase more stock for the shop such as cooking oil, flour, sugar, tea leaves and sweets for resale. Stephen intends to use the anticipated profits to save and plow back into his business. In the future, he plans to grow his business and become stable financially.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as cooking oil, flour, sugar, tea leaves and sweets

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive la señora Haydee C. que tiene 29 años, estudio solo la secundaria y esta casada con el señor jesus con el cual tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos asisten a la escuela en su comunidad.
Doña Haydee nos platica que hace mas de un año inicio a trabajar en la venta de ropa interior para dama y perfumeria por catalogo con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ella decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que deseaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastas del hogar y los estudios de sus pequeños hijos.
Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de catalogos, ropa y perfumeria para su posterior venta.
Ella nos platica que desea que cada dia su negocio prospera ya que desea darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y que en un futuro tengan una profecion.
Ella se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion por el credito que le ha otorgado ya que con esta prestamo tendra la oportunidad para que su negocio cresca.
texts.en:
The community of Arroyo de Pita is located in the state of Oaxaca, and is characterized as being the only one with a high school within various kilometers.  Haydee C., age 29, lives in this community, but only studied to junior high school.  She is married to her husband named Jesus and they have three children who attend the local school.

Haydee tells us that she began selling ladies underclothing and perfumes through a catalog to her friends and neighbors more than a year ago.  She decided to start her own business so that she could help her husband pay the household expenses and support their children.
  
She needs this loan in order to buy catalogs, clothing, and perfumes for resale.  She tells us that her business prospers daily and she wants to give her children a better quality of life and wants them to have professional careers in the future.

She is very grateful to the foundation for the loan.  This will allow her to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Nyamabare_ Tweyimukye Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
Richard M. is the leader of Nyamabare Tweyimukye group in Bushenyi. He is 46 years old and married with six children. Four of them are in school. 

Richard is a teacher by profession offering teaching services to Katerera town council schools. He is also involved in agriculture and sells the produce. One of his future plans is to start up a poultry business. 

He is able to generate 310,000 KES monthly and he needs a loan to be able to pay school fees for his children this term. He is a very hard-working man and hopes for the best for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children this term.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, 43, needs to give a lot of care and attention, since her focus rests not only on her children but also on her piglets—which make up her business. Mary Ann is a high school graduate and is married to Luis, a driver. Together they are raising four children, two of whom are still in school. Their family currently resides in Tanza, Cavite.

Owning a piggery requires a lot of effort and Mary Ann recognizes this. Every day she has to make sure the piglets are given the right nutrition, stay in a good environment, and has the right suitable conditioning. She considers all these factors to make sure the piglets produce well. She also continuously seeks ways to improve the piggery. Mary Ann has been managing this business for 11 years, and makes a net income of around Php11,350 each month.

To help her continue  the operations of her piggery, Mary Ann is requesting a loan for Php 27,000.  She will use this loan to purchase feeds for her piglets and materials to renovate her piggery. Included in the list of items to buy are hollow blocks, cement, and wood. She says that the profits will be used as additional investment in the future. 

One challenge Mary Ann faces is when the pigs get sick.  She is also concerned about her children, as lately they have become disobedient when it comes to attending school. But Mary Ann is maximizing every resource she has at hand to make sure she arrives at the results she wanted. She dreams of becoming prosperous and raising her piggery to the next level. Of course, it is also her dream to see her children finish their education and have a career of their own someday, because the bottom line is that she cares and loves her children most. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy hog feed & vitamins and materials to renovate her piggery

loans.name: Ivonne Cecilia

texts.es: Ivonne Cecilia tiene 59 años, su actividad es la venta y elaboración de comida. Tiene más de 25 años que tiene este negocio, es una persona muy responsable y a pesar de su edad mantiene una gran alegría cuando recibe a sus clientes. Uno de sus mayores desafíos es su salud pues muchas veces tiene que levantarse temprano para empezar su actividad económica. El motivo del crédito es para la compra arroz, frijoles, aceite, repollo, maduro, platos desechables y cubiertos.
texts.en: Ivonne Cecilia is 59 years old. Her business is the preparation and sale of food. She has had this business for more than 25 years. She is a very responsible person, and in spite of her age she keeps up great cheerfulness when she receives her customers. One of her greatest challenges is her health, since she often has to get up early to begin her business activities. The purpose of the loan is to buy rice, beans, oil, cabbage, plantains,  disposable plates and utensils.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, cabbage, plantains, disposable plates and utensils

loans.name: Aurelia Nely

texts.es:
Aurelia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, es   conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió hasta 5to de primaria. 
Junto a su esposo se dedica  a la compra y venta de animales como ovejas alpacas.  Desde hace un año trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Su primer préstamo solicitado fue por S/. 500.00 nuevo soles,  dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, comprará diez unidades de ganados: ovejas y alpacas para su respectivo engorde  por cuatro meses para luego venderlos a buen precio.
Su sueño es seguir con los animales y así mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, las charlas y las ganancias de sus ahorros. 
Debido al intenso sol la fotografía presenta problemas de nitidéz.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Concepción” which is located in the village of Ayrumas Carumas in the District of Acora, Province and Department of Puno. She is 25 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children. Aurelia has a fifth-grade education.

Together with her husband, Aurelia buys and sells animals such as sheep and alpacas. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for one year. The first loan she requested was in the amount of 500 PEN and invested in her business.

With this new loan of 2000 PEN, Aurelia will buy 10 heads of livestock, including sheep and alpacas. She will fatten these animals for four months before selling them at a good price. Her dream is to continue raising animals so that she can improve her income. What she enjoys about her Communal Bank are the meetings, the seminars, and the interest she earns from her savings.

The photo of Aurelia did not turn out as clear due to the intense sunlight.

loans.use: to purchase 10 heads of livestock, including sheep and alpaca.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 30-year-old married man with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail business for 10 years. He got his start-up capital from selling yellow bananas and firewood. His hardship is high commodity prices and his vision is a bigger retail shop plus a better future. Stephen needs the loan to buy a weighing machine and cassava flour.

loans.use: To buy a weighing machine and cassava flour

loans.name: 54 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs T. has a retail business selling medication. She is requesting a loan to purchase medicine to resell.

T. is 58 years old and is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.
T. is the group leader of the 54 Thieu Do solidarity group which consists of 4 members. 

This is T.'s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
T. has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that T. faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, T. hopes to be abL. to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, to remodel her house and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase medicine to resell

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 42 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Cheryl has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Cheryl aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Slylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a 41-year-old single mother of five children, living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her family dream is to educate her children. She has been selling bags and used shoes for ten years and with the proceeds she has been able to build a house for herself. Her major challenge has been limited stock due to inadequate capital and her dream is a fashion house. 

Sylvia needs a loan to buy used bags and shoes for resale.

loans.use: To buy used bags and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is 40 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has four children; all of his children are currently in school. Saidi has a business of leather products, like suitcases and bags, which he has had for six years.         
	
To help expand his business, Saidi has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase leather products like suitcases and bags for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Saidi hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Saidi hopes to construct rental houses to get more money to support his family. 

Saidi is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase leather products like suitcases and bags for resale.

loans.name: Elie

texts.en: Elie is a 50-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two children. Over the years, he has earned good experience working as a home painter. He has been involved in this type of business for the past 25 years. He started running his own business in 1991. He works on a freelance basis. His income is very important as he is the main income source of the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional paints and tools for a new project. He needs to be prepared to satisfy the customers' demands. In the future, he hopes to continue the growth of his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional paint and tools for a new project

loans.name: Bihija

texts.en:
Bihija is a single woman with two school-going children. She owns a house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and her children's school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 45-year-old divorced man from Lebanon. He is living with one parent and three siblings. He opened a vegetable shop in 1990. In addition, he has prepared a corner where he sells fruit. Like the majority of the Lebanese men, he helps his family with the household expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added vegetables and fruit to sell. He will also use the loan to improve his shop’s decoration. In the future, he plans to open a juice shop.

loans.use: to purchase added vegetables and fruit to sell and improve his shop’s decoration.

loans.name: Prok

texts.en:
Prok (in the photo), 37, is a cleaner for a company. He has a young son and lives in a village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. His wife is also a cleaner with him. 

Prok is asking for his first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to get work.

loans.name: Isidora Narcisa

texts.es:
Isidora  es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa D. Lima”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia D. Chucuito y departamento D. Puno, tiene 57  años D. edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos independientes.  Cuenta con educación primaria (incompleto).
Su primer préstamo otorgado por el Movimiento Manuela Ramos fue por la suma D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. comidas.  Nos cuenta que también  venD.  ropas en la ciudad D. Puno.
Solicitara un nuevo préstamo por la suma D. S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, con el cual comprará ropas como mantas, chompas, llicllas y ponchos. 
La señora desea seguir con el negocio y mejorar sus ventas.  Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, el ahorro y las utilidades generadas por el ahorro.
texts.en: Isidora is a member of the 'Santa Rosa D. Lima' community bank which is located in Juli district, in Chucuito province, in Puno department. She is 57 years old, married, and has four children who live independently. She did not complete her primary education. Isidora's first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos was for 300 soles and she invested that money in her food business. She tells us that she also sells clothing in the city of Puno. Isidora will request a new loan for 500 soles to buy clothing such as sweaters, ponchos, mantas and llicllas (traditional squares of woven cloth that are worn as shawls or used for carrying children on your back). Isidora would like to continue in her business and improve her sales. What she likes about her community bank is the ease of the loans, the savings and the interest she makes on her savings.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, mantas, llicllas and ponchos

loans.name: Karimeh

texts.en: Karimeh is a 61-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. Despite her older age, she has been working as a farmer for the past 20 years. She is specialized in cultivating vegetables according to the season. She works hard in collaboration with her husband to provide better living conditions to the family.  Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase fertilizers and seeds to increase her business productivity and help her harvested products grow faster. In the future, she plans to hire a part-time employee to work on her behalf.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds to increase her business productivity and help her harvested products grow faster

loans.name: Omar

texts.ru:
Омар 50-летний фермер, живущий в с .Учкун. Имеет троих детей, жена работает учителем в местной школе.  С 1981 года семья Омара успешно занимается разведением скота и полеводством. Начав с приобретения одной коровы, Омар смог  увеличить поголовье до четырех коров и пяти баранов, а также у него имеются 2,5 тонны кукурузы для последующей продажи. Доходы от такой бизнес - деятельности  позволили Омару приобрести машину для своей семьи.  
 Для дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Омар обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для покупки дойной коровы. Планируемую прибыль Омар намерен использовать для постройки нового сарая в целях обеспечения хороших условий для содержания скота.
texts.en: Omar is 50 year-old farmer, who lives in the Uchkun village.  He has three children, and his wife works as a teacher at the local school.  Since 1981, Omar's family has been successfully involved in breeding livestock and farming.  Having started with a purchase of one cow, Omar was able to grow the livestock headcount to four cows and five sheep.  He also has 2.5 tons of corn for the next sale.  Profits from this business allowed Omar to buy a car for his family.  In order to further increase livestock headcount, Omar requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase a dairy cow.  He intends to use the planned profit to build a new barn in order to provide good conditions for keeping livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is 41 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She is in the transport business, and has been in it for the last three years with a monthly profit of about KES 9,000. 

She  was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of KES 21,000 from the company. She plans to use part of the loan to service her motorcycle, and part to open up a small cafe in Ganda in Malindi town. 

She will save the anticipated profit to help take care of her children. In future, Hidaya hopes to grow her businesses and be financially stable.

loans.use: To service her motorcycle and open up a small cafe.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, 44, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a rice trader. Her husband is a farmer. Two of her children are employed overseas; her son works as construction worker in Thailand and her daughter works as homemaker in Malaysia. 

Sokha requests a loan of USD 1000 to purchase rice to store in a warehouse to sell when the price is higher. By doing so, she can make more profit than usual.

In the future, she would like to run a rice store at home, build a new house, and support her children to study the Korean language in order to find a job in Korea.

loans.use: to purchase rice to store in a warehouse to sell when the price is higher.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a mother of five children, three of whom are still of school-going age. She has been in poultry farming for five solid years, with her poultry going to the local market.

Pauline has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow for a venture into dairy farming. She plans to have five dairy cows in the future in order to enjoy the economies of scale and be among the major suppliers for the local market. 

She states that the major challenge remains animal diseases.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is a 48-year-old woman. She is single and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Ly earns an income by sewing clothing. She has done this for eight years. 

Ly would like to take out a loan to buy sewing materials and fabrics. This will increase her productive capacity and allow her to create a larger amount of clothing. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and set aside some savings for her family.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and fabrics.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 36-year-old mixed crop farmer, married to David who is a dairy farmer, and they are blessed with three children. She has been in the farming business for the past three years with the monthly income of about KES 10,500, which she uses to support her family.  

She is applying for her third loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Mary will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

She hopes to start a poultry farm on a large scale in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.
